Title: Study OF the Chinese Bank`s NPL
Abstract: At the condition of market economy, finance is the main fashion of resource configuration. So Marx and Engels had mentioned the impact of first and last impetus and bank's credit to the development of social economy several times in Theses on Feurbach and so on. Lenin also discussed the core status and impact of bank in modern economy, he emphasized "Bank is the core of modern economy, and is the nerve in all capitalism country's economic system". Mr. Deng Xiaoping also gradually augmented that finance is the core of modern economy in practice and work for ages. He appointed that "Finance is very important, is the core of modern economy. If finance is good and alive that all will be alive." Financial system arrangement must accord to the development of economy, adapt to the requirement of the economy's development, which will efficiently achieve resource configuration best. It is all countries' chasing goal to attain Pareto efficiency. China is out of exception. The development of finance and the structure of credit influence the speed and structure of economic development. It is a very important aspect of building market economy to build modern financial system and construct financial resource configuration mechanism adapting to market economy. The financial domain of china has suffered a series of important and profound innovation since 1970s. China has transformed singular bank of planning economy into kinds of finance passing by reformation and opening for more than 20 years, built and owned a very big bank groups. In the same developing level country, we can say that no one can compare with china in the rate of loan quantity to entire economy. However, we must clearly recognize that the bank system in china is very vulnerable, in which the worried by people is the non-performing loan in bank whose quantity is surprised. Resolve mal-loan problem is much more important to Chinese economic system and decides Chinese economy healthy development or not. According to some specialists, the current financing feature in china resembles to Thailand before financial crisis on some degree, Chinese financing is up to the dangerous. The success to the finance system or not relations to the development of the nation's economic and benefit of every family. Distinctly, Chinese government has recognized the dangers. Finance reforming battle has been starting off. This paper applies Marxist rationale to describe bank's beneficial capital character and effect, expounds primary aim of dealing in banks is to achieve capital increasing, introduces bank facing with kinds of danger, looks back the Chinese financial regimentation' transition, particular to bank. The paper analyses the defect of bank regimentation arrangement in china and all kinds of drawback leading by authority regimentation, describes and analyzes bank's non-performing loan phenomenon and reasons. At the same time, this paper analyses and introduces foreign bank experience to deal with non-performing loan, discusses how to resolve non-performing loan of Chinese banks, and gives the project to reform finance profundity. In economic theory, this paper exerts some theories such as political economics, regime economics, development economics, authority economics, financing, calculation economics, tries to incorporate actuality to provide some better resolving projects for defending and dealing with financial non-performing loan in the procedure of economy transferring of china. This paper is divided into seven chapters, and puts forward own standpoint with suggest thinking from the Marx respectively the reputation theories, non-performing loan operating characters, Chinese banks regimentation arrangement and transition since 1949, Chinese banks non-performing loan's actual state and reasons, the effect of government's will in, the process of the non-performing loan foreign bank experience and lessons to deal with non-performing loan, the countermeasure to resolve non-performing loan problems, and etc. Chapter 1, reputation theories of Marx thinking and bank's property manage. This chapter uses the Reputation theories of Marx thinking to study capital, reputation and bank property managing. In Marx thought extensive work, have to expatiate thoroughly with the reputation mechanism to the capital movement with the argument, and became the ownership of the original theories system in his work. Marx considered, under the economic term in merchandise, every kind of main factors for needing when the merchandise is engaged in the production operates, must pass the market use the way that wait the price commutation then can acquire. For this, any merchandise production that be engaged in the person operates the activity must hold the capital of the certain quantity. Capital that has no certain quantity, can't obtain any kind of main factor that be engaged in the production, and then can't be engaged in the production. Marx got a conclusion for below after analyzed the general trend of capital resources presented in the process of economic development: The first, the capital total amount has continuously enlarging trend. The second, the capital's constant part presents increasing increases trend when compared with variable part. The third, capital ownership and operating power present continuously separated trend. The fourth, the ownership of one's own capital or borrow have the trend to separate from the talent of managing labor. The fifth, the capital quantity in conjecture presents more and more increasing trend. According to these trend, Marx emphasized the reputation system, especially the function of the bank credit, it overcame the localization of the business reputation, no longer restricted by the capital quantity and the capital reflux or fly to of individual capitalist, thereby extended the scope of the reputation, adapt to the demand that capitalism produce, complement and perfect economic movement in capitalism mechanism. With the theoretical research on the reputation for Marx thinking theories, we can thorough understand the living capital, interest, bank, conjecture capital, two powers separate, the extensive problem of the international money flow in the domestic system and reputation system. Then deepen the necessity cognition of establishing the financial system in socialism adapting to the market economy regulation. In this chapter, for the sake of the clear definition of non-performing loan, according to the currency bank theories and finance, we also discuss the modern bank operating mechanism and kinds of risks and endanger in bank operating .Try to let the reader understand the bank have the high risk characteristic, in its management must try to avoid every kind of risk. But the non-performing loan of the bank is the decreasing risk factor in commercial bank's steady management and development. Chapter 2, bank arrangement and change since 1949.This chapter primarily looks back the system arrangement of the Chinese banks and its change since 1949 the People's Republic of China established. Introduces before the 1979 reformation opens, under the planned economy system the frame of the Chinese bank system and function. Specially points out the business characteristics of the Chinese bank in this period: First, credit business highly concentrates in people bank system; Second, savings that all levels bank absorb all ascend to the head office. The loan that all levels bank issue is decided by the head office, strictly issue according to the plan, the grass-roots bank can't use the built-up savings without authorization, can't agree to the loan of the business enterprise. Describe the relation between public finance and the bank's and their position. Then understand under the planned economy system, bank is not the primarily section of funds and resources arrangement, is only a fiscal accountancy and cashier. The position of the bank has been profound influenced on Chinese bank arrangement later. At the same time, in this chapter detailed describes the process of Chinese financial reformation since the reformation open, and the success and experience precept obtained at different periods. Chapter 3, presents condition of non-performing loan in Chinese banks and its influence. A flood of data in this application data was detailed to introduce the Chinese banks face seriously non-performing loan condition. And analyzed the influence on the bank's operating and economy development. Points out the Chinese bank system still can't get away from the harassment of the property quantity up to now, the earnings level is low and have not enough capital ample ratio. If the non-performing loan continues rampant and cannot to control, can't availably resolve the non-performing loan problem of the bank, will bring serious negative influence to financial system and business enterprise or other economic system. But once Chinese banks occurrence crisis, will strike in China economic so larger compare to the other the nation. Chapter 4, analyses the cause of non-performing loan in Chinese banks. From five aspects, this chapter detailed analyzes the reason of non-performing loan in Chinese banks becoming and quantity residing highly. Using the standpoints of the power theories, system economics theories, agency theories and other western economics in etc. this chapter process the thorough meticulous analysis to the formation reason of the non-performing loan and study from points of view. Through the superficial phenomenon of the non-performing loan, analyze the Chinese banking produce power system arrangement, government bank's agency relation, and the blemish on the bank managing construction. It was in many respects to put forward the original views in personally. Chapter 5, explains the relation of government’s will and non-performing loan formation. This chapter emphasizes to point out in the non-performing loan formation reasons of Chinese banking, in addition to the reasons of the power system, entrust agency conflicting, the management construction and social reputation environment mentioned in chapter 4, on a certain extent still under the influence of government behavior. Governmental policy target claim and interfere with bank operating are important reason that the non-performing loan formation of Chinese banking. Therefore, though it can also induce into the Chinese banking non-performing loan formation, writer still list the government behavior relates to with the cause and effecting that non-performing loan formation the conduct and actions alone of a chapter. As the biggest shareholder of the Chinese bank system, government though hope that the management of the bank can bring the larger income, but do not hope the capital run off because of the non-performing loan, even do not hope the crisis of the bank system cause economic crisis and even governmental political crisis. But because of long-term planned economy formation of the path depends and the government target of diverse and limited tenure in official in government, government behavior under the system that is not a complete market and interfere to the bank system, is an important reason that banking non-performing loan formation. Chapter 6, experience and teach of abroad non-performing loan handling. In this chapter, by a flood of abroad source, as the mother country of modern banking, western national bank system though sounder, management norm and laws of sound both already to equal extent, these national banks are not from the first to have the good management construction and operating method, the bank also has many acutely painful lesson in its development process, backlog abundant experience, these experiences and teach deserve us draw lessons from. Also introduces the foreign country concrete measure of handling the non-performing loan. Though the background of all countries non-performing loan formation is different, dealing methods are different, but all have common place: First, its core contents is all to separates non-performing loan management with the good property, down price to sell, the purpose is to digest these non-performing loan as soon as possible. Second, all established the organization to handle the non-performing loan. In fact the quality is a bridge for currency property and real object property. Third, is all to cooperate between banks with government well and effectively, by the way the market and administration can solve the problems of non-performing loan. Chapter 7, explains the countermeasure for defending and dissolving the non-performing loan problem of Chinese banks. This chapter commences the spring of non-performing loan formation begins, setting out from the Chinese state of the nation, aiming at the present condition of the non-performing loan and the Chinese banking reformation trend. Putting forward the non-performing loan defending and dissolving, needing to adopt the way that specimen concurrently cure, at digesting the current non-performing loan, deepening the financial system reformation, making the bank establish the perfect company management mechanism, at the same time establishing its kit matches the laws of the market economy regulation, creating good market environment, make the bank become the propose of the real independent market corpus. Proceed the reformation in all aspects, the acquisition breaks in laws and the kit of the power system, promoting the bank oneself win the benefit ability, realizing the target of the management that profits maximize, then attain the purpose of digesting the exist non-performing loan and avoid large quantity new non-performing loan creation. Among them, concerning the power construction, perfect company management and sound market environment, all have the realistic meaning.

Title: A STUDY ON TOURISM CREDIT
Abstract: Tourism industry plays an important role in developing economy in our country and is becoming the pillar and a new point of economic growth in our civil economy. In real life, a crisis about tourism credit has showed, especially credit lack of tourism enterprises has caused a lot of appeal and thus restricting tourism development of our country healthily. The problem of tourism credit has aroused the whole society and managing department related to pay great attention to it. The national tourism bureau advances we should push construction of trust in tourism and design a frame of tourism credit system as soon as possible. In practice, some regional managing departments and guilds in tourism have begun to build credit system of tourism enterprise. Few scholars have discussed it as well. As a whole, the study on the problem is in an initial stage and lacks an in-depth academic study. So, the problem has become a new task that needs to research it urgently. It not only can provides theoretic foundation and actual guidance and thus improves the international competitive force of tourism industry in our country, but also can help to enhance moral level of whole society and shape a well social fashion, and to accelerate a era of credit economy to come and build a harmonious society. Therefore, the study has an important theoretic meaning and a practical significance. The analyzing process follows common rules of economics that puts forward a problem and then analyzes it and solves it. On the basis of credit theories, the paper first studies some basic general situation about tourism credit, and then stresses analyses on actions of the government, enterprise and individual that include defining on their action boundaries, behavior of credit lack and causes of credit lack. Finally, the paper puts forward countermeasures solving the problem of tourism credit, namely, construction of system of tourism credit. The structure and contents of the paper are as follows. Chapter 1 is about the origin of theory on tourism credit. The study on tourism credit is part of social credit system and it roots in credit study. The paper hackles some credit theories that relate to tourism credit. These theories include Marks’ theories such as credit and credit relation, commercial credit and bank credit and credit system, the traditional credit theories in the western countries such as credit agent theory, credit creation theory and credit adjustment theory, and the modern credit theories such as non-symmetrical information theory, dealing cost theory and game theory, and so on. They establish bases for study on tourism credit. Chapter 2 is a conspectus on tourism credit. In order to build a frame of study on tourism credit, the paper undertakes researches on some basic general situation, for example, concept defining of tourism credit and its characteristic and its types, and tourism credit system. It is an analysis on credit actions of the main body of tourism credit from chapter 3 to chapter 5. Credit action is an action that people behave in economic company according to the principles and demands and criterion of credit, including possession and acceptance and performance of right. So, to a great extent, analyses of credit are analyses of credit action. The main body of tourism credit includes tourism enterprise and tourism individual and the government. Because tourism industry possesses characteristics of strong all-around property, bigger associated degree and vast involved aspects, credit action of the main body of tourism credit are more complex than the others. For instance, tourism enterprises credit include various enterprises such as travel agency, hotel, tourism traffic, tourism shop and scenic spots; individual credit include both practitioners credit and tourists credit. Various main bodies of tourism credit act differently, so we need to study them deeply. The paper anatomizes their credit actions in detail applying to some theories of economy and tourism science. Chapter 3 is a study on government credit of tourism. Government credit of tourism is the key in tourism credit system and has a demonstrating effect. Its credit depends on its function. If the functions of the government define dully, the government lacks credit easily. So, first, the paper defines the functions and action boundaries of the government in developing tourism in a great deal sections, and then the paper analyzes various credit problems of the government applying some economic theories. For instance, the policies of tourism are random and dark, its deeds are unfair and inequity, its deeds depend on official will, and its deeds take on a trend of seeking economic profits and a ism of regional protection causes credit lack. Eventually the paper discusses causes of credit lack of the government. The causes sum up as follows: there existed limitations of system in the period of transition in China, the functions of the government have produced dissimilation, a phenomenon called district economy results in credit lack of the government, the government itself looks after profits, and lawful restrictions intenerate and system construction lags in our country. Chapter 4 is a study on enterprise credit of tourism. As a main part of economic movement of tourism, credit actions of tourism enterprises become the main body of tourism credit naturally. Among whole system of tourism credit, credit of tourism enterprise is crucial. Credit actions of tourism enterprise are manifested by the actions of price, sales promotion, service and competition. In tourism market, credit lacks of the enterprises in China include payment in arrears, various credit lacks such as tourism contract bargaining, quality of service, shopping, capital, sales promotion and price, and counterfeit. The factors of credit lack of the enterprises include the factors of system, market, information, culture, management and law, and so on. Chapter 5 is a study on individual credit tourism. Individual credit of tourism is a base among tourism credit system. The chapter includes two parts. Part one studies credit action, credit lack behavior and causes of credit lack of individual credit tourism. Part two discusses development of consumption credit of tourism. Chapter 6 is a study on construction of credit system of tourism. To solve tourism credit lack, the key is to build a system of tourism credit. On the basis of experience about construction of credit system in developed countries and other callings in our country, combined characteristics of tourism itself, the paper undertakes a study how to build tourism credit system. They include both construction of ethics criterion and the lawful environments in macro-lay and credit system construction of tourism enterprise, tourism individual and the government in micro-lay. The main conclusions of the paper are as follows:1、We should build moral standard of tourism credit from these aspects of increasing effective supply of system, doing well moral construction of the officials, doing well public moral construction of society, strengthening professional moral construction of tourism, and shaping a criterion of club. 2、A lawful system construction of tourism credit includes legislation and executing the law of credit and establishing a punishment mechanism for credit lack. 3、Countermeasures on building credit system of tourism enterprise in our country include establishing system of property right, credit evaluation, credit management, credit encouragement and punishment and proclamation, and credit culture, and bringing into play function of guild. 4、Countermeasures on building credit system of tourism individual include creating a nicer surrounding of social credit, building system of evaluation and management of individual credit and strengthening education.5、Countermeasures on building government credit include changing its function, standardizing its actions, changing its concept of credit, promoting moral making and administrative level of the officials, making evaluation system more perfect, building self-contained law system, and bringing into play function of guild. On the basis of absorbing the former fruit, innovative points of the paper are as follows: Firstly, a study thinking of combining different subject. As the study on tourism credit is a new field combined economics and tourism science, the paper studies it using a method combined different subject. Secondly, putting forward a new concept. Based on concept of credit, the paper puts forwards concept of tourism credit from the angle of broad sense and researches it roundly. Thirdly, establishing a system of tourism credit that includes enterprise, individual and the government. In the system, individual credit is a base, enterprise credit is a center, and government credit is a core and key. Fourthly, defining action boundaries of government credit of tourism. There have been a lot of disposals at all times about the function of the government in developing tourism. The paper considers that its main functions are macro-management, harmony and supervision and service at present according to the situation of our country. Namely, action boundaries of the government are limited to the following aspects: cultivating perfect system of tourism market, eliminating exterior non-economy, keeping competition and opposing monopoly, providing public products of tourism, rectifying non-symmetrical information of tourism, establishing and performing tourism law, and carrying out tourism regulations. Fifthly, building evaluation system of tourism enterprise. Sixthly, the paper carries through study on individual credit of tourism from the angle of moral credit and capital credit. The paper needs to study problems in-depth: 1.To analyze the problem in-depth by applying a method of game theory. 2. Taking a tourism city as an example, to build a more perfect and strong operational evaluation system on enterprise and individual of tourism, and to spread it all over the country.

Title: The Urban Social Economic Development and the Geographical Environment of Wuhan Since the Opium War
Abstract: The geographical environment puts great influence on the development of urban social economy. On one hand, the geographical environment plays an important role in the formation and development of a city; on the other hand, the social economic activities of human beings constantly convert the geographical environment. The two parts interacts on each other. In Wuhan, the geographical environment influences profoundly on urban modernization construction in the early stage and the modernization construction in 1990s as well as the construction to build up a sustainable development city in a new century. Accordingly, the study of how the geographical environment (especially after the Opium War) has affected the urban social economic development of Wuhan, is of great importance and referential value in the urban economic overall arrangement, the space for development, the construction of ecological environment, the harmony between nature and man, and the realization of sustainable development in the future. In this dissertation, the geographical environment consists of natural geographical environment and humanistic geographical environment. The former refers to the regional characteristics, the regional disintegration and variation, the process of formation and development as well as the rules of changes in the natural environment on the surface of the earth where human beings live. It includes those natural factors such as hydrology, climate, rocks, physiognomy, soil and environment. The latter comprises the social and cultural environment, political environment, economic arrangement environment, population and residence and city environment. The dissertation consists of seven chapters, which are respectively introduced in the following paragraphs. In chapter one I introduce the relationship between the geographical environment and the historical changes of the three towns in Wuhan. From the characteristics of geology, physiognomy, climate, hydrology and land structure as well as the geographical predominance, it is concluded that the natural geographical environment in Wuhan is generally composed of plains accounting for 40%, ridges and hummock 40%, hilly areas 0.5% and mountainous areas 0.5%. What is more, there exist rainy seasons with the high temperature, mass rainfall, low-lying terrains, many rivers and lakes in the city proper, frequent flood and watercourse changes. All these above greatly influence and restrict the formation and development of the three towns in Wuhan. Because of the geographical situation that Wuchang and Hanyang are situated at the hilly and mountainous areas and beside Yangtze River, the two towns are the earliest to be built up and become critical military towns and later commercial centers. The transfer of the commercial center afterwards is closely related with the up and downs of Shazhou river area of Yangtze River. The change of Han River watercourse causes the buildup of Hankou. Han River changes its watercourse from the south of Guishan Mountain and winds its way northwards, so that Hankou is separated from Hanyang. Commercial ships swarm there and Hankou develops to become an independent town. This chapter also analyzes and remarks on how those favorable conditions such as the central location, the link to the sea by way of rivers and the vast central region have benefited the development of Wuhan. In chapter two I analyze the influence of the geographical environment upon the construction and development of Wuhan. Because of the mass rainfall and the brooky rivers and lakes, flood becomes the greatest threat to its development. Therefore, damming, restoring the dykes, earth filling and groundwork building must be the steady steps in the urban construction to safeguard the living environment of the city. This chapter expatiates the influence of several major damming constructions in the history upon the development of Wuhan and the improvement of the city functions. Hanzheng Street comes into being alongside the river with the change of Hanshui River watercourse. It expands gradually and turns into the earliest commercial center and the collecting and distributing trade center of land and water in Hankou. As the change of the major watercourse of Yangtze River and the evolvement of Jiangxinzhou river area transform the ports in Wuhan, the industrial overall arrangement is accordingly modified and the economic center transferred. Focusing on the effect on the changes of Wuhan ports by the up and downs of Parrot river area and Liugong river area, the change of Han River watercourse and the formation of Tianxing river area, this chapter points out that in different historical periods, the natural geographical environment has bigger or smaller effects on the development of Wuhan city with social economic progresses. In chapter three I discuss the influence on urban development brought by the first opening of Yangtze River-side areas and the ports in Hankou in 1860s. Firstly, this chapter analyses the natural geographical factors and the humanistic geographical factors of Wuhan, such as convenient transportation, the link to the sea by way of rivers, vast central region and prosperous commerce and the influence on the ports opening by the rather complete built-up dam constructions. Secondly, this chapter discusses that the opening of ports brings about a great many foreign investments and changes the economic and trade structure in Wuhan, so that this city turns from a feudalistic town into a semi- colonial and semi- feudalistic modern city. After the opening of the ports, the emergence of concessions has two facets. On one hand, it is invasive; on the other hand, it changes the economic character in Wuhan. Thirdly, this chapter studies the geographical factor that the built-up Lugou Bridge-to-Wuhan Railway turns Wuhan into a center of Westernization Movement. The main reason is that Henan and Hubei province are located in the central region of China and Lugou Bridge-to-Wuhan railway is useful for developing the resources in the midland as well as linking to the shipping in Yangtze River and making full use of military transport of railways. The buildup of Lugou Bridge-to-Wuhan railway improves the overall arrangement of modern iron and steel industry, military industry, mechanical industry and textile industry. The development of foreign enterprises and westernized enterprises bring along the development of the national industry and commerce, and then change the economic structure and ownership structure in Wuhan. Therefore, the structure of pluralized-economic development comes into being with the co-existence of foreign enterprises, state-owned enterprises and individually-run enterprises. All these enforce the economic strength and enhance the economic geographical advantage in Wuhan. In chapter four, I discuss the influences of geographical situation on neoteric Wuhan to become the political center of the country. Since the Opium War, Wuhan has begun to play an important role in several momentous transformations in Chinese modern history and become the political center several times. Except for the political and economic factors, geographical situation also has a considerable effect. The success of the first uprising in Wuchang of The Revolution of 1911(the Chinese Bourgeois Democratic Revolution) is tightly related to the terrain features as well as the important district position of Wuchang: situated on Yangtze River in the west side, Wuchang has a low and plain landform crossed with hills, rivers and lakes, which actually made no key posts in military actions and provides the favorable conditions for the first uprising in Wuchang to succeed; the Lugou bridge-to-Wuhan Railway being open to traffic and the development of neoteric Wuhan industry and commerce laid material foundations for The Revolution of 1911; being for long a territorial political center, Wuchang was provided with the humanistic and social environment for the success of the first uprising in Wuchang. In this chapter, I expatiate on both the reconstruction of Wuhan after The Revolution of 1911 and Dr. Sun Yat-sen’s tentative plan of the modernization of urban Wuhan, which gives prominence to Wuhan’s geographical predominance and shows its significant status in the whole country. Also, I make detailed analysis on the geographical background both when the Nationalist Government established Wuhan as the capital of the state after The Revolution of 1911 and during the Wuhan Battle in the Anti-Japanese War, and hence the social、economic influences that were brought about upon Wuhan. In chapter five, I further analyze the influence of the geographical environment in the mid Republic of China (1912-1949) upon the social economic development of Wuhan. From the aspects of analyzing natural resource conditions and city humanistic environment, I discuss the factors that caused the fall of Wuhan external trade in the 1930s, also do I probe into the geographical factors which made Wuhan a transfer station for the national industry to move into the hinterland in the Anti-Japanese War period. In chapter six, I place emphasis on analyzing the interaction between geographical environment and the economic development of Wuhan during the period from the foundation of P.R.C to 1980s. From the first “five-year plan” to the fifth one, by reason of its geographical location (in the middle part of the country), convenient transportation and its rich water resources, Wuhan has become a heavy industrial city in the strategic constructions of the country, and it has built a large group of key industrial enterprises and inaugurates a block of industrial zones. The constructions of bridges and embankments not only change the separated pattern of the three towns but also improve the internal environment of urban development, meantime the construction of the embanking and cultivating project around the East West Lake build a new pattern of urban industry overall arrangement. In the same period, as the result of practicing single planned economy, the effect of Wuhan’s geographical predominance on its role as a financial and commercial center is artificially weakened. In the early 80s, when the state put into practice the strategy of opening the coastal cities, Wuhan re-examined and gave full play of its geographical predominance, established a strategy of “The Two Communications” which had transport and circulation as its breakthrough points, thus it resumed its central role in transportation and trade in the middle part of the country. In chapter seven, I further elaborate on the great influence that the strategy of opening the riverside in the 1990s has brought upon the urban development of Wuhan. Advantaged by this opening, Wuhan has stepped out from an inland city towards a modernized and internationalized city, and with the further prominence of its geographic geographical predominance as connecting nine provinces as well as the sea, Wuhan has again become a focal point of foreign investment, thus came into being the Wuhan East Lake High Technological Development Zone, Wuhan Economic and Technological Development Zone (Zhuankou) and Wujiashan Taiwan Merchants Investment Zone (East West Lake). Great changes have taken place in the economic structure of Wuhan: from the traditional structure with heavy industry、chemistry and textile as the principle parts, to the new structure mainly with steel、automobile、electromechanical and new material industries; foreign enterprises have played an important role in promoting the industrial structure. The Three Gorges Project changed the geographic environment for the development of Wuhan: in one hand, it strengthened Wuhan’s capability of flood control, promoted its level of flood control, brought forth formidable electric power and augmented its traffic and transportation capacity; in the other hand, it brought along the development of correlative industries. In the late 1990s, as the state actualized the strategy of Grand Exploration of the West, Wuhan showed even more its outstanding geographical predominance and became the transfer station for the industries of eastern area to transfer and for the foreign investments to move into the west. While the urban construction of Wuhan is striding forward towards a scenic garden city sharing the beauty of hills and lakes, the city’s specially characterized natural environment has already exhibited its own value. The conjunction of the two rivers made bridge construction the most critical of all the important urban constructions, hence these bridges became both passages for traffic and transportation and great sights in the riverside and lakeside areas. Densely covered with rivers and lakes and universally intersected with low mountains and hills, Wuhan has the natural conditions to provide material foundation to constructing a scenic garden city with the beauty of hills and lakes. The silt in the northern shore, which was caused by the swaying movement of the mainstream of Yangtze River, offered material source for the construction of river beaches. In concomitance with the entrance into the new century, the geographic environment of Wuhan provide important guarantees for fastening the economic growth, transforming the mode of economic growth and realizing the sustainable development of social economy. To sum up, we can make a general conclusion that, on one hand, the development of Wuhan’s economy depends mainly on its inner economic and social factors; on the other hand, it also benefits from Wuhan’s predominant geographical conditions. Situated by the hills and rivers, prospered by the river conditions, enlarged by the embanking constructions, open and unobstructed by the bridgeworks, beautified by the surrounding lakes, Wuhan has become the financial and commercial center in Central China resorting to its geographical predominance, and it became the scene of the first uprising in the Revolution of 1911 as well as the political center of the Republic of China (1912-1949) resorting to its humanistic conditions and central geographical locations. Wuhan is now facing the opportunities and challenges of the new century, we have the responsibility to carefully learn from the experiences of history developments, fasten the pace of reform and opening to the world, give full play to the geographical predominance, thus build Wuhan into a modernized international metropolis in Central China.

Title: Understand The War News From the Iraqi War
Abstract: This text bases on two basic points: The classical theory of the news dissemination and news report of Iraqi war. On the basis of this, from various angles, such as news, military, politics, economy, culture, etc., it probes into the essence of war news study. In the high-tech war in information age, the news media has already become an important part of war. It has changed its status from an observer and a note-taker into a participant and an assistant. In modern wars, news has already become a kind of war weapon. The increasing combination of War and news is caused by the close relation among war form, social form and propagate form. These three forms have their own important signs, and provide prerequisite of mutual utilization. War news means reports on latest war and interrelated social activities under special war period and statuses of war. The essential feature of war news was taken shape to the contradiction movement by its inherent four. Namely freedom and control, open and secret, true and false, Objective and trend, they blend, permeate and influence each other, maintain close ties each other. Among them, the contradiction of " freedom " and" control" is in power." Freedom " means the dissemination of news, but" control" requires just the opposite. " freedom" and" control", become the core of the news contradiction of the war. The Iraqi war news report shows the community responsibility of media. Among obeying the war and media intuitive knowledge between the two, the journalists are making a difficult choice. Whether the western media under the believe of community responsibility will fall into chaos after the Iraqi war, is a question that needs to be answered. The Iraqi war has a enormous impact on world media industry, it mainly Shows in the following aspects: First, the news competition within the whole world makes a set of famous war journalists enter people's vision; Second, the world propagates pattern has no great changes, Western media's monopoly is broken, many sounds and a pattern of world is taking shape, in the media of a batch of the Arab world and developing countries, there is original behavior; Third, the media function in the war report of the network is gotten apparently, the strength of" the fourth media" begins to have approval. This text thinks, the Iraqi war gives us a warning that under the background of economic globalization, if China wants to win in the global competition of culture, economy, military etc, a long-term strategy of mass media and a strong media battle array should be built.

Title: Aliens en route: european transmigration through britain, 1836-1914
Abstract: This thesis discusses the agencies, transport systems, and infrastructure that enabled more than 3.15 million Europeans to emigrate to the United States, Canada, and South Africa through Britain between 1836 and 1914. Rather than travelling directly from the European mainland, these transmigrants broke their journeys by travelling to Britain where they boarded another vessel that conveyed them across the Atlantic. The control that Britain exerted over both the short-sea and long-haul passenger routes thus involved was as important to British maritime commerce as similar controls over freight or direct long-haul passenger routes to the far-flung corners of the British Empire. However the crucial significance of the transmigrant business to the British merchant marine has been largely overlooked in recent historiography, and it is this lacuna that the present dissertation seeks to redress. The study is split into three sections. The first part quantifies the patterns of the transmigrant business, answering questions such as: what were the origins of the migrants and what routes did they use to reach Britain? When did they come? Where in Britain did they land, where were they bound, and where did they re-embark? Having charted these issues, the thesis turns in the second section to investigate how the transmigrant business developed and evolved, paying particular attention to the factors that conditioned the market throughout the 78 year period. Finally, the thesis examines the significance of the transmigrant business to British ports serving as conduits for the passenger movement, to the companies involved in transporting the aliens, and to the migrants themselves. By exploring these issues this thesis has made a significant contribution to migrant and maritime historiography in the following ways. First, it has broadened the chronological and geographical focus of migrancy back from the 1880s to the 1830s and stressed Scandinavian as well as Central/East European movements. Second, it has demonstrated how European transmigrants were as important to British shipping companies as were British emigrants seeking to settle in Britain's overseas dominions. Third, immigration to Britain has been incorrectly conceptualised because historians and social commentators fail to take account of the onward movement of aliens arriving in Britain and assume instead that most were permanent settlers. Fourth, the primacy of Britain's maritime links to the United States was more important for the passenger business than has been previously acknowledged. Finally, this study disproves theories by immigrant historians that centres of alien settlement across Northern Britain arose because they were situated along the transmigrant corridor between the Humber and Mersey. In reality many of the trains carrying transmigrants never passed through the towns and cities where large-scale immigration took place. By combining a mixture of global, national and local studies, and a longer chronology, this thesis offers an important intersection of transport and maritime studies that shows how transmigration has been under appreciated by both maritime and migrants historians alike.

Title: Remapping women's movements, rethinking feminist politics in South Korea (1980s-1990s): links and tensions between the local, the national, and the global.
Abstract: This research aims to reconstruct feminist politics by exploring the exclusion of local women's experiences within women's movements, which are constructed within the wider national and global context, and by considering how to include them within the feminist politics in South Korea (hereafter Korea). It is based on the case study of women's organisations in Taejon city using feminist oral history interviews, focusing on the transitional period including the authoritarian period (the 1980s) and the democratisation era (the 1990s). The main concerns of this research are: In what ways and contexts are local women's experiences excluded from Korean feminist politics and how to include them. This thesis is a critique as well as a reconstruction. While criticising an exclusive feminist politics based on dichotomous discourse, it suggests possible ways to include local women's experiences within the feminist politics. The inclusion of local women's experiences considers three themes based on feminist citizenship theory: the politicisation of the personal, the politicisation of the local, and the creation of inclusive/transversal politics. Firstly, it explores Korean feminist dichotomous discourse between the new progressive feminist activism and the old conservative non-feminist activism. Current feminist discourse caught in this dichotomy functions to exclude local women's experiences and their activism framed largely under the influence of conservative non-feminist activism. Testimonies of local women disprove this feminist dichotomy and blur the fixed boundaries between feminist and non-feminist groups. Secondly, this thesis examines the social context of local women's exclusion, situating their experiences within the context of development policy at national and global levels. Local women's voices demonstrate that the shifting boundaries between different women's groups are constructed within the context of development policy at both of these levels.

Title: Cross-examining suggestibility: memory, childhood, expertise
Abstract: Initially a central topic for psychology, suggestibility has been forgotten, rediscovered, evaded definition, sabotaged experimentation and persistently triggers epistemological short-circuits when interconnecting psychological questions of memory, childhood and scientificity, with concrete legal issues of child witnesses' credibility, the disclosure of sexual abuse and psychological expertise in courts of law. The aim of this study is to trace suggestibility through history, theory, research and practice, and to explore its efficacy at the intersection of psychology and law, by examining and comparing the. concrete case of child witness practice in England and Germany. Taking a transdisciplinary approach the study draws on two interrelated sources of 'data' combining historical, theoretical and research literature with the analysis of empirical data. A genealogy if theory and research is combined with the results of reflexive interviews, conducted in England and Germany with practitioners from all those professions involved in creating, applying or dealing with knowledge about child witnesses and suggestibility: judges, prosecutors, lawyers, police officers, psychologists (researchers, experts) and social workers. Drawing on the work of G. Deleuze and 1. Stengers this study shows how practical tensions around reliable witnesses, evidence and expertise merge pragmatically with theoretical movements employed to adjust the discipline, thereby causing frictions and voids. In this sense suggestibility provides a liminal resource: It transgresses disciplinary boundaries and pervades pragmatic and theoretical, global and personal, historical and actual considerations, creating voids that allow us to reconsider the pragmatics of change and to redefine the issue of critical impact, as well as to reformulate the problem of child witness practice and children's suggestibility. The study hopes to make a concrete contribution to facilitating the just prosecution of sexual abuse by adding transparency to the complex and at times unhelpfully polarised field of child witness practice. By exploring the 'pragmatics of change' the study furthermore hopes to give an unsettling and productive impetus to theoretical debates within critical approaches to psychology.

Title: In negara kangguru: indonesian organizations in australia
Abstract: The central claim of this thesis is that, transnational movement, and the increasing globalisation of capital and geopolitics notwithstanding, the logic and rhetoric of nation-­states remains a primary point of reference for much lived social experience.  Through an examination of Indonesian organisations in Sydney, Australia, the thesis explores the nature and implications of nationalism in a world increasingly characterised by cross­-border migration.  I show that Indonesian migrants are challenged with negotiating between the twin gravities of Indonesian and Australian national imaginaries.  I trace the relationship expatriate Indonesians form with diplomatic and consular authorities outside national territorial boundaries.  I also take account of the particular bilateral atmosphere following the Bali bombings in October 2002. As a migrant minority in multicultural Australia, Indonesian engagement with the Australian state authorities occurs largely through the language of cultural identity.  Indonesians' participation in such conversations is commonly predicated on state recognition of their coherence as a group, and their consequent difference from others.  Through a series of ethnographic case studies, I examine ways in which the quality of 'lndonesianness', struggling with the discrepancy between ethnos and nation, is expressed through organisational membership, and presented in a broader public sphere.  In so doing, the thesis highlights the tendency in policy contexts to elide and naturalise concepts of 'ethnic group', 'migrant community' and formal organisation.  It argues that more attention should be paid to the internal constitution of migrant organisations, especially given their central role in welfare service provision for marginal groups.  I suggest that a more informed approach to migrant 'micro -politics' requires an understanding of the relationship between organisational structure and forms of national and regional belonging.

Title: An inquiry into the creative process of butoh: with reference to the implications of eastern and western significances
Abstract: This thesis investigates the creative processes of Butoh choreography. A phenomenological perspective is used in this thesis to explore the implications for choreographers of the choreographic options employed in Butoh creative processes. Phenomenology corresponds to the Japanese philosophical context which gave birth to Butoh, elucidating the worldview merging with the universe which underpins Butoh. In terms of phenomenology, merging with the universe is firstly understood as a state of inter-subjectivity or transcendental consciousness, and secondly as the interweaving through actions of individual woridviews and a greater world of shared socio-cultural significances contributed by different people. The inter-subjective relationship between self, other self and objects is used to examine and elucidate the juxtaposition of various kinds of imagery in Butoh. The phenomenological notion of actions is used to examine bodily movement with respect to a greater world in Butoh. Phenomenology particularly corresponds to some of the fundamental processes used by Butoh choreographers. The choreographers' initial options for treating materials, namely visceral sensations as media for merging with the universe, texts as media for perception, paintings as media for presenting images, and actions as building blocks of an inter-subjective world, are inclined to guide the creative processes to develop the manifold of a spiritual imagery and bodily actions. These options and treatments are elucidated in this thesis through the network of perception and the phenomenological notion of graded fulfillment. The choreographer's treatment of the materials requires that the network of perception operates differently for different materials. The results of the operations are then integrated by the choreographer, through a process of graded fulfillment, into a holistic perception of the imagery or into a greater world, of which every image on stage is a part. In contrast the dialectical choreographic options, namely texts as tools for reasoning, paintings as representative structures of the subjects, and actions as representative units of social structure and cultural patterns, are inclined to guide the choreographers towards a focus on the development of formalised postures and gestures. The dialectical options are underpinned by rationalist, sociological or anthropological perspectives. It is argued that both the initial and dialectical options have value. The initial and dialectical options have co-existed and merged over the course of Butoh's development. Through their use different significances are incorporated into dance through the creative processes. Those significances can be identified as mainly rooted in Eastern philosophy, but later expanded to include Western philosophy when Butoh began to develop in a global context. Accordingly, Butoh creative processes are enriched by the use of a variety of choreographic options and by incorporating viewpoints from different people and perspectives.

Title: Devotional islam in kashmir and the british diaspora: the transmission of popular religion from mirpur to lancashire
Abstract: This thesis will explore the underlying dynamics of the religiosity of the Mirpuri Muslim diaspora in Britain.  In Chapter 1 my thesis is located in terms of the literature on religion and diaspora though it is argued that the experience of Mirpuris are somewhat absent from the literature to date.  As well as an account of my qualitative methodology, accounts of the social context of Mirpuris in both rural 'Azad' Jammu and Kashmir and urban Lancashire are given.  It is argued that the religion of the Mirpuris can be characterised mainly in tenus of devotion to the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), the Sufi saints of the major Indian Sufi orders (the Chishtiyya, Qadiriyya and Naqshbandiyya) and their shrines.  In Chapter 2 it is shown how these orders played a key part in the transmission of popular devotional practices such as milad sharif (Prophet's Birthday) and urs sharif (death anniversary of a saint) before the emergence of neo-orthodox reform movements in the nineteenth century.  In Chapter 3 there is a case study of the popular Qadiriyya-Qalandariyya order and its main saints in Mirpur including a description of the shrine of Kharri Sharif.  But what happens to religion when it travels?  This is my concern in the rest of the thesis.  What changes and what remains more or less constant?  In Chapter 4 I examine how the religiosity of the first generation of Mirpuri migrants to Britain was transformed by pirs (saints) and ulama (scholars) in Barelwi mosques which took on a new significance in the diaspora.  In Chapter 5 I examine to what extent these mosques and the Barelwi movement has been successful in transmitting devotional Islam to the second and third generation British-Mirpuri youth.  In Chapter 6 I examine alternatives to the Barelwi.  movement open to young people, from examples of 'anti-Sufi' and 'post-Barelwi' movements, to transnational non-South Asian pirs representing universal Sufism to the persistence of a 'needs-based' kismetic religion which deals with fortune and misfortune.  By way of conclusion I argue that the devotional religion of Mirpur has been increasingly exposed to neo-orthodox criticism in the diaspora and so is being gradually transformed especially amongst the youth.  However, the overall picture is one of plural trends and significant continuity with the past still remains amongst a community which has close diaspora ties to the homeland.

Title: Interactive technologies for the public sphere: toward a theory of critical creative technology
Abstract: Digital media cultural practices continue to address the social, cultural and aesthetic contexts of the global information economy, perhaps better called ecology, by inventing new methods and genres that encourage interactive engagement, collaboration, exploration and learning. The theoretical framework for creative critical technology evolved from the confluence of the arts, human computer interaction, and critical theories of technology. Molding this nascent theoretical framework from these seemingly disparate disciplines was a reflexive process where the influence of each component on each other spiraled into the theory and practice as illustrated through the Constructed Narratives project. Research that evolves from an arts perspective encourages experimental processes of making as a method for defining research principles. The traditional reductionist approach to research requires that all confounding variables are eliminated or silenced using methods of statistics. However, that noise in the data, those confounding variables provide the rich context, media, and processes by which creative practices thrive. As research in the arts gains recognition for its contributions of new knowledge, the traditional reductive practice in search of general principles will be respectfully joined by methodologies for defining living principles that celebrate and build from the confounding variables, the data noise. The movement to develop research methodologies from the noisy edges of human interaction have been explored in the research and practices of ludic design and ambiguity (Gaver, 2003); affective gap (Sengers et al., 2005b; 2006); embodied interaction (Dourish, 2001); the felt life (McCarthy & Wright, 2004); and reflective HCI (Dourish, et al., 2004). The theory of critical creative technology examines the relationships between critical theories of technology, society and aesthetics, information technologies and contemporary practices in interaction design and creative digital media. The theory of critical creative technology is aligned with theories and practices in social navigation (Dourish, 1999) and community-based interactive systems (Stathis, 1999) in the development of smart appliances and network systems that support people in engaging in social activities, promoting communication and enhancing the potential for learning in a community-based environment. The theory of critical creative technology amends these community-based and collaborative design theories by emphasizing methods to facilitate face-to-face dialogical interaction when the exchange of ideas, observations, dreams, concerns, and celebrations may be silenced by societal norms about how to engage others in public spaces. The Constructed Narratives project is an experiment in the design of a critical creative technology that emphasizes the collaborative construction of new knowledge about one's lived world through computer-supported collaborative play (CSCP). To construct is to creatively invent one's world by engaging in creative decision-making, problem solving and acts of negotiation. The metaphor of construction is used to demonstrate how a simple artefact - a building block - can provide an interactive platform to support discourse between collaborating participants. The technical goal for this project was the development of a software and hardware platform for the design of critical creative technology applications that can process a dynamic flow of logistical and profile data from multiple users to be used in applications that facilitate dialogue between people in a real-time playful interactive experience.

Title: Caught in-between: Exploring the complexities of school vandalism. Case study research in Kenya
Abstract: School violence in Kenya has developed from wanton walkouts to planned and premeditated incidences of vandalism which have been tragic and led to millions loss of school property. The main purpose of this study is to seek for a deeper understanding into the occurrence of school vandalism within the Kenyan school context and perhaps explore why the various initiatives being undertaken by the government and the independent organisations have not been effective in controlling or preventing the menace. In order to achieve, the objectives of the study, we purposefully sampled for a case study that had a history of school vandalism and 31 respondents. We discovered, that the vandalism at Kusasi was a very complex phenomenon which was embedded in the social-cultural, political, economical and historical aspects in the school but also to a large extent flowing from their influences in the post-colonial society. By discussing the movements of the public school in this society we contend that the youth are caught in-between and the vandalism is a form of 'tactical agency' (Certeau, 1984) in their struggle to emerge from these forces which are beyond their control. As Garbarino (1998) posits the society today is toxicated, and there is an impeding clash between cultures as the older generation insist on using authoritarian models in dealing with the phenomenon. By posing critical questions on the events and crisis in the post-colonial society, we show that indeed these societies are caught in-between as they attempt to embrace the global trends. School and education seem to have lost their function and meaning, as the crisis has threatened its core goals. It is thus, our conclusion, that, perhaps, what is required is for a critical pedagogy that will invoke reflection, questioning and challenging the meanings and identities of the contemporary society and education.

Title: Constructing Chinese Christian identity in diaspora during the 1950s and 1960s: A case study of Xie Fuya (1892–1991)
Abstract: Xie Fuya (1892-1991), one of the most prolific Chinese theologians of the 20 th century, has so far been largely ignored in the historical or theological studies of Chinese Christianity. Even worse, Xie Fuya has been seriously misunderstood by some historians of Chinese Christianity. Some of them labeled him as a representative of the indigenous theologians who focused exclusively on the relation between Christianity and Chinese culture without any concern for the relevance of the Christian message to the contemporary social change. Some stereotyped him as one of the Chinese Christians who made a far-fetched comparison between Chinese culture and Christianity. However, these prevailing paradigmatic "conclusions" on Xie Fuya are not properly based on in-depth historical investigation and the derived theological criticisms were merely built on some a-historical assumptions. The present research aims at pointing out that the relevant historical materials do not support the above conclusions-that Xie Fuya did not concern the social and political situation of his homeland and indwelling place(s). In fact, historical evidences show that Xie as an indigenous theologian, not only spent time on bridging the relation between Christian message and Chinese culture, but also paid much effort in social construction and political participation. All these were done both before and after 1949. Furthermore, the present research is going to indicate that many historians and theologians have failed to take serious the diasporic context when articulating their concepts of traditional Chinese culture and of the Chinese identity. In fact, Xie Fuya, as a diasporic Chinese after 1949, did not define his Chinese identity and the Chinese culture in territorial or political terms. Instead, he shared the viewpoints of those overseas Chinese who were struggling to survive in diasporic contexts. And his diasporic experience and horizon generated a critical understanding of Chinese culture and indigenous theology as well as their relationship. Even now, some scholars in Mainland China continue to emphasize that indigenous theology should be understood, discussed and applied within the social, political and cultural contexts of Mainland China only. However, their understandings of Chinese culture and Chinese identity, as well as the related methodology of indigenous theology they have employed, need to be examined critically. The present thesis aims at investigating how the Chinese Christian intellectual Xie Fuya, responded to a diasporic movement resulting from the drastic political change of China in and after 1949. He tried to construct a unique and new identity that he had never had before-an identity that helped him to face the diasporic environment and generated a new horizon of his understanding of his faith. Showing the contents of this identity; the thesis illustrates how unique Xie's diasporic identity was expressed in the community of Chinese intellectuals and Chinese Christians during the 1950s and 1960s. That identity could not have been created, experienced and articulated by any Chinese and Christians inside Mainland China at that time. The thesis will argue that it is Xie Fuya's experience of being forced to leave his homeland and the reflection of his Christian thought and experience that helped formulate his diasporic identity. Furthermore, both the fate of Chinese overseas in different areas because of the change of international politics, and the understanding of his own ethnicity and culture through the discourse among the Chinese intellectuals in Hong Kong, helped reinforce the articulation of that dislocating identity. In addition, the thesis will argue that this diasporic identity constitutes a significant ingredient of Xie Fuya's indigenous theology and contributes to Xie's new understanding of his own indigenous theology of Christianity in a post-1949 diasporic environment. Xie's indigenous theology, especially his theological method, aroused furious discussion among Chinese Christian intellectuals in and after the 1960s. Such discourse was identified as a significant break of historical continuity between the past generation and the next of Chinese Christian intellectuals in Hong Kong. The significance of this research does not only rest in its showing that a significant and important figure like Xie Fuya has been neglected in the historical and theological studies of Chinese Christianity in the past; it is significant also because it discloses how the thought behind the identities of a diasporic Chinese and Chinese Christian bears significance in a historical context and contributes to a new understanding of the Chinese identity, the Chinese culture and indigenous theology from a different perspective---which is different from the past and is closely related to cultural, anthropological and theological studies of our times.

Title: The rise of Islamism among the sedentary Fulbe of northern Cameroon: Implications for theological responses
Abstract: This research examines the root causes of Islamism among the sedentary Fulbe of Northern Cameroon. The study attempts to draw the implications for the development of contextual theological responses to Islamism. The author begins with issues pertaining to the related theoretical framework and methodology. The most notable model for the study of Islamism seems to be the Dekmejian/Voll/Woodberry theory. Islamism is a worldwide phenomenon. Almost all African Islamist movements and organizations have networks with people or organizations in Asia and other continents. The study of Islamism in Cameroon does not ignore the global context. Since the focus is on the Fulbe ethnic group, the study examines their culture and worldview in order to better understand the impact of Islamism. Pulaaku is at the center of Fulbe culture and worldview and it has three key aspects: wisdom, patience, and reserve. Interestingly enough, cattle are also essential to the Fulbe worldview. However, if the nomadic Fulbe place the highest value on their cattle, the sedentary Fulbe culture revolves around Islam. Islamism, as it manifests itself in northern Cameroon, has been established through various means and a diverse team of change agents. As a result, key aspects of Fulbe culture and worldview have been impacted. The causes of the rise of Islamism are multidimensional and in accordance with the Dekmejian/Voll/Woodberry theory. Islamism is growing in Cameroon. This phenomenon, at least at a theoretical level, requires contextual theological responses that address the root causes of Islamism and meet the felt needs of the population in the light of the Holy Scriptures. In the final part of the study, the author draws implications and makes recommendations that may help to move from theory to practice. In the current world where Islamism is one of the major social and religious influences, this study presents principles that are of interest to theologians and non-theologians worldwide.

Title: Deconstructing a South African narrative of oppression. The influence of religion in public policy: Christianity in South Africa, 1948–2004; exploring the African narrative of ubuntu
Abstract: In 1948, the Afrikaner Nationalist Government became the ruling party in South Africa and instituted the brutal system known as apartheid. To maintain their power, Afrikaners drew on Christian scripture and traditions to create self-justifying religious narratives that supported their oppressive ideologies, prohibiting inclusion and suppressing pluralism. Concepts of manifest destiny and redemptive violence supported a divisive culture of suppression of the majority by the minority. The Afrikaner-Christian narratives that provided the underpinnings for apartheid began to unravel as counter-narratives within the Christian tradition in Latin America (liberation theology) and Asia ( minjung theology) and African theologies influenced the Black church to demand equality and democracy. The South African historical, political, social, economic, cultural, and theological context is best understood and interpreted through the vision of ubuntu philosophy, theology, and thought. One of the most powerful concepts which, demonstrates the high value that African cultures place on humanity and expresses this solidarity in a corporate communal way of life that demonstrates the powerful shift from singularity to plurality in South African society. The dismantling of apartheid led to recognition of the religious other, the recovery of the alternate narratives and the reappearance of ubuntu perspective and practice in the political and public sphere. After the peaceful transition to a democratically elected government, the Truth and Reconciliation Commission drew on the narrative openings created by the struggle against apartheid, and by global anti-colonial theological movement, to create a platform for multiple voices, stories, and religious narratives to be shared in a public political context. This multiplicity of voices resulted, ultimately, in the formation of a new constitution for South Africa that seeks to uphold African values of community and inclusion in its institutions. While South Africa's apartheid system and the Truth and Reconciliation Commission are both rooted in the biblical narrative, the former used its theology to enforce and iron rule, while the latter combined Christian and African concepts to create a pluralistic and open society expressive of a culture that places emphasis on communality and interdependence of each individual's humanity solidifying ubuntu, a person is a person through other persons.

Title: Concurrent conservation and development: Lessons learned from a community-based case in Thailand
Abstract: Community-based management holds the potential to simultaneously deal with the multiple objectives of community economic development and the conservation of natural resources. Pred Nai Community Forestry Group based in the coastal mangrove forests of Thailand was recognized by the UNDP in 2004 as an example of a successful case of community-based management. The overall purpose of this research was to study the Pred Nai group in order to learn about the institutional and organizational characteristics, and the cross-scale linkages that facilitate community-based management. This qualitative research was carried out during four months of fieldwork in rural Thailand using interviews and participant observation. Pred Nai Community Forestry Group has been working toward the sustainable use and restoration of the local mangrove forest. The principal means they have employed includes the restoration of formerly logged and degraded areas and the development of a forest management plan. In addition to stopping the loss of existing biodiversity, their efforts have also resulted in the return of many formerly displaced native fauna, including species of wetland birds and monkeys. Pred Nai's conservation efforts have also had a direct impact on alleviating poverty and facilitating local economic development. This has come about through the improvement of yields in the local crab harvest, the utilization of non-timber forest products from the mangroves, and the establishment of a village savings fund to assist with social and economic development initiatives. The restoration and conservation of mangrove forests has improved the long-term sustainability of the villagers' economic activities. Research on Pred Nai's community-based management program revealed the importance of the following factors: (1) Availability of funding to proceed in small, practical steps; (2) A village savings group that provides capital, training, and lends credibility to the community; (3) Step-wise evolution leading to formal management; (4) Step-wise evolution allowing for capacity building over time; (5) Interplay of leadership, community cohesion and NGO support; (6) Leadership as key to grassroots movement; (7) Partnership with a key organization for building capacity and establishing linkages, in this case, RECOFTC; (8) Horizontal learning among communities as the key to replication of experience, and; (9) Local ecological knowledge as the foundation for environmental stewardship. The community did not immediately assume full responsibility for the management of the mangroves, but instead progressively assumed a greater role over time as the community built capacity and gained experience. Strong leadership within the community also played an important role as it ensured that the community members remained united in support of Pred Nai's conservation and management efforts. It was found that Pred Nai has formed numerous important linkages with external organizations, i.e. government, NGOs, and other communities, at the sub-district, provincial, national and international levels. Networking and other forms of horizontal learning between communities also played an important role in the replication of Pred Nai's successful initiative in other communities. Local ecological knowledge also played a role in Pred Nai's success as the community members' knowledge of the mangrove forest allowed them to create rules which were relevant to local ecological conditions, thereby helping the community to conserve a resource that provides at least part of the livelihood needs for 80% of Pred Nai villagers.

Title: Imagining and performing Habasha identity: The Ethiopian diaspora in the area of Washington, D.C.
Abstract: Washington, D.C. hosts a distinct density of Ethiopians that sets it apart as the largest Ethiopian demographic axis and cultural hub outside of the horn of African country. Unfamiliar with the historical white-black relations in the United States (partially attributable to absence of colonial occupation), Ethiopians migrated to the United States in three waves beginning from the 1920s. These movements reflected the turbulent political and economic traumas their homeland experienced in the 20 th -century in concert with global forces that transformed the world. The qualitative majority of Ethiopian immigrants in the United States are speakers of the Afro-Semitic languages, Amharic and Tigrigna, to whom blackness represents an alien notion of inferiority. This dissertation examines Ethiopians' reinvention and performance of the racially ambivalent Habasha identity in Washington, D.C. as a creative response to the disempowering implications of blackness. It addresses Habasha's entanglement in the political economic hierarchies of America by focusing on how everyday and symbolic performances enable or disable Ethiopians' desire to fit into the molds of dominant American discourses of race, ethnicity, gender, and class. The Habasha seek to establish their prestige through ritualized re-enactments of Judeo-Christian heritage and phenotypic markers that they stage in different spaces such as churches, restaurants, coffee shops, stadiums, fashion catwalks, museums, and so forth. Conversely, African-Americans and southern Ethiopians contest expressions of Habasha exceptionalism. These processes unfold against a backdrop of rapid gentrification in the Adams Morgan and Shaw neighborhoods of northwestern Washington, D.C., the retail hearts of Habasha mobility and areas Ethiopians have made home since the 1980s. Although the general rise in real estate prices continues to affect both communities, a recent proposal to rename a corner of 9 th Street at U Street, NW to "Little Ethiopia" has particularly intensified tensions between Ethiopians and African-Americans. The dissertation argues that Habashaness highlights "Semitic" ancestry to circumvent the negative ascriptions of blackness in exchange for economic and social mobility. Yet, it also emphasizes the contested performances of Habashaness can be sites for racial/ethnic dialogue in order to tackle larger socio-economic disparities.
