Title: Hospitality: Resolving gross inequalities of welfare and cultivating civic virtue
Abstract: Hospitality is a social practice little examined in either its personal or policy implications. One notable exception is Immanuel Kant's work in Perpetual Peace where he describes hospitality as a large scale interaction between nations and foreign guests. In this dissertation, I expand on Kant's initial description of large scale hospitality. I draw on his political and moral work to construct a more robust, Kantian version of hospitality that provides a theoretical justification for all hospitality relationships whether they are large or small. I argue that hospitality has significant implications for the way in which we address deep inequalities of welfare. On my account of hospitality, I claim that the host has three central tasks: (1) to allow visitation and access to needed material resources; (2) to build relationships of respect with the guest; and (3) to display a basic level of concern for the guest's well being. When we offer hospitality to both foreigners and fellow citizens, we provide them with essential material resources (such as food and shelter), emotional support (through our welcome and care of them), as well as access to important life opportunities (such as education or medical treatment). When people have access to these material and immaterial resources, they achieve an equality of welfare with others, a fundamental right that allows them to fulfill important life plans. In addition, I argue that hospitality helps citizens develop civic virtues. Kant argues that citizens must act on the common good to create strong national governments and international associations, but he doesn't explain how citizens are to develop the necessary virtues that enable them to do this. I examine Dorothy Day and the Catholic Worker Movement as examples of small scale hospitality offered to the least among society. I argue that when we act as hosts in the hospitality relationship, we expand our vision to include the needs of those who suffer from inequalities and learn how to act for the common good. Thus, practicing hospitality cultivates civic virtues necessary to achieve the broader aims of Kant's vision.

Title: Race, housing, and the making of twentieth-century Louisville, Kentucky
Abstract: Using oral histories, census data, newspapers, letters, diaries, and municipal records, this dissertation analyzes the creation of the predominately African American West End of Louisville, Kentucky, during the twentieth century. Praised for its racial progress by national and international observers, including Presidents Dwight Eisenhower and Lyndon Johnson, Louisville had a long history of racial inequality and economic oppression. At the beginning of the twentieth century, African Americans and whites lived next to each other in the city's downtown business district. Over the course of sixty years, individual forms of discrimination merged with institutional discrimination as government officials and business leaders, homeowners and real estate agents, and moneylenders and mortgage brokers in Louisville deliberately kept African Americans out of white neighborhoods and isolated from economic opportunities. By the end of the twentieth century, a residential color line starkly divided Louisville with African Americans living in the West End, which was situated on a flood plain and in the path of air pollution from nearby industries, and whites living everywhere else. This study of Louisville positions housing at the center of the movement for racial equality and economic justice. In so doing, it illustrates the complex relationship between housing and racial and class categories. Working-class whites joined with middle-class and upper-class whites to protect their neighborhoods from African American residents because housing symbolized economic mobility, social standing, and financial vitality. Examining the struggle over where African Americans should live in Louisville, this dissertation illustrates the limitations of public policy to eradicate private prejudice and structural racism. Despite the passage of federal and local legislation against discrimination, African Americans continued to be relegated to the West End of the city. In the end, Louisville remained one of the nation's most segregated cities at the end of the twentieth century. Keywords. Race, Housing, African Americans, Southern History, Urban History

Title: A bitter homecoming: Tunisian veterans of the first and second world wars
Abstract: This dissertation examines the lives of Tunisian veterans who fought for the French during the First and Second World Wars. My thesis breaks new ground in that it attempts to place the story of Tunisian veterans in the wider global context of the World Wars and decolonization. Earlier studies of Tunisian veterans, while comprehensive in some aspects, limit their inquiry to a specifically Tunisian context. My research into recently-released French archives documenting Tunisian veterans in the 1950s also contributes to the importance of my thesis. Whereas most Tunisian historians have considered the veterans as "collaborators" with the French, my research indicates that such generalizations simply do not describe the complex relationship between the veterans and French colonial rule. Rather, I argue that veterans participated in and, in some cases, seem to have organized armed resistance to French rule. In contrast to similar research on African veterans from French Equatorial Africa (AOF), my research on North African veterans reveals that the political roles open to Tunisian veterans in the post-independence period were few and far between, unlike the situation in the Ivory Coast or Mali. Finally, my limited interviews with Tunisian veterans and my use of interviews transcribed by other Tunisian scholars provide unique insights as to how veterans themselves interpreted the wartime and post-war environment. The introduction functions as an historiographical overview positioning Tunisian veterans within the wider context of veterans' movements in France, North Africa, and elsewhere. Specifically, I pose the question of why Tunisian veterans did not become politicized as did other Arab veterans (notably in Iraq and Morocco). The first chapter deals with the establishment of the French Protectorate in Tunisia and the First World War. I explore the depth of pan-Islamic and pro-Ottoman sympathies among the troops, as well as the experience of Tunisian troops in German prisoner-of-war camps. The second chapter deals with the aftermath of the First World War and the halting efforts to define social benefits for the veterans. The veterans and their descendants use their correspondence with the French administration to negotiate benefits on the basis of their wartime sacrifices. The third chapter deals with the Second World War and the enormous upheaval of the French defeat in 1940. I use an appeal by Marshal Pétain and a Free French Franco-Arabic military journal Al-Nasr , published from 1943-1946, to detail the intense French propaganda efforts to retain the loyalty of Muslim soldiers. The fourth chapter details belated French efforts to reinvigorate their policies towards the veterans, while exploring the increased militancy of some veterans as French power waned in the late 1950s. The fifth chapter deals with the post-independence period (1956-Present) and describes how Tunisian veterans were pushed to the margins of historical memory (both in France and in Tunisia). The chapter ends with a discussion of how and why the veterans have once again emerged as a potent symbol for national unity and pride in both France and Tunisia in recent years.

Title: The decorative fire of Susan S. Frackelton: China painting, art pottery, and book illumination
Abstract: Susan Stuart Goodrich Frackelton (1848-1932) was an influential leader in American ceramic art in the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries. She personified the emergence of the professional woman artist and entrepreneur. Her work spanned both the Aesthetic and the Arts and Crafts Movements. Although she was a regional artist, based in the emerging and largely immigrant city of Milwaukee, Wisconsin, she received many awards for her china painting and art pottery at national and international exhibitions. Her experiments in native clays, salt-glaze stoneware, and porcelain garnered her much acclaim for originality. That originality extended to her collaborations with George E. Ohr. Her ceramic oeuvre expressed an interest in nature as inspiration for art and the many debates between naturalism and conventionalism surrounding the depiction of design. Her sketches and watercolors reflect the art training she received from landscape painter Heinrich Vianden. As a successful businesswoman, author, inventor, teacher, and lecturer, she shaped a career that went beyond the decorating and making of ceramic objects. Her many accomplishments, including her manual, Tried by Fire: A Work on China-Painting , invention of a portable gas kiln for firing china, and the manufacture of mineral colors, directly supported the engagement of women in ceramic arts. With a goal to elevate American ceramic art, she co-founded the National League of Mineral Painters in 1892, which enabled thousands of amateur artists, most of whom were women, to have a visible profile on the exhibition scene. Her contributions to the art of book illumination, some of which were collaborations with her daughter and the Monastery Hill Bindery, and done for the Chicago Woman's Club as well as for private individuals such as Elizabeth A. Plankinton and Henry N. Torrey, crowned her achievements in the decorative arts. Frackelton's work and career provides a multi-faceted understanding of the social, educational, and artistic framework that supported the development of American ceramic art and decorative arts in general, and sheds light on the struggle of women to gain recognition as artists.

Title: Dynamic Evolvement and Sustainalbe Use Control of Land in LargeOpencast Mine in Loess Region
Abstract: Global change research developed at very fast speed and the impact of human activity on environment, especially the impact of land use and exploration by human life and production on land cover change were considered by international scientist to be important composition of global environmental change. Opencast mines of China were mainly suited in ecological fragile zone in arid and semiarid region. Mining resulted in deterioration of ecological conditions. Land use and cover derived by mining showed different regional change between city and countryside, which witnessed land wasted, vegetation bankrupted and ecosystem lost its self-supported capability, and revealed notable impact on sustainable development of mine region. A case study was done on the first modern large opencast mine, Antaibao Opencast Mine. Based on analysis of land reclamation and ecological restoration in mining area, a theoretical framework of mining area ecosystem and its controlling ecosystem were established, and controlling technology systems was furthermore put forward. Geographic Information Systems was used as the platform to analyze land use/cover change and establish primary integrated land use/cover change model, which was then used to analyze drive factor and relevant land, environmental and human activity problem. There are few report about change rule and drive power of land use in mine region. As such, the paper conducted a beneficial try and the main results were list as following: (1) Considering characteristics of land use in large opencast mining area, land use change process was divided as two phase. The first phase is land use change in ecological damange, including land xcavating, occupying and piling. The second phase is land use change in ecological restoration, that is, reconstruction of landforms, soil, and vegetation. Land use/cover showed spatial quick movement, changeability of land factor, polyphase of land sustainability, complexity of land types. The analysis result of Antaibao Opencast Mining Area land use change showed that all land use/cover changed except expropriated area in Mining Area Ecosystem. Damaged area of mining is 2003.07 hm2. Forestry land showed biggest change, which increased with 492.52hm2 of area. Shrub land added 329.02hm2 with 46.52% increasing rate per year. 329.4hm2 of industrial land was added, which are mainly industrial building, facility filed and factory land. Industrial land is supposed not to have much change in the next period. Mining land was added with 406.17hm2 of area. Bare land added 413.38hm2, which are most land waiting for restored. (3) Water erosion assessment index and model was used to analyze water-land safety grade of dump in land reclamation phase and later restored phase, which showed high risk and low safety grade separately. (4) The drive power of land use change was discussed based on land use change characteristics. The land use change phases in mining area were firstly divided with the dominated drive power as basic criterion. Land use change in mining area was consumed to be the integrated result of internal and external drive power. Currently the land in mining area could not realize optimal benefit. However, the main reason is not restoration technology but management systems problem. As such, government should take on duty to guarantee social public benefit, and take economical measures and management means to support the land restoration. (5) Combining previous research with supplemented data, the paper summarized application technology for land reclamation and ecological restoration for opencast mining area, established land use and controlling technology systems for large opencast mine in loess region. Based on the assumption of artificial control on ecosystem succession conditions, the case study on ATB was done to optimize land resource to realize cycling and development of land economy with landscape planning method.

Title: The Optimization Way of Chinese Government Purchase System Under WTO Frame
Abstract: The government procurement has more than 200 years history from emerges to the development- However, along with the economical development, inflation of the national public function as well as increasing of the government intervenes, it has become an important form of expenditure in the various countries, especially in the developed market country- The government procurement after the practice and development in the western nation and its applicable scope from domestic to oversea, has constituted of indispensable part in the international political and economy- Although the government procurement is mainly an internal affair of one state, but actually is restrained the market economy development and influenced by the world economics development, It is an product of the deepening development of market economy- The goal of Chinese Economic Restructuring is to establish the socialist market economy system- As the important constituent that realize this goal, the Chinese Communist Party 15th is proposed explicitly to establish the socialism public finance system, the essence of which is the public finance should serves for the public interest- The key to achieve the goal is to reform and consummate a series of financial revenue and expenditure system, especially to carry out the government procurement system- The attempt of the reform of China’s government procurement began in 1993- During the past decade, we have made the huge progress and accumulated the rich experience in the objects of purchase, the purchase way, the procedure, the purchase management- In 2002, the ninth sessions of Standing Committee of the National People's Congress 28th conference considers through "People's Republic of China Government Procurement Law" (hereafter refers to as" Purchase Law"), which is to summarize these experiences- It also is an important milestone, symbolized the government procurement work move from the experiment site stage to the legal system and the standardized track- After the promulgation and implementation of "Purchase Law", the government procurement system widely carried out in our country, obtains the remarkable effect, especially prominent in the function of saving financial fund- With China entering the WTO, Government Procurement, either as government behavior or as one field of the national economic institution, reflects the state’s macro economic policy on one aspect- The government procurement is already playing as an important role in the domestic economical development, moreover is one of the international trade domains, therefore, are attached importance by the WTO and its members- In China, the government procurement system is an innovation, its force may radiate to many deep problems based in the transition economic system at this stage, especially to the market analysis, the public decision-making, the government regulates aspect and has the stronger influence- The establishment and consummation of Government procurement system will have a profound and significant influence, in regardless of national politics, the economic restructuring, or the socialist market economy development and the consummation, as well as the socialism democracy, the legislative work- The perfect government procurement system, is advantageous to the enhance the regulation and controllability that the government entire national economy macroeconomic; is advantageous to save the government fund, raise the use level of the financial fund; is advantageous to strengthen the market consciousness, and promote to change the idea; is advantageous to create the condition for the market fair competition; is advantageous to intensify the purchase transparency and promote the establishment or cultivation of clean government; is advantageous to expanded the international economy exchanges, as help with protecing the home industry- Therefore, establishing the perfect government procurement system will produce the great benefit for the people and the nation- But a reform’ carrying out, is not allowed to accomplish the whole take via only promulgating a law- The government procurement in our country don’t achieve "Purchase Law" requests level, regardless of is its scale or its standardized degree- This article goal is to divide six chapters to analysis and induct the related theory about the government procurement under the above background, compare and research the international experience, discuss how to unify the situation and the background that we joined WTO, through constructing the related system, seeks the optimization way of the government procurement system- First chapter is the introductory remarks, which is composed of six sections- First section mainly has expounded the research goal; Second section mainly elaborated the rationale that the Chinese government procurement system seeks the optimization way, based in the supposition theory about "the economic man" in the politics and the economic, the theory of rent-seeking, the principle of entrusting the agent and the analysis to concern the public choice theory; Third section learn the theory and practice significance through studing the Chinese procurement purchase system optimization way- Many kinds of disciplines essential method and certain theories are overlapping used, which have broken to the government procurement system research background and the method quite sole pattern, has opened up the government procurement system research scope, has enriched the research method of the government procurement at the same time, the establishment and consummation of the government procurement system, regardless of to the national politics, the economic restructuring, or the socialist market economy development and the consummation, as well as the socialism democracy and the legislative work, all will certainly raise profound and the significant influence; Fourth section mainly elaborated the literature situation concerning the domestic and foreign research government procurement ; Fifth section mainly has established this article the research technique which with the comparative analysis, the system analysis , the unifies analysis of the standard and real diagnosis analysis- Second chapter is composed of four sections- Mainly elaborated the elementary theory of the government procurement- First section elaborated the historical evolution of the government procurement system- The government procurement is original from 18 century's ends and the beginning of 19th century as the west non-monopoly capitalism country, had more than 200 years history, which divide into 3 development phases; Second section elaborated the government procurement connotation, the nature and the characteristic, and point out the government procurement although has certain characteristics as the civil activities, but research from its essence, it has many significant differences with the ordinary civil behavior, it still belong to the category of the administrative action; Third section has induced the integrant parts of the government procurement, confirmed the main body and the object in relationship of the government procurement , the purchase way, the procedure and principle; Fourth section has analyzed basic function and the economical effect of the government procurement-The standard government procurement behavior, the promotion to economy and the social development are the main functions- At the same time, the resources disposition effect and the financial effect are two big economical effects in the government procurement- Third chapter is composed of three sections, which mainly elaborated under WTO the Chinese government purchase system vicissituded- First section mainly reviewed and analyzed the history and the situation of the Chinese government procurement system; Second section has analyzed WTO with emphasis "Government procurement Agreement" the positive influence, which produces to our country; Third section elaborated the main international rules and regulations in the government procurement domain and its model that can be used in our country- Fourth chapter is composed of three sections- Which mainly elaborated how to seek the optimization way of Chinese government purchase system- First section analyzed the advantages that our country establish the government procurement system, namely deepening the economic restructuring, the finance organizational reform won initial success, incurs bids the system gradually to carry out, the domestic market and the international market gradually connected rails; Second section has analyzed some main questions in the government procurement system at present, and discusses the deep level reason which it forms, which is advantageous to reform radically, and how to elimination the restriction and disadvantage factor that exited in development of the government procurement system; The third section analysis has discussed the basic principle and the target complex which our country government procurement system optimizes- Pointed out our government procurement should build the target complex that follows public, fair, the good faith and the efficiency principle, bases in the efficiency and the validity, encourages the advance in technology, executes the national policy, promotes the honesty of government procurement, enhances the confidence that the public gives the government procurement system- The Fifth chapter is composed of four sections- Mainly it provides the feasible policy suggestions how to establish the government procurement system that adapts for the Chinese national condition and conforms to the WTO request, which based in the reform theory and the practice innovation of the government procurement system- First section elaborated what are the essential factors that we consummate the surveillance management system of the government procurement- We should do from the following aspects including consummating the laws and regulations for the government procurement system and the management system, strengthening centralism purchase organization and supplier's aspect; Second section elaborated what are the essential factors that we establish and perfect the foundational work system of government procurement- We should establish and perfect the foundational work mechanism of the government procurement from the perfect government procurement surveillance mechanism, including strengthening management in the information network for the government procurement and the experts, strengthening all levels of the governmental purchase scope and expanses the aspect; Third section elaborated what are the essential factors to build and perfect the budget management system of the government procurement and its movement mechanism- We should act as the following aspect including standardizing the budget system of the government procurement, choosing the reasonable government procurement way, establishing the budget accounting system and the state treasury centralism payment system, using the method which the purchase plan establishment and the state asset management unifies to come the standard government procurement the movement mechanism; Fourth section elaborated what are the essential factors that we should establish the rescue mechanism of the government procurement- We should do it on the base that compensates mechanism and establishment science aspect and so on- Sixth chapter is a conclusion, has made an induction about the main research conclusion, simultaneously also pointed out which this article needs to further study three major problems- Firstly, we must attach importance to the research about the government procurement system in switching time; Secondly, we should think much of the research about the application theory of the government procurement; Thirdly we ought to pay attention to the research of the policy function of the government procurement-

Title: Business Ethics: Theoretical Evolution and Business Practice
Abstract: In the past few years, the frequent revealing of business scandals in China and abroad has aroused once again peoples’ concerns towards ethics and moral issue in business practices. And it has also brought on to the table the issue whether ethical consideration and value judgment should be implanted in the economics research. Therefore, business ethics has become a critical topic both in academic and practice field.From historical perspective, economics originated as an offshoot of Moral Philosophy. But the study on economics theory evolution shows that this origin has diverged into two different paths during the development. On the one side, economics has been viewed as a purely positive science, thus ethical theme has been downplayed because of the principle of value-neutral. On the other side, economics has been viewed as a social science with the nature of science and humanity, and economics research has been regarded as a field that embraces both ethics and value judgment. Thus, it conveys strong alliance between economics and ethics.At the same time, business practice has been calling for rebuilding the ethical dimension in economics research and business practice. Therefore, coming from different disciplines, business ethics has developed into an independent science since 1970s. Also, since 1990s, an extensive global business practice has resulted from the integration of theory and practice. Enterprises are at the core of the ethics practice movement. This movement has been driven by the governments, NGOs, enterprises and individuals etc. in the ways of laws, initiatives, authentications and principles or codes of conduct etc.Combining the results of many years’ researches in China and one-year as visiting scholar in the U.S., this paper concentrates on the theory and practice issues of business ethics. It reviews the ethics theories of major economics schools and of their representative economists historically, and it explores the development of modern business ethics as an independent discipline. Therefore, this paper provides a historical picture on the theoretical origin and the evolution of business ethics in both China and Western society. Also, it concludes the similarities and compares the differences between business ethics theories of China and of the Western society. The research then reaches a conclusion that the ethical and moral consideration will enable more profound and more persuasive economics research both in China and abroad, both in the past and present, even though great differences in politics, economy and culture do exist. Meanwhile, even though approaches of practices are diversified, the results from the research on the business ethics in enterprises practices have shown that ethics management has become a critical part in corporate management globally, and is helpful for constructing a more ethical business community. Based on the theoretical and practical analysis, this paper finally suggests the rapid theory and practice development of business ethics in China, which is definitely urgent and important for building a harmonious society. In order to do so, a comprehensive integration should be emphasized, by considering Chinese background of special development phase and traditional business ethics, by following Marxism scientific methodology, and by learning from the experience of European and American.

Title: The Industrial Evolution Theory
Abstract: The Industrial Evolution Theory Major：political economics Doctorate candidate：Chen Xiaotao Tutor：Jiang Yongmu The industry evolution is the unceasing change process of the industrial structure and content in the developing process，and is the industrial unceasingly self- renewal process，which enhances the economical scale and the aggregate in the quantity，and enhances the economic efficiency and the character in the quality，which performs the industrial structure unceasing rationalization and the advancement process in the time evolution，and which refers to its spatial crosswise expansion，including industrial overall scale unceasing expansion，industrial regional distribution expansion，industrial layout optimization and industrial shift in the spatial structure evolution. The industry evolution is the process that the resources disposition structure transforms，and is integration of the continuity and the non- continuity. The industrialization essence is the industrial evolution process，which not only is the industrial structure from the primary agriculture to the primary industry，but also is the industry internal structure evolution process，with the unceasing elimination of the decline industry，the strength of the technological reformation to traditional industry，the reasonable transformation to the leading industry and the support and the guidance to the emerging industry. The economic development experience among various countries indicated that the industrial evolution had the obvious regularity with the national income level enhancement and the economical development，but regarding different country and area，the industrial evolution presented own obvious particularity because of the differences of the respective resources constitution，the social system，the traditional culture and the development successive aspect. The economical development practice and theory indicated that the industrial evolution and the economical development had the special relation，which the evolution on the level of the economic development and the altitude of the industrial structure was synchronized，and the industrial structure had become the important symbol that weigh a country development phase in society，economy and culture. Based on the deeper level，the economical development core is the industrial structure evolution and optimization. Industrial structure evolution speed reflects not only the industrialization speed，but also the modernization quality and level of production and life. Therefore，the elementary sentence of economic development is the industrial structure evolution，and the reasonable industrial structure has the significant function to the economic development. The economic structure evolution centralized by the industrial structure became the basic characteristic and the content of the modern economic growth and development，and the industrial structure change constituted the vivid connotation of the economic growth and development，so the strategy on the economic development was formulated on the basis of the rule of industrial structure evolution in various countries. Therefore，the research into industrial evolution mechanism and the exploration into industrial evolution rule, naturally had become the hot spot and key to the research region of the modern economy development，so the research into industrial structure evolution has the actual significance to our country economic development. Since the 20th century 70's，the self-organization fundamental research has thrived and become an emerging science, which creates the new method and scientific thought that enlighten the sociologist and the economist to explore the rule of the social movement and the economic movement. The self-organization theory mainly includes the dissipative structure theory, synergetics, morphogensis and so on. The external performance of the industrial system evolution process is namely the industry economic phenomena，and the openness, the non- balance and the non-linearity of the industrial system is the fountain from which the complexity and the multiplicity of industry economic phenomena derives. The organization evolution of the industrial system is the process with a circulating reciprocation and the structural unceasing evolution. The production and the development of self-organization theory, as well as its convergence with the national innovation system theory, the evolution economic theory and the growth economic theory, provides the new and broader field for the research into industrial evolution mechanism. At the same time, some analysis tools such as evolution economics，the evolution game theory，the experimental economics，the chaos theory and the non-linear dynamics and so on also unceasingly emerge in the evolution economic models, which causes the very good coordination between the complexity of the research objects and the analysis tools. Our country is a developing economic great nation with fundamental change, and the economic development and the adjustment of the economic structure has extremely close relationship. Since the reform and the open policy，along with the fast growth of national economy，our country industrial structure adjustment has obtained the remarkable achievement，by means of a series of policies and measures including the prior development of the light industry, the scale expansion of durable consumable import，the constructive strength of the foundation industry and the infrastructure, vigorous development of the tertiary industry and so on，to enable our country industrial structure gradually to tend to the coordination and to develop towards the optimized and promoted direction. Our country industrial structure change mainly presents the characteristics：①The industrialization advancement further speeds up，and the second industrial with steady growth constitutes the main content which our country economy grows；②The agricultural internal structure is reasonable day by day；③The growth between weight industry and light industry is reasonable day by day；④The tertiary industry develops rapidly；⑤The production resources are collected to the superior enterprises gradually. But China takes in a developing great nation，whose industrial structure adjustment has its distinction. China has dual economic structure between the city and countryside and between the industry and agriculture. In our country economic life，at present，the exposed prominent contradiction is the structure unbalance, the supply excess，the demand insufficient, the industrial optimization and promotion. Looked from the deeper level，the essence of the supply surplus is the supply structure and industrial structure in particular is unreasonable，which cannot adapt the change of market demand structure，whose essence is the backward industrial structure. At present，with the obvious globalization tendency of international economy and the intense international competition day by day，the melt of the chinese economy into in the global economy and the access into WTO will bring not only the development opportunity to China but also serious challenge to chinese economy. Under the economical globalization background，facing the adjustment upsurge of the world industrial structure，the primary mission of our country economic development will be the acceleration of the industrial structure optimization and promotion. The 16th Party's reports proposed that，“The industrialization realization still is the arduous historical duty in our country modernization advancement”，“With the persistence in the information impetus to industrialization and the industrialization promotion to information, we will go out a new industrialization pathway followed by the high technological content，the good economic efficiency, the low resources consumption, the low environmental pollution and the full display of the human resources superiority”, “we will advance industrial structure optimization and promotion to form the full scale pattern of industrial development”. Walking the new industrialization path is the inevitable choice which our country realizes the industrialization and modernization. As the biggest developing nation，under the economic globalization background，at present our country is a crucial time of the new industrialization advancement，therefore，we adjust the industrial structure to realize the industrial structure optimization and to enhance the industrial economic competition，which has specially vital significance to realize the new industrialization. This article will take the Marx economic theory as the instruction，simultaneously profit from the domestic and foreign industrial economics and the western economic theory, combine microscopic analysis with the macroscopic analysis，and integrate the standard research with the real diagnosis analysis，to lay emphasis on the research into the pattern，the influence factor and way of industrial evolution，and refer to the international experience，and use our country statistical data to review and analyze our country industrial structure change，and to explore the process and the rule of our country industrial evolution，and to research into the existent question of our country industrial structure，the compared superiority，the adjustment direction and the countermeasure. In the research，based on the self-organization theory and method and the evolution economic theory, through the establishment of non-linear dynamics mathematical model，with the aid of to the logistic equation，the mechanism and the process of the industrial self-organization evolution will be carried on the discussion. The paper structure and the main content are： 1st chapter, the present situation and achievement of the domestic and foreign research was introduced systemically，mainly involving the elementary theory of industrial evolution，including the Marxism industrial structure theory，the western industry evolution theory and our country scholar's research，and the current research situation and the newest progress of industrial evolution theory was fully analyzed，and the industrial evolution theory was summarized from the different research angle. 2nd chapter，the world industry evolution was briefly analyzed. The historical vicissitude of the global industry promotion was introduced，the current new tendency of the world industry evolution was summarized，and the enlightenment on the developed country experience to the chinese industry promotion was induced. 3rd chapter，The industrial evolution pattern was analyzed，the influence factors of the industrial evolution were induced，the industrial evolution way was discussed，the industrial evolution rule was summarized，and finally，the judgment standard and the safeguard system of the industrial evolution was discussed. 4th、5th chapters，the influence factor analysis of industrial evolution. Based on the macroscopic and microscopic economic agents such as the natural resource, the labor resources, the expense demand，the investment，the foreign trade，the system，the technology advancement， the flexible production，the industry concentration，the product difference， the entrance barrier，the labor division and so on，the industrial evolution influence was elaborated，inducing respective function mechanism, the agent and the mechanism. 6th、7th chapters，the tendency and the way of the current world industrial system evolution was discussed，and the agent and the evolution tendency on the industrial softening，the industrial convergence，the industrial ecologization，the economical service，the industrial internationalization，the high-tech industrialization，the industrial cluster，the industrial shift and the industrial integration was elaborated and studied 8th chapter，the content and the analysis method of the industrial structure rationalization and advancement，the industrial international competition strength and the industrial layout was proven. Based on the industrial structure optimization，the international competition enhancement and the layout optimization，the judgment standard and the request of the industrial evolution was analyzed. 9th chapter，the real diagnosis research into our country industrial evolution. On the light of all years statistics data of our country，the history and the present situation of our country industrial evolution was analyzed. The history of industrial structure evolution was reviewed，the present characteristics of the industrial structure was described，and the existent question and the reason analysis of the industrial structure was pointed out，the stage，the way，the influence factor and the future development tendency of our country three industries evolution was explored. The paper researched into industrial evolution rule and characteristics，and carried on the real diagnosis analysis to our country industrial evolution，so the work is the research foundation，research innovation mainly has following several aspects： 1、The basic principle on the organization theory，the non-linear dynamics，the new trade theory and the new growth theory and so on was utilized to research industry evolution rule，to infer the industrial evolution model. In the research，with the aid of to the logistic equation，the quantitative characteristics to the whole evolutionary process of industrial system were carried on the analysis，the industrial evolution model was carried on the discussion，the industrial life cycle and the industrial promotion process was analyzed，and the industrial evolution way was obtained. 2、The traditional industrial economics has simply induced the basic influence factors of industrial evolution，for instance：the demand factor，the supplies factor，the international factor and the system factor，unified with the industrial evolution rule，this article further deepened the basic influence factors of industrial evolution，has discussed respective action mechanism and the influence way. This article specially studied the industrial evolution microscopic factors on the enterprise，studied the influence of the flexible production，the market structure，the enterprise annexation，the division of labor and the high additional value on the industrial evolution. 3、The new way and tendency of industrial evolution in the contemporary world was studied，including：the industrial cluster，the industrial convergence，the industrial ecologization，the high-tech industrialization，the industrial internationalization，the economical service，and the industrial integration and so on. 4、The traditional economy growth theory only use the rationalization and advancement of the industrial structure to judge the degree and effect of industrial evolution，this article increased the enhancement of the industrial international competition and the optimization of the industrial layout to judgment standard，which consummated the judgment standard on the industrial evolution under the sustainable development theory. 5、Combined with the history and the present situation of our country industrial structure evolution，with all previous years datum in statistics yearbook，the process，the stage，the way，the influence factors and the future development tendency of our country industrial evolution was carried on the comprehensive and thorough research，the question and reason of industry evolution was analyzed，the strategic measure and the policy suggestion that advanced industrial evolution was proposed. Key words：industry；evolution；law；factor；way

Title: Folk on tyne: tyneside culture and the second folk revival, 1950-1975
Abstract: This thesis explores the nature of the second folk revival in the North East of England. While there have been several major studies of the various national folk revivals during the 1950s, '60s and '70s, there is a paucity of scholarly accounts viewed through a regional lens. This study therefore builds on a common perception of North Eastern regional particularity to establish the ways in which the folk revival as experienced by its members within the region was distinct from that detailed in the literature on the wider (inter-)national folk scene. Using comparative examples drawn from the regional and international folk movements, the thesis contextualizes and differentiates the general trends within the second revival as a whole and its North Eastern manifestation. There are some evident discrepancies relating, for example, to levels of political involvement in the respective folk scenes but also broad similarities in chronological developments. These trends are explored through a number of themes, beginning with the weaving of a constructed regional folk-cultural identity out of a diversity of ethnic, local and occupational strands. Secondly, the common assumption that the North East is a region with a rare continuity of traditions is interrogated, alongside an acknowledgement that this was a time of rapid social change, mobility and dislocation from older cultural practices. The basic dichotomy of 'mediator' and `mediated' is questioned and found wanting, particularly in a region where young revivalists were rarely far — temporally, geographically or socially - from the source of their tradition. The ways in which the media represented and altered folk traditions, and how these representations were used to build regional consciousness is considered, as are the 1960s developments in heritage and tourism which saw vernacular culture taking on a much greater significance in the region's economy. Further, celebratory imagery is shown to have a long history in musical representations of the region, but with a contemporary focus on stoicism in the face of decline. Finally, the reasons behind the folklorists' imperative to locate the `authentic' are sought in relative degrees of alienation from contemporary society, resulting in a dissolution of the barriers between 'genuine' and 'invented' tradition.

Title: Politics of cinema under the Islamic Republic
Abstract: Based on ethnographically informed research, this thesis engages with the practices of production and reception of films in Iran and explores the politics of Iranian cinema in relation to its (post)revolutionary context. Arguing against the accepted views about film censorship in Iran, Chapter Two sheds light on the complexities in the workings of the Islamic state’s control of Iranian cinema.  It argues that in the absence of a clearly defined censorship code or a unitary censorship mechanism, there have been openings and opportunities for Iranian filmmakers to resist the state control and engage in social criticism. Examining the discourses around socially critical films, Chapter Three maintains that they are produced and received as a means to reflect upon the (post)revolutionary context. In addition, it examines how the filmmakers have used cinema as a means of consciousness raising in relation to social movements in Iran. Chapter Four explores the negotiations of gender at the moments of production and reception of the films about women’s issues.  The investigation shows that women engage with these films reflexively and in this process consider their personal experience as part of the larger political reality of the patriarchal order. In Chapter Five, the international prominence of Iranian cinema in relation to the politics of filmmaking and the discourses of identity is explored. This thesis concludes that owing to the complexities in the context of production and consumption of films in Iran, whether a film is political or not is difficult to determine from a distance by looking at film texts.  This is because researchers would run the risk of celebrating resistance where there may in fact be conformity or vice versa.

Title: ‘Something wicked this way comes’: the Russian delegation at the 1931 Second International Congress of the History of Science and Technology.
Abstract: The 1931 Second International Congress of the History of Science has acquired an iconic status in the modern discourse, yielding a plethora of misinterpretation and myth that serves to obscure the genuine significance and meaning of the event.  While many historians have viewed the congress from the perspective of the present, assuming a ‘quiet meeting of historians of science’ of standard academic character, its context and construction were nothing of the kind. Following the philosophical motivations of the organizing committee, especially the crucial figure of Charles Singer, the congress was designed to launch a public intellectual movement for the history of science.  The debates were carefully sequenced to demonstrate the contemporary and philosophical relevance of the history of science.  This thesis outlines Singer’s strategy and motivations. On the first day, a Russian delegation led by Nikolai Bukharin entered the arena.  Its composition reflected the fluid and complicated political situation facing Russian science, politics and philosophy during this period. There followed a series of debates on the relevance of the history of science and clashes on the political and social significance of the subject between the congress ‘mainstream’, the scientific left and the Russian delegation.  While some of this has been analysed in publication, there has never been detailed examination or even recourse to the proceedings record.  The most serious historical reinterpretation occurred regarding the Special Session, allegedly dedicated to the Russian delegation’s papers, which witnessed the crescendo of the confrontation between the Russians and Charles Singer.  This thesis outlines the developing controversies of the congress and an alternative account of the clash. The final level that reveals the unique character and timing of the congress is the social context of the event.  The thesis analyses the stream of social contexts affecting the event and the political consciousness of those present.

Title: Student teachers' attitudes to inclusion: implications for education in northern ireland
Abstract: The rationale for this research is based on an examination of student teachers’ attitudes towards inclusive education within the evolving educational environment of Northern Ireland. The overall aim was to investigate, identify, describe and analyse the key factors that influence student teachers’ attitudes, experiences and perceptions of inclusion during pre-service training.  The research is a case study.  The samples for the quantitative (n=125) and the qualitative (n=41; n=15) phases involved data collection through the use of a survey, a questionnaire, online discussion groups and interviews. One phase of the research is a small action research study involving a pedagogical intervention with the aim of improving practice. The research provides a singular viewpoint of a key stakeholder group and offers a unique and important contribution to the current international debate around issues relating to SEN and Inclusion. Findings provide evidence of positive attitudes towards the philosophy of inclusion with the majority of student teachers supporting the ideal of inclusive classrooms while finding the beliefs and aims behind the movement towards inclusion to be worthy.  Participants articulated the belief that inclusion was important for social integration and for building self-esteem, of upholding human rights and for promoting better understanding of diversity while offering equality of opportunity to all learners.  However, they also showed concern about how to make inclusion work in practice.  In common with many more experienced teachers they perceived difficulties in coping with large classes and in managing resources effectively.  At the end of the pre-service year while perceptions about personal efficacy had considerably increased, these anxieties remained. The effect of a successful teaching experience in a non-selective school had the most positive influence on perceived competency and on general attitudes towards inclusion.  This research concludes that those responsible for pre-service education in Northern Ireland should ensure that such school based experience is increased.

Title: Situated cosmopolitanisms: notions of the 'other' in contemporary discourses on cosmopolitanism in britain and germany
Abstract: The thesis proposes to understand contemporary discourses on cosmopolitanism in Britain and Germany as situated outlooks influenced by specific national cultures and nation state histories. These discourses are also embedded in the transition of the current nation state order that is driven by global capitalism and new forms of social and legal integration. Within Europe, the legal integration project of the European Union has to be regarded as at the core of these contemporary discourses. While situating discourses of cosmopolitanism historically, the thesis traces back dominant discourses of commercial (Britain) and cultural (Germany) cosmopolitanism that influence contemporary national outlooks of British (David Held, Chantal Mouffe and Homi K. Bhabha) and German voices Qiirgen Habermas, Ulrich Beck and Hanna Behrend). The main argument is that those discourses are framed by historical pathways, particular memories and national horizons situated differently in various countries, but also situated differently regarding the social locations of concrete intellectuals engaging in these discourses. Thus, the analysis of the different authors' writings pursues a double aim. On the one hand, it explores to what degree national discourses are situated as hegemonic public communicative sphere historically; on the other, it reveals how specific voices are situated individually within the larger discourse, thereby unearthing their contribution to confirming or challenging a hegemonic discourse. Most significantly, the Utopian vision of a cosmopolitan 'opening' that evolved during the 1990s shifted to a hegemonic ideological discourse of European 'closure' after 9/11 2001. The analysis reveals the appearance of a discourse of European cosmopolitanism conveying cultural Europeanisation. Apparently, this discourse neglects the problematic legacy of a distinction that was typical for the German discourse of the late 19 th and lasting until the mid of the 20th century, i.e. the distinction between the world citizen (Weltbürger)and the cosmopolitan (Koswopolit). The former had a positive connotation of mobility whereas the latter was used as an anti-Semitic signifier for Jews as unwanted 'wanderers'. The contemporary discourse conveys still biased meanings of 'mobility' and 'migration' being decisive for e.g. the notion of EU citizenship as die privileging frame of free movement constructing new insides and outsides of populations.

Title: Memories and the exigencies of national interest: an analysis of post-cold war sino-japanese and sino-russian strategic relations and perceptions
Abstract: The primary focus of this dissertation is to examine how social memories of major historical conflicts and confrontations affect the mutual strategic perceptions and the corresponding bilateral relations between China and her two closest neighbours - Japan and Russia. Despite the end of the Cold War and the demise of the Soviet threat, Japan has not moved away from the United States strategically in order to balance US hegemony in the Asia Pacific. Japan instead chose to reaffirm the US-Japan security alliance in order to balance against a perceived rising China. At the same time, Russia rather than forging a closer relationship with the United States as predicted, instead sought to form a "strategic partnership" with China to counter US hegemony. While structural realists tell us that these could be explained as strategic balancing acts of states (against hegemony or threat), structural realism does not tell us when states choose to balance against threats and when states choose to balance against hegemony. The theoretical lens of economic interdependency does not quite adequately accounts for the behavior of these states in the post Cold War era either. Russia and China befuddle economic interdependency theorists with their warm political ties and low key economic relations, as do China and Japan with their vibrant economic relations but appallingly estranged political relationship. Various studies have pointed to the "history" factor as being responsible for this state of affair, but given that both Japan and Russia have pursued imperialistic policies towards China in the past hundred years, why should the PRC have so much antagonism with Japan but paradoxically enjoy close ties with Russia. The thesis therefore attempts to answer the theoretical puzzle posed by this abnormal state of affairs in post Cold War Asia-Pacific International Relations. The basic research question therefore asks if states are capable of bearing "grudges", and if so, why and how does this affect their foreign and security policy. In other words, what impact do memories of past conflicts or antagonism have for the behaviour of states. Drawing from the Constructivist literature, the thesis attempts to fill a theoretical lacuna posited by this empirical puzzle. The thesis weld the notion of social memories to Constructivism and in doing so, reflect how this approach can help examine the strategic movements of China, Japan and Russia in post Cold War Asia-Pacific, which economic interdependency and structural realism cannot adequately explain. The thesis argues that it is important to understand national interests in the ideational sense as much as it is to understand it in the material sense (as advocated by structural realism). Therefore, defending elements of a country's national identity (e.g. saying that a "correct" vision of history should be adopted) would be as equally important as defending a country's material interests. The thesis argues for the importance of social memories as a crucial element behind the change and continuity in each country's national identities. Without understanding the social memories in each country, one would not be able to comprehend the changes behind the national identities espoused by these states and their evolving definition of national interests (hence perception of various issues). At the same time, since constructivism emphasises the dialectical interactions between agency and structure, social memories are therefore not just important for the constitution of a state's identity and interests but also provide a social structure that shapes the state's foreign policy and bilateral relations. By advancing the notion of social memories to understand the research problematic, the thesis shows that it is possible for the "grudge" to build up and persist well beyond the conclusion of a conflict or confrontation. The genesis of this "grudge" therefore depends on the level of reconciliation and subsequent interactions and discourse relating to the conflict or confrontation. All these interactions are remembered and deposited into the social memory of the country which subsequently influences the definition of national identity, national interests and nationalism. The thesis maintains that in the Sino-Japanese case, there is actually very little reconciliation, and even if diplomatic gestures are made at the governmental level, it does not have the "trickle down" effect on the Chinese and Japanese nations respectively. In doing so, the thesis demonstrates that social memories are intricately linked to a very divergent evolution of national identities and mutual negative images in post-Cold War Japan and China.

Title: Managing dissent: advocacy networks in the Brazilian Amazon and the Mediterranean
Abstract: Contestation to states can take many different organizational forms, from social movements to non-governmental organizations (NGOs).  Advocacy networks are linkages of these different types of contesting organizations.  As webs, their coordination and actions gain strength and legitimacy from each of their members and from their willingness to come together.  Their network structure, however, allows for flows of power and decision-making that defy previous ideas of organizational and political theorizations.  This thesis is about the political process within two sets of advocacy networks: one in the Brazilian Amazon and one in the Mediterranean.  In each setting, I observed the networks from within a single environmental NGO.  The reason behind this choice lies in the political ecology that views humanity's relationship with its surrounding environment, along with all its causalities and interconnections, as political.  From my observations, interviews, conversations, and consultation of documents, I can claim that these advocacy networks are a form of organized contestation that can manage dissent towards the state and its decisions.  This management of contestation can be directed towards different goals or ideals, either in line with those of the state or opposed to them.  For this reason, I believe it is extremely relevant to understand the flows of power within their web-like structure.  An anthropological approach can therefore unpack both their underlying Enlightenment ideas, as well as their organizational configuration.  The fact that advocacy networks have become prevalent and are transforming international politics is proof of their relevance as a complement, or shadow, of the state.

Title: The marginalised integration accounts of foreign-trained professional migrants in Canada: an analysis of structural and institutional barriers to integration
Abstract: This thesis interprets subjective migration and integration experiences of foreign-trained professional (FTP) migrants in Canada and explores the relevance of their accounts concerning immigration policy developments.   Empirical evidence suggests that despite the existing opportunities for FTP migrants' international movement, they experience gross disadvantages in the form of 'entry effect' and are deskilled by what is known as 'taxi driver phenomenon' in Canada.  This phenomenon has resulted in their limited participation within the Canadian labour market and the broader society. This study draws attention to the social and structural barriers FTP migrants have and are still encountering within the milieu of immigration policy and practices from 1969 to 2003.  It particularly draws attention to FTP migrants' general settlement needs; raises doubts about current immigration selection policy based on the points system and recent immigration dispersal framework, and contributes in building knowledge regarding the effectiveness of both strategies. Although the focus of the study is on 'micro' level of analysis, a post-structuralist approach is applied to explore the wider 'macro' , and 'meso' (socio-cultural, economic and structural) factors that form the context of these experiences.  Layder's (1993) conceptualisation of research analysis is used to understand the underlying relationship between structure (i.e. 'social context' and 'institutional setting' ) and agency (i.e. 'situated activity ' and 'individual agency' ) influencing migrants' individual experiences. Data was collected through three fieldwork periods in the summers of 2001 to 2003. The sample comprises 42 semi-structured, face-to-face interviews with FTP migrants with professional qualifications, five with local service providers, and a further three with local stakeholders in London, Ontario.

Title: Exhibiting practice: retrospective survey exhibitions of conceptual art, 1989-2000.
Abstract: In recent decades, the retrospective survey exhibition has become one of the primary sites for the presentation of art historical propositions. This thesis examines the contribution of four such exhibitions to a history of Conceptual art: L'Art Conceptuel, Une Perspective (Paris, 1989); Reconsidering the Object of Art, 1965-1975 (Los Angeles, 1995-96); Global Conceptualism: Points of Origin, 1950s-1980s ( New York, 1999); and Live in Your Head: Concept and Experiment in Britain, 1965-1975 (London, 2000). Through individual case studies, this thesis analyses the processes through which the history of this relatively recent art 'movement' has been elaborated. It seeks to understand how works of art can be accommodated to a museum-based art history and how they can be called upon to support particular curatorial narratives. At the same time, it considers to what extent they may be able to resist the conditions of display imposed upon them and may, instead, continue to signify independently of curatorial intention. In so doing, this thesis re-emphasizes the notion of critical practice, as well as the performative and discursive dimensions of Conceptual art that have often been passed over in historical exhibitions. It rejects the "oppositional" model of radical artists pitted against conservative institutions and argues for an understanding of Conceptual art based upon the recognition that claims for its independence from the institutional art world were made within the available rhetorics of a discourse that sustains the self-identities of both artists and institutions. Ultimately, this thesis reflects the understanding that to continue to regard artist and institution, artwork and exhibition, in their isolated functions is to fail to attend to the ways in which art, as a social practice may support broader ideological structures.

Title: The 3, 4, 5 literature: ideopolitical-moral education in mainland china as a barometer of political and economic change
Abstract: Moral education is inseparable from ideology and politics in China. This study investigates the rise and fall of the "3,4,5 literature" and its related movement. The "3,4,5 literature" (the New Three Character Classic, Four Character Song of Social Ethics and Five Character Rhyme of Family Ethics) were bestselling moral education texts generated in Guangdong, a southern SEZ, since the adoption of a policy of opening up the economy in 1978. This study employed the method of content analysis to identify distinctive values embedded in the 3,4,5 literature and other related moral texts. Major stakeholders involved in the development of the 3,4,5 literature were interviewed in order to understand the dynamic process of the 3,4,5 movement. In addition, documentary analysis was employed to show how the government's policy on ideopolitical-moral education led to the rise and the fall of the 3,4,5 literature and to assess the implications of the 3,4,5 literature for the government in formulating its subsequent policies in ideopolitical-moral education. The findings of this study indicated the pioneering role of the 3,4,5 literature in the reform of ideopolitical-moral education in China. Ideopolitical-moral education in China is currently characterized by concerns for students' psychological health, moral qualities, democracy and legal education rather than political themes. This study also shows that a de-politicization in ideopolitical-moral education resulted from decentralization, with greater autonomy granted to the regions. In turn, this made it possible to professionalize ideopolitical-moral education. The professionalisation made it possible to free ideopolitical-moral education from party dogma, in other words to secularise it. All this was made possible by the rapid social transition initiated by market-oriented reforms. Nevertheless, in spite of decentralization and regionalization, the national government remained highly influential. This study also reveals the sustaining power of traditional ethics in current ideopolitical-moral education and its power in maintaining official legitimacy and moral authority as China increasingly integrates with the global world economy. Finally, the study depicts the changes in methods of political socialization. These were initiated by economic liberalization rather than changes in political system. It is hoped that the findings will enhance the understanding of recent development of ideopolitical-moral education in China and add to existing knowledge of such research fields as culture, political socialization and soft-power.

Title: A comparison of patient functional characteristics and outcomes across two psychiatric outpatient programs: A continuing day treatment program and a psychsocial clubhouse
Abstract: Since the deinstitutionalization movement in the 1950s and 1960s, there has been a proliferation of community-based treatment programs and services. Many programs have been shown to be effective with some types of patients. However, it still is unknown which types of programs, services, and interventions are most appropriate for which types of patients, and which stages of their illnesses. Additionally, there is a growing body of evidence to suggest that most community-based programs are not implemented with the same commitment used in the clinical trials, which established their efficacy. Several questions remain, and are the focus of this study. First, is the multitude of community-based programs necessary or justifiable given the realities and limitations of rehabilitation psychiatry? Do most community-based psychiatry programs serve the same patients with the same results? Which patients benefit from community-based psychiatry programs and which do not? The objectives of this study are (1) to identify the type of Seriously Mentally Ill patient that is best served by two types of community-based treatment programs (a continuing day treatment program and a psychosocial clubhouse), and (2) to empirically establish a set of objective demographic and psychological predictors of success at the two types of programs. The study accomplished these objectives by comparing client and member functioning at a continuing day treatment program and a psychosocial clubhouse for patients who have been at one program or the other for a short period of time (less than three years) and a longer period of time (between three and six years). The study is a between-subject 2 X 2 design, in which the variables are program type and length of tenure in the program. Much of the data in the study was obtained from existing patient records from each program site. Additional information was gathered through a battery of tests and self-report measures, including: the Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale (BPRS), the Global Assessment Scale (GAS) portions of the Scale to Assess the Unawareness of Mental Disorder (SUMD), the Test of Nonverbal Intelligence second edition (TONI-2), the Social Adjustment Scale second edition (SAS-2), the Drug Attitude Inventory (DAI-30), the Level of Expressed Emotion Scale (LEE), and the Influential Relationships Questionnaire (IRQ). Data analysis was comprised of a series of correlation and two-way, between-subject ANOVAs based on a separate analysis for each of the dependent measures. The results of this study indicate that regardless of program type, individuals are hospitalized less with more years of participation, day treatment program clients report more trouble with substance abuse, clubhouse members have a better understanding of the need for medication and better adjustment to social and leisure time. Some characteristics were also found to be predictive of positive outcomes in either day treatment or clubhouse participation.

Title: A place for family farming: Food sovereignty in Uruguay
Abstract: In order to reverse the decline of small-scale farming in Latin America, many social movements on the political left are advocating "agroecology" and "food sovereignty". Agroecology is an approach that places biological and cultural diversity at the foundation of agricultural systems. The concept of food sovereignty relates to the orientation to international trade. Proponents of food sovereignty argue that the priority of food systems should focus on local producers and consumers, who should also decide how the system functions. In Uruguay, the creation of a citizens' proposal called "Sustainable Uruguay" has brought together rural and urban organizations in efforts to create an alternative plan for the country. A central principle is the need for national policies for food sovereignty. I carried out fieldwork to examine the connection between these ideas and the views and practices of horticultural family farmers in a locality in the northeast of the department of Canelones. This region has seen negative environmental impacts from the use of chemical fertilizers and monocropping. It was also affected by trade liberalization in the 1970s, which led to the collapse of a national agroindustry oriented to the domestic market. My analysis, based on research in the region and particularly with an organic cooperative, indicates that agroecology methods have been beneficial for farmer autonomy, health and environmental protection. Several of the local strategies and skills were crucial for making the transition to organic production. Vital to the relative success of organic producers has also been their participation in organizations to develop markets and to exert political influence. Many leaders of Uruguayan organizations representing small producers point out the cultural value of family farms and critique the production-driven model of agriculture. They demand differential policies for protection of family farms and for the revitalization of rural areas in general. Some rural organizations have begun to explore ideas relating to agroecology and food sovereignty, which push further the critique of industrial agriculture and commonly-accepted notions of development. These organizations collaborate with environmental and union organizations that espouse these views and that are part of international networks, such as those that participate in Sustainable Uruguay forums. This thesis presents two interlinked elements key to the collaboration between organizations in Sustainable Uruguay: its methods and the framing and substance of its proposals. The horizontal and long-term nature of the participatory methods has been essential to be able to overcome divisions and foster common understanding and collaboration. The food sovereignty proposal has become the backbone of the forum's platform on agriculture because it is an idea that responds to the needs and demands of the workers, farmers and environmentalists involved. Such alliances may be significant for helping to bridge the rural-urban divisions that exacerbate neglect of the crisis in family farming. Crucial to this effort, I argue, is an understanding of the cultural and affective relations between farmers and their homes and livelihoods.

Title: The homiletic dimension of small Christian communities
Abstract: This thesis project explores the homiletic dimension of small Christian communities and proposes strategies to enhance the quality of their preaching conversations. Chapter one lays a solid theological foundation for understanding preaching as conversation by using David Tracy's work on conversation and theological method to construct a theology of preaching. Chapter two begins with a brief history of the development of small Christian communities in the United States and the influence of RENEW International on their emergence. It then examines the key facets of the liturgical homily as restored by the Second Vatican Council and shows how these facets are operative in small Christian communities today. Chapter three presents a contextual biblical hermeneutical process that is informed by conversation and grounded in praxis based on the work of philosophers Hans-Georg Gadamer, Paul Ricœur, and South African biblical scholar Gerard West. This process addresses the weaknesses in the homiletic dimension of small communities---the lack of critical analysis of Scripture, the hearer's cultural context, and a movement toward social action. Chapter four applies the theoretical groundwork laid by the first three chapters to the development of a faith-sharing resource entitled Word Alive: Conversations on the Sunday Gospels, Advent, Year C . These four sessions included as Appendix A are designed for small Christian communities to test whether intentionally adding to the preaching conversation a critical study of Scripture in dialogue with the American context will improve the quality of the group's homiletic experience. Chapter five reports on and draws conclusions from the Word Alive survey results. It indicates areas for further exploration regarding continuing ways to strengthen the preaching conversation in small Christian communities and implications for the enhancement of liturgical preaching.
