Title: Red pulp: Repression and radicalism in mid-twentieth century United States "genre" fiction
Abstract: Red Pulp recuperates, resituates, and re-evaluates the voluminous mid-century mass culture production of a series of once-popular, subsequently suppressed left-wing U.S. writers of "genre" fiction. More specifically, it is to date the first full-length, close study of three different re-emerging progressive, anti-racist writers of this period: Guy Endore, Paul William Ryan, and Len Zinberg. Doubly derided by critics and censors as "Red" and as "pulp" writers, the subjects of my study deserve critical and popular reconsideration, I argue, for reasons political, historical, and literary. All three writers' work defies current categorizations of American Left writing, combining, in heretofore unnoticed ways, explicitly radical, proletarian and anti-racist social commentary, modernist formal experimentation, and sensational, at times seemingly conservative, even reactionary aspects of "pulp"—that is, hard-boiled, detective, adventure, and horror fiction. My study of these writers' varied work, work which was often produced under pseudonyms, and in contexts conditioned by political persecution, calls into question prevalent historical notions of how the "Old" Left related to mass culture, how it thought about race, racism, and imperialism, and of how successfully the Communist cultural Left's opposition to U.S. racism was "silenced" during the Cold War. In chapter one I critically review the scholarly literature regarding the generic tendencies, limitations, and politics of "pulp fiction" as a subset of mass-cultural forms. I engage with Marxist cultural theorists such as Fredric Jameson, Ernest Mandel, Antonio Gramsci, and Teodor Adorno, as well as figures within and American and cultural studies such as Michael Denning, and recent reader-response, and working-class studies interpreters of pulp fiction, such as Erin Smith. Synthesizing and complicating each of these theorists take on pulp, I argue for an understanding of pulp fiction as a contradictory medium for the articulation of left-wing politics to an American mass audience in the early-to-mid Twentieth Century. I further track this account of pulp fiction in relationship to the ongoing literary-historical recovery and revaluating work being done on the U.S. Literary Left. Barbara Foley, Denning, Alan Wald and others in this vein have documented and begun to map the complicated and long-suppressed terrain of American literary radicalism of the mid-20 th century. Red Pulp is an effort to complicate and expand our understanding of proletarian or revolutionary American fiction beyond the overly narrow notion of the term currently either affirmed (or more often, dismissed) by contemporary scholars and critics of the period. In each subsequent chapter of Red Pulp, I examine these left literary works in close detail. I demonstrate in each case how the work of Endore, Zinberg, and Ryan, is sophisticated, self-reflexive, and ironic in ways not previously noticed. I further argue that returning left-wing, Jewish, and working-class writers, such as Guy Endore, Len Zinberg, and Paul William Ryan, to the "pulp" contexts and discourses where they belong forces us to rethink the status of these popular discourses and their historical development. In chapters two through four I turn to the life and works of Guy Endore, author of among other novels, the best-selling horror "classic" Werewolf of Paris (1933) and Babouk (1934), a sensational, experimental historical novel about the Haitian Revolution. Endore's work and its reception reveal both the tremendous possibilities but also the formidable dangers and limitations of appropriating conservative established mass-cultural generic confines for "progressive" ends. Positioning Endore biographically, politically, and discursively, in part through the examination of materials unearthed by original archival research at the Endore Papers held at UCLA, I argue that he occupied a productively liminal location within/without the burgeoning American mass culture industries, and the growing Communist-led cultural movement of the Depression. In each of these three chapters I position Endore's work in relationship to a different mass-popular genre; historical fiction, horror fiction, US colonialist writing on Haiti, respectively. In chapters five and six I turn to the work of Paul William Ryan, who maintained dual, concurrent—and I argue, interrelated—writing careers: as a West Coast proletarian journalist, political poet, and pamphleteer, under the name "Mike Quin," and as a successful writer of pulp fiction novels immediately after WWII and on the cusp of the Cold War under the pseudonym "Robert Finnegan." In chapter seven and eight I examine the voluminous literary production of Len Zinberg, better known as international best-selling pulp writer, "Ed Lacy." Zinberg's early works such as his anti-racist boxing thriller Walk Hard-Talk Loud (1939), and his critical bilndungsroman of an ex-radical journalist, Hold with the Hares (1947) reveal sophisticated but explicit left-critiques of American society, while his later pulp works maintain a subtle, subversive, at time subdued, but nonetheless consistent left commentary on U.S. post-war racism, imperialism, and American Big Business. (Abstract shortened by UMI.)

Title: After the rain: Surrealism and the post-World War II avant-garde, 1940–1950
Abstract: This dissertation focuses on the shifting position of French Surrealism during World War II and its immediate aftermath. My historical and contextual analysis examines what was at stake for the Surrealists faced with exile, clandestine activities conducted by Main à Plume during the German Occupation, and a radically changed postwar cultural milieu. I scrutinize Surrealist practice as visual strategy, intellectual history, political engagement, and cultural critique. Postwar Surrealism established its position in relation to the strategies of Jean-Paul Sartre's Existentialism, the cultural policies of the French Communist Party (P.C.F.) articulated by Louis Aragon, and the re-emerging Parisian avant-garde. I analyze how artists, writers, and group exhibitions made concrete the expanded wartime boundaries of the movement and how physical sites of exile informed Surrealist activities. War-era journals—View, VVV, and Dyn—provided intellectual spaces for the promotion of both Surrealist ideas and dissent among members of the group. I also consider André Breton's search for a new Surrealist myth, an inquest that paralleled the contemporary preoccupation with mythical subjects among Abstract Expressionists such as Adolph Gottlieb, Barnett Newman, and Jackson Pollock. To address the Surrealists' return to France, I utilize the sociological theory of boundary disputes to assess how postwar ideological clashes established parameters of debates. Significantly, I argue that the Communist and Existentialist intelligentsia defined themselves in relation to the Surrealists, and kept the group in public view until its first exhibition of the postwar period, Surrealism in 1947. The poetic origins, international roster, and critical reception of the exhibition, which promoted esotericism and mythical initiation, are examined as well. Shifting postwar definitions of 'real' and 'realism' are also analyzed, and the approach of Surrealist artists and writers—Georges Bataille, Victor Brauner, Charles Duits, Jindrich Heisler, and Toyen, among others—is compared with that of Socialist Realism (adopted as official P.C.F. policy in 1947) and the brute materialism of Jean Dubuffet. In the broadest terms, this dissertation explores to what extent artistic practice can be bound to social practice, and how the Surrealists modified yet maintained their carefully crafted revolutionary mantle.

Title: Suzanne Noël: Beauty, feminism, and cosmetic surgery in early twentieth century France
Abstract: In this dissertation I examine the life of Suzanne Noël (1878-1954) who was both a feminist and a cosmetic surgeon. Although it may appear that a combined representation of both the beliefs of a modern French feminist and that of a pioneer and innovator of cosmetic surgical procedures are diametrically challenging, in reality they were both embodied and exemplified by Noël. This dissertation places Dr. Suzanne de Noël in the history of plastic surgery as an innovator, promoter, and popularizer. Her life is set within the context of a beauty culture as it was formulated in early twentieth century France and within the context that was understood as the "New Woman" who was not only the image of energetic beauty, intellectual competency, but who gregariously took new liberties within the social arena. This dissertation is organized into six chapters. In chapters one and two I examine the bibliography of Noël and her place in the historiography of the History of Medicine. Chapter three is an analysis of her work in regard to the Soroptimist International which she helped found. In chapter four I develop a correlation between the rise of a beauty culture in France and the effect that culture had on Noël and her profession as a cosmetic surgeon. In chapter five I explore Noël's discourse through her cosmetic surgical publications and text. In chapter six I surmise that it was in part her gender that helped make Noël one of the most notable cosmetic surgeons in the world during her time. I argue that the feminist movement in France at the turn of the century had a direct impact on her view that economic independence was one of the most valuable assets a woman could have. She believed that in her role as a plastic surgeon she helped women attain and retain that independence.

Title: Anthropogenic influences on the behavior of large carnivores in the northern Serengeti ecosystem
Abstract: Most large mammalian carnivores are in global decline, largely due to habitat loss and their involvement in livestock depredation. Increasingly, large carnivores are forced to adjust to living in landscapes characterized by human activity and disturbance. It is therefore critical to understand both the extent to which carnivores can adjust to human activities and the factors influencing human tolerance of their presence. Here I document the activity patterns and space use of three social groups, or clans, of spotted hyenas ( Crocuta crocuta ) in the Masai Mara National Reserve, Kenya that vary in exposure to humans, and investigate the degree to which these behaviors are influenced by human activity, primarily in the form of livestock grazing. I also investigate the issue of local tolerance of carnivores with an intensive study of livestock depredation. Hyenas were active during 31.5 ± 2.7% of the 24-h period, and 96.2 ± 0.9% of all activity occurred from 1800-0900 h. Male spotted hyenas tended to be more active, and exhibit higher movement rates than females. Female hyenas in territories with daily livestock grazing showed lower activity and den use than hyenas in an undisturbed territory during the times of day when livestock grazing coincided with potential hyena activity. Space use patterns of hyenas with no exposure to livestock grazing were influenced by the location of the communal den, and the distribution of prey, vegetation types, and water features within their territory. Relative to this clan, hyenas exposed to livestock grazing showed a stronger avoidance of open grass plains and a weaker association with prey resources and den location. However, the distribution of livestock did not directly influence hyena space use patterns, indicating that increased use of vegetative cover by hyenas may be an important behavioral shift allowing temporary coexistence with livestock and their herdsmen. Hyena home range size, core area size, and core area location were influenced by the presence of a refuse pit at the edge of one study clan's territory. The most common rank group utilizing the pit was low-ranking females, and regular pit users were more likely to be found near the pit during times of relative prey scarcity. These results indicate that human refuse at pastoral villages may increase hyena use of these environments, and that this use may vary on a seasonal and individual level. Spotted hyenas, leopards ( Panthera pardus ) and lions ( Panthera leo ) were responsible for 53%, 32%, and 15% of attacks on livestock, respectively, that were documented along a Reserve border. Monthly depredation frequency was correlated positively with rainfall and negatively with natural prey abundance. The spatial location and size of local villages, and the fence type used at livestock enclosures influenced the vulnerability of these locations to livestock losses, with leopards and hyenas showing clear differences in selection of attack locations. Overall, improved fences, more watch dogs, and high levels of human activity were not associated with lower livestock losses to predators.

Title: Peasant mobilization, land reform and agricultural co-operativism in Brazil: The case of the Landless Rural Workers Movement (MST), 1984–2004
Abstract: This dissertation examines the interplay of peasant mobilization, land reform and agricultural co-operativism in Brazil from 1984 to 2004. Its context is the Landless Rural Workers Movement (MST), which is considered the most dynamic force for progressive social change in Latin America today. This dissertation uses an integrated macro-micro theoretical perspective in order to examine peasant mobilization, agrarian reform, and co-operative formation from a more balanced and nuanced approach. The integrated neo-Marxist and Sustainable Rural Livelihoods (SRLs) theoretical approach is supported by fieldwork in three Brazilian states (Paraná, São Paulo, and Goiás). Its central thesis is as follows: the MST's community-based model of land reform has great potential for effectively promoting SRLs. Yet, in the long-term, without ongoing state and international support, the MST has limited capacity for sustaining, let alone furthering, this model of land reform. Brazil has historically been a country with highly concentrated landownership. Chronic landlessness, increased rural poverty, and eventually environmental destruction, intensified in the 1960s and subsequent decades with the introduction of agricultural modernization. Globalization has further accentuated this situation. Currently, almost 46 percent of the country's total registered agricultural land belongs to less than 1 percent of landowners, over 20 million rural people live in abject poverty, and more than 4 million families are landless. The MST has vigorously contested this situation. It has effectively practiced the politics of land occupation to advance a luta pela terra (the struggle for land). It has also eagerly cultivated the politics of agricultural co-operativism to advance a luta na terra (the struggle on the land). However, the processes of land occupation and co-operative formation have often been difficult, conflict-ridden, and, in some cases, divisive. Also, limited access to financial, educational, technological, and commercialization resources has significantly contributed to the MST's difficulties. Despite setbacks, limitations, and uncertainties, the MST has established an effective, grassroots, community-based model of land reform that offers great potential for reducing structural poverty and food insecurity, enhancing peasant identity, strengthening democratic participation, and promoting environmental conservation in rural Brazil. The main conclusions of this dissertation are seventh-fold: first, land reform has had a limited impact on land inequality and rural poverty; second, concerted peasant mobilization is fundamental to achieving access to resources necessary for SRLs; third, the nurturing of a culture of co-operation and the culture of solidarity are vital to enhancing community participation in the pursuit of SRLs; fourth, the promotion of SRLs is inherently a political and conflictual process; fifth, interpersonal and group conflicts obstruct the pursuit of SRLs; sixth, the incorporation of principles of conflict resolution or conflict management into SRLs approaches is essential to overcoming internal obstacles; and seventh, the state has to play a major role in supporting community-based SRLs by providing access to financial, educational, technological, and human resources.

Title: Radical form, political intent: Delineating countercinemas beyond Godard
Abstract: This study argues that "countercinema" describes a fluid, potentially global practice which integrates radical formal intervention with political intent, in historically specific contexts. This practice both limits and expands past and present applications of the term. It includes more than the list of formal characteristics with which Peter Wollen (accurately) characterizes Godard's countercinema in 1972, but limits countercinema to those films which are formally radical, politically-minded and historically specific, rather than any film or practice which is non-patriarchal, non-capitalist and/or non-Hollywood. Countercinema is more specific than "art cinema," "world cinema" or "independent film," and while it crosses those categories, it cannot be cleanly encompassed by any of them. Even Hollywood produces countercinema. This study includes films from the sixties to the nineties, further detaching countercinema not only strictly from Godard's practice but also from the specific mass-social politics of the sixties. The five case studies undertaken in this study include countercinema produced by Godard in France, Glauber Rocha in Brazil, Dusan Makaejev in Yugoslavia, Chantal Akerman in Belgium and New York, and Gregg Araki in Los Angeles. Ranging from new wave movements to national cinema to minimalist feminism and New Queer Cinema, these case studies are deployed to argue that "countercinema" is a valuable term useful for describing a specific kind of political film-making and that such film-making can be located (both in the present and in the past) by its radical form, political intent and historical specificity.

Title: Coca leaf and sindicato democracy in the Bolivian Yungas: The Andeanization of Western political models and the rise of the New Left
Abstract: In 1953, Bolivia's indigenous peasantry carried out one of Latin America's most successful agrarian reforms, in which the Spanish feudal system was abolished. In place of the hacienda estates in the highland Yungas region were established rural Aymara communities with a novel form of political economic organization: European syndicalism. Over the next 50 years, this system originally designed for Western labor unions was adapted to meet the exigencies of semi-subsistence livelihoods and turned into functioning structures for rural community government, called sindicatos. As these communal systems lay outside the formal state structure, the rise of sindicalismo also represented the formation of civil society in the Yungas after four centuries of colonialism and elite republicanism. Coca leaf has been cultivated for a millennium in the Yungas, which is now the primary legal zone to supply Bolivia's domestic markets for medicinal, nutritional, and ceremonial uses of the leaf. Coca has also been targeted for eradication in the U.S. “war on drugs,” sparking fierce resistance by the sindicatos to defend the economic mainstay of Yungas campesinos. The symbolic force of the “sacred leaf” combined with cultural memories of historical Aymara revolutionary heroes have helped to organize the Yungas sindicatos into one of the country's most influential social movements. This dissertation argues that the methods of sindicato resistance are gleaned from long traditions of democratic governance, drawing on both labor union syndicalism and the ancient Aymara ayllu system. Coca leaf has provided an especially potent impetus for campesino advocacy in the Yungas, placing the sindicatos at the center of civil society efforts to counterbalance the power of the state and international interests. Bolivia's neoliberal political reforms via the Law of Popular Participation of 1994 and the Law of Citizen Groups and Indigenous Peoples of 2004 expanded the range of options for civil society participation in local and national government. These structural changes enhanced the ability of the sindicatos to defend the coca economy and promote new policies for the leaf through democratic political engagement. Anthropology has only recently become devoted to the ethnographic analysis of democracy, which has deepened the study of the diverse methods, discourses, and structural potentials for democratic organization across historical cultural contexts. This dissertation contributes to this emerging practice by showing not only how Yungas sindicalismo is a viable form of community democracy, but also how its role as a principal civil society actor is helping to strengthen (and hybridize) Bolivia's precarious democratic traditions at the municipal and national levels. With the election of Evo Morales to the presidency in December 2005, it is also clear that agrarian sindicalismo has directly contributed to the rise of the new Left in Bolivia.

Title: Communal violence in Gujarat: Rethinking the role of communalism and institutionalized injustices in India
Abstract: Five years have passed since Narendra Modi's, Bharatiya Janata Party state government unleashed an ethnic genocide/pogrom against the Muslims in Gujarat. This thesis explores communal violence between Hindus and Muslims in Gujarat, uncovering its history and impact on inter-communal relations, as well as approaches to prevention. The causes of communal violence are assessed by examining conflict theory, communalism, and communal violence in India through testimonies and interviews of victims/survivors of communal violence. The state government's institutionalization of communalism and communalization as a process, as well as their impact on society are analyzed exposing and outlining communalist tactics in an effort to understand its advocates' strategic successes. Resistance to the communalization process is also examined through interviews with members of the anti-communalization movement and a discussion of their respective programs and activities in order to determine the latter's type and level of impact on the occurrence of communal violence. Recommendations on approaches to preventing communal violence include: (1) initiating a process through which justice and reconciliation can be sought by and for victims/survivors and perpetrators, (2) resisting further communalization and polarization of society, (3) implementing mechanisms of early warning and detection of genocide, 1 and (4) promoting a culture of social justice, human rights, and equality of all citizens. The lessons learned through the case of Gujarat are important for assessing other conflicts of deeply divided societies by highlighting the integral role of the state, as well as individuals or movements who have vested interests or benefit directly from conflict as units of analysis. Thus, this study calls on scholars of peace and conflict resolution to incorporate a particular lens or paradigm into their methodology by asking: Who is benefiting from this conflict? How can conflicts become less profitable? 1 For the purposes of this paper the terms genocide, massacre, pogrom, and carnage will be used interchangeably to refer to the genocide that took place in Gujarat in 2002. In Chapter 3 Theoretical Approaches to Inter-Communal Conflict, the case for how the violence that took place in Gujarat, in 2002, was genocide according to international legal definitions of genocide.

Title: Servant-leadership. Shifting paradigms/empowering people: A content analysis of servant-leadership
Abstract: This is a study of the sociology of culture and the dissemination of servant-leadership philosophy within our institutions. Robert Wuthnow's work is framed within the context of cultural structuralism. Wuthnow's cultural analysis theory synthesizes several theoretical traditions. His work is a blend of dramaturgy, institutional analysis, and subjective approaches (Turner, 1998:504). We will explore the reinforcing collective values of servant-leadership, the embellishment of certain messages within servant-leadership, and the particular activities which produce the system of cultural codes and facilitate their integration into institutions within our society. The founder of servant-leadership philosophy, Robert Greenleaf (1904-1990), was employed by American Telephone and Telegraph and worked within the management, research development, and education departments of the company. Upon his retirement from AT&T, Greenleaf started down his second career path as a teacher and consultant, working with a wide range of institutions from The Harvard Business School to the Ford Foundation, including visiting lecturer at Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Sloan School of Management and teaching positions at both Dartmouth College and the University of Virginia (www.areenleaf.org ). Robert Greenleaf coined the term "Servant-Leadership" and developed the philosophy of servant-leadership. During the 1960s, the civil unrest that plagued the country's universities and communities was alarming to Greenleaf and inspired him to write his first essay on the philosophy of Servant-Leadership. "The Servant as Leader" is the 37-page manuscript that sparked an international movement that is referred to as "Servant-Leadership". We will explore the themes of servant-leadership and examine how they have evolved into a belief system. Wuthnow's view that moral codes are " a set of cultural elements that define the nature of commitment to a particular course of behavior " (Turner, 1998:505) is critical to our quest. This paper also includes an analysis of selected cultural institutions in order to determine the extent of the dissemination and its evolution from a philosophy into an institutionalized leadership model. Many organizations have experienced dramatic transformations since passing into the new millennium. We can assume that leadership is also manifesting change. Many people in positional power still behave in a manner which is commensurate with their past experience and their requirements for success. That model, however, belongs to an earlier era. Our current era is in transition. It appears to be concerned with "empowering" leadership. The leadership styles which have flowed from our past paradigms are possibly problematic in creating the kind of organization that will thrive in our increasingly globalized society. Consistent with the theories that focus on a leader's qualities, servant-leadership addresses the leader's personal characteristics. Such characteristics may be developed by anyone with a commensurate value system. Wuthnow addresses three aspects that are " critical to structuring the moral order: (1)  Moral objects versus real programs , (2)  core self versus enacted social roles , and (3)  inevitable constraints versus intentional options " (Turner, 1998:505). The "old school" view of leaders singled out specific attributes as "dynamic", "charismatic", and other "force-of-personality" factors which appeared to be "natural born" traits rather than acquired ones (Shamir, House, Arthur, 1993:577-594). The new calling for servant-leaders looks instead to the traits that flow from a natural, deeply held belief system which identifies the worth of a person. Therefore, a leader's traits remain an important factor, but in the servant-leadership paradigm, any person may cultivate the desired traits as he or she draws from a set of fundamental precepts that dissolve borders and transcend race and culture (www.green leaf.org). Wuthnow's stated that ideologies are " vehicles for change in the moral order because the moral order is altered through the development and subsequent institutionalization of new ideologies " (Turner, 1998:507) Servant-leadership cuts across the traditional authoritarian leadership theories and provides a new foundational philosophy that emphasizes principles congruent with human growth. In addition to similarities with the trait theories, servant-leadership is similar to behavioral theories, in that the leader's behavior is of critical importance. The old saying, "Management sets the precedence", is absolute within the servant-leadership philosophical model. This is an exploration into the applications of servant-leadership within corporate, non-profit, and educational institutions. The basis for this content analysis is an examination of the cultural context of servant-leadership using the primary material and artifacts. We will address the processes in which the production and institutionalization of the servant-leadership ideology is transmitted and implemented within these organizations using Robert Wuthnow's cultural analysis theories.

Title: Destination Italy: Tourism, colonialism, and the modern Italian nation-state, 1861–1947
Abstract: This dissertation demonstrates that modern mass tourism was a key discourse that created a set of representational and economic practices critical to the making of modern Italy. Since the mid-nineteenth century, Italy's history as a nation-state has been characterized by belatedness, regional fragmentation, and political instability. Both foreign and Italian tourists, however, encountered a culturally unified nation with a heritage of imperial grandeur and artistic patrimony. My dissertation combines historical, literary, and anthropological methodologies to show that tourism allowed for an imagined community powerful enough to overcome modern Italy's fragmented political identity. Part I explores how the political rhetoric of the Risorgimento—Italy's national unification movement in the mid-nineteenth century—paradoxically celebrated and refused the nation-state. At odds are the rhetoric of poiesis, which insists that Italy is something to be made, and the rhetoric of negation, which maintains that Italy can never exist given its regional, social, and linguistic differentiation. Chapter 1 clarifies the origin of a phrase that has been central to Italy's nation-making project: "With Italy made, [we] must now make the Italians." The phrase is often attributed to senator Massimo D'Azeglio circa 1866, but recent scholarship has implied that he never uttered it in that form. I trace the permutations of the phrase through the publication history of D'Azeglio's Ricordi , its resurfacing in the writings of Ferdinando Martini at the fin-de-siècle, and finally its re-appropriation by Gabriele D'Annunzio and the fascist government in the 1920s and 1930s. Chapter 2 shows that by the late nineteenth century Italy becomes framed in terms of decline and decadence; it is no longer a nation of growth, progress, and expansion, but rather one defined by difference and backwardness. I reveal how semantic shifts in concepts such as "patria" and "nation" from the late Renaissance through the Risorgimento evolved into the rhetoric of negation, which continues to punctuate contemporary political debates about modern Italy. Part II shows how the practices of mass tourism in the nineteenth century by foreigners and Italians alike conditioned a cohesive imagined community that challenged the unstable political conceptions of the nation-state. Chapter 3 details the arrival of modern mass tourism on the Italian peninsula in 1864. It first considers the forms of proto-tourism—pilgrimage, commerce, and the Grand Tour—that foreshadowed the itineraries and practices of later "mass tourists." The last half of the chapter explores the role of British tour operator Thomas Cook in establishing a tourism industry in Italy, and consequently, how Cook and his tourists encouraged and accelerated Italian national unification. Chapter 4 explores the development of an organized Italian domestic tourism industry, beginning in 1894 with the founding of the Touring Club Italiano (TCI). I show how the patriotic aims of the TCI laid the foundation for the state organization of tourism circa 1920 and eventually, its manipulation by Mussolini's regime to advance fascist agendas. In Part III, I explore the transition from nation to empire with Italian tourists traveling to their colonies in the 1920s and 1930s, particularly to Rhodes and Libya. Here, Italian tourists encountered an incongruous "Italy": one that was simultaneously their own modern, powerful, fascist nation-state and an exotic, primitive, unconquerable Other. I find that tourism conditioned Italy's imperialist project, and in each site, it presaged the transnational flows of globalization. Chapter 5 details the development of the Italian tourism industry on Rhodes, the capital of Dodecanese Islands, and specifies the representations and practices that constructed an "Italian Rhodes." It shows how the idea of "mare nostrum" and its link to former empires—Rome, Venice, and Christianity—shaped Italy's imperial attitude. Similarly, Chapter 6 explores the representations, and to some extent, the practices of Italian colonial tourism in Libya. Libya was the locus for Italian imperialism, which was simultaneously oriented toward the past, ancient Rome, and the future, Mussolini's fascist Empire. Tourists perpetuated the syncretisms inherent in colonial rule, bringing the colony home with their postcards and narratives. At the same time, these tourists embedded "Italy" into a system of cultural flows and asymmetries of power characteristic of a new global order, or, another form of "Empire."

Title: Study on Make Decision in Reservoir Resettlement Modes based on the Analytic Hierarchy Process
Abstract: Reservoir resettlement is an important part for the construction of hydraulic and hydroelectric engineering Project, and is a heavy and organized population movement caused by the construction of dydraulic resource project during the process of development and utilization of water resources. It has non-resource nature, also is a complex system project concern to many aspects, such as society, economy, resource, enviroment, etc. Whether dealing with the resettlement issue properly will be directly related to immigrants living standards and the stability of region even the country, the success or failure of the project construction, the smoothing achievement of constructing harmonious society in our country and the goal of ensuring our people a relatively comfortable life. This paper discussed the scientific decision-making methods of selecting reservoir resttlement modes, and then carried out the empirical studies. Based on the brief analysis of reservoir resettlement characteristics, this paper elaborated the resettlement methods like social security, shareholders dividends and long-term compensation to soilless resettlement for reservoir immigrants, and the methods like nearby or near to agriculture resettlement, local agriculture resettlement and relocation agriculture resettlement to soil resettlement for reservoir immigrants. The paper summarily analized the operation methods, strengths and weaknesses, and the constrains of various resettlement modes. Reservoir resettlement is not only a simple relocation process, but also includes the sustainable development requirements that make the the living of immigrants meet or exceed their original level. Therefore, combined with sustainable development theory and reservoir resettlement theory, this paper discussed five inffluent factors which affects the selections of the reservoir immigrants resettlement modes, they are society, economy, resource, enviroment and management level. This paper is based on the actual situation that mainly using soil resettlement and combining with other resettlement modes in our country, the resettlement principle of minimize risk and sustainable development, and related policies. It linked up with the Sustainability and Well-being Assesment (SAWA) proposed by the International Union for Conservation of Nature(IUCN) and the International Development Research Centre (IDRC), the DSR model (Drive force - State - Response) proposed by Commission on Sustainable Development (DCS), and the sustainable model proposed by Scientific Committee on Problems of the Environment (SCOPE), and accorded with the IRR model proposed by Prof. Michael M.Cernea, fully considered the risks, impoverishment and reconstruction issues during process of reservoir resettlement, prevented the ten risks mentioned by T. Downing. This paper adopted the methods which combined macroscopic and microcosmic analysis, quantitative and qualitative analysis, builds up the target system of selection of resettlement modes. It built up AHP (The Analytic Hierarchy Process)model, used the expert grade methods of 1-9 scale to obtain judgement matrix, take the identity test on the matrix, and then calculated each matrix, confirmed the hierarchy single rank and hierarchy overall rank. At last, this paper made the empirical analysis, tested the rationality and availability by considering the Liangshan state reservoir resettlement.

Title: By Network Right of Privacy Legal Protection
Abstract: Our country that have long of cultural traditions, the hole rule which the whole national ideological trend developing and gradual progress by traditions thought. Its behavior mode makes people ignore the protection of one's own personal secrets, which cause China's personal secrets with long-term traditional culture to lack the location of privacy. In addition, from self-sufficient natural economy and the social structure to the patriarchal clan system family. From the centralization of state power political mode to the spirit of difference quality that agricultural ideology of plough patriarchal clan system of the kindling material quality has caused legal culture. What people ignored to one's own right is safeguarded, who does not know where to begin especially in protecting the right of privacy. What is more, we may pay attention to the people's faint legal consciousness in dense tradition. And founded a state on initial stage the frequent political movement delayed the process of law construction to a certain extent again. The existence consciousness of the right of privacy has been in the state of freezing all the time either. The appearance and history and culture of the country of personal secrets are inseparable, which in close relation with whole consciousness structure of people of a country. However, because China have rigorously enforce the individual rights of meaning ancient time. Certainly, which do not have the most genuine right of privacy either. Through our consciousness review the human development history now, we can say since having social activities of individual people, which have individual privacy, but the result when developing that the real protection of the right of privacy is civilization modern times. It is the result that citizen's societies developed constantly. China is a heavy-population country; it is the guarantee that the society develops normally to protect the personal secrets of every citizen. It is an inexorable trend developed in era, especially the development at a high speed with global economy. The economic individual depends on the network to link up each other more and more. In addition, with the popularizing constantly of Hi-Tech, the network, electronic computer wide application. The development model and the network with unreasonable legal construction, protect citizen's right of privacy of our country to become the task of top priority in the environment of the network. Right of privacy mean natural person one's own personal private business, personal life know, forbid right who others interfere for others by feeling things in the field personal information, etc. The personal secrets of the network mean that citizens private life secret in Internet are not interfered, spied upon illegally by him, personal data information and other resources closely related to personal information are not searched, spied, make public and utilize illegally by him. Network involve mainly by content that personal secrets protect. The individual privacy that should be protected that some information among them belongs to the general meaning, information it belongs to be can have been at others at normal information who way wins, this part of information can be gotten, known, but the information provider can control others' use and get by others in the network. In a word, at present while the network develops rapidly, not only it is convenient to utilize the network to offer all sorts of human, but also want too. We can't deny the superiority of the network because of what the network causes difficult problem. The formulation and development of any technology will all meet the same question, which will need the law to give correct one direction. Maintain the normal development in order of the network. Keep a relatively legal and rational private space on the cyberspace; keep the individual's information of personal secrets. The ones that ensured personal private life are peaceful, protect the personal inner world and are not interfered for any reason by the external world. Guarantee that the personal information is not spread and spread it maybe is illegally, all play a role in can't be underestimate in maintaining common preface good custom of the modern society and stability development. Modern societies governed by law society, however, come and maintain individual privacy not merely one a piece of social morals issues era network through law, It is even more a legal problem needing to receive settlement urgently. Accelerating development of modern information technology is being brought to mankind and improving enormously, the impact that brings to human personal secrets life too, the ones that therefore formed to right of privacy challenge greatly, it behaves in following several mainly: 1. The individual privacy that the network system is caused by itself encroaches right; 2. Utilize resources of the network to encroach on others' personal secrets; 3. The special subject infringes the individual privacy through the means of the network. This text will be described in detail. This text has also introduced the relevant legislation protected to the right of privacy of the network both at home and abroad; there are the relevant regulations of U.S.A., European Union, Canada, Japan, Switzerland, France, and Taiwan of our country and the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region of our country mainly. The legislation of the above-mentioned countries has characteristics each, there are pros and cons each, worth drawing lessons from our country. European Union and Canada legislate and make network collect user personal the behavior standards of information materials by facilitator by government, this is favorable to emergence protecting interests of individual privacy, reduce the unnecessary encroachment of right dispute case. But this kind of mode restriction on the thing that the facilitator of the network collects user's data and the behaviors of personal secrets to put forward certainly, know the enthusiasm of dampening trade development, and the rigid legislation should always be lagged behind in network technology of developing rapidly, so legislation that lag behind want and hinder network the developments of technology and produce sure negative effect to economic development. Depend on the American mode of the independent management of the trades, which has been adopting the relatively loose policy to the development of the network and e-business all the time, help to encourage and bring about an advance in trade, but because there is not compulsory measure legislating to have and ensure the means, it makes the right of privacy of user's personal data unable to get practical protection to know. It is actually conflict that is the benefit of the country that the conflicts of these two kinds of modes study carefully its profound reason. There are close culture background and traditional idea in Japan, Taiwan and the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region, its the development and protects and prior to our country to network the legislations of right of privacies of technology but development, its legislative course especially basic principles protected to the right of privacy of the network are comparatively perfect, worth drawing lessons from our country too. Any things are the contradiction entities of profit and fraud; the network is as the same. While following the development of the technology of the network and bring the facility to the masses of network users, the drawback of the network is dashed for ward gradually very apparently, a great deal of problems that the network brings demand solving in order to the form that legislate urgently too. But law lag behind development in society always, the stabilities of law make and legislate impossible to surmount era and the developments of society, so the network user's right of personal secrets is encroached on to be difficult to find the awkward situation that relieve of the law to be difficult to avoid. To the fundamentals law of a country, all very important and irreplaceable to protect meanings and about of citizen's right of privacy in constitution. However, have not stipulated the right of privacy, which protects the citizen clearly in the constitution clause of our country, the regulation of the constitution, lacks the effectiveness. The right of privacy is one of department of important composition in the personality right, it is one of the national democracy that behaves too, it is not merely shown as the inside system of a country, and develop and become the civil right of the range of the world gradually. Stipulate the right of privacy, the attention that will embody the law and protects to personality right clearly from the constitution, in addition, rule by law modernly and emphasize it to people's own care day by day and put the protection of people on the space of top prominence, pay attention to the protection of human rights. The right of privacy is the right that the mankind must be required after crossing over the basic rights to subsistence, this is that mankind respects one's own inevitable outcome, is the prerequisite of respecting each other. The constitution is not merely shown as and adjusts the relation between the country and citizen as the achievement of the human civilization, still adjust the relation between the citizen and citizen. Whether the public law or field, or the private law field, the regulation on the constitution has effects, an organic whole should act on. It is an inevitable choice of a constitution to pay attention to right this of mankind itself, so should analyze the constitution status of the right of privacy from several following respects: It make among it is at constitutions clear the citizen one method in right of privacies, leave of our country one a item of independent personality rightness on right of privacy directly through modification constitution the relevant content of private right. Study the theory to speak from the traditional constitution, it when is encroached on, at judicial ways, quote constitution come question that ensure, there is obstacle of the theory directly. We know, the law is the adjustment of certain social relationships, the ruling class makes the purpose of the law, adjust the social relationships of various fields through the law. In general scholar's view, what constitutions are adjusted is a relation between the state power and citizen's right, This kind of social relationships is decided by the nature of the country and basic system, And has embodied the basic value theory and system of adjusting the state power and citizen's right and arrange. Some scholars think too, the use of the constitution must be realized through the political structure reform, but not pass the characteristic of constitution oneself. The administration of justices of constitution operate issue, at value meaning, mean ordinary courts among judicial activities could have been direct and suitable constitution comes to award the dispute by clause. Exchange speech, it is ordinary court in that involve its it the more civil try, whether could carry on the violation of the constitution and examine or quote the issue that the clause of constitutions awards the civil, criminal case directly by the way at the time of the administration and criminal case. So, in the relation of the constitution, the country or the government office is the important participant throughout, the relation not adjusting citizens between individuals. So, when the citizen's fundamental right is encroached on, in theory, it is difficult to quote constitutions and ensure directly. It is to concern our country's one of the important difficult point of construction governed by law of future how to solve this problem correctly, one of the focus question that theory circles have been probed into all the time s that is too. Looking from civil law, protecting citizen's right of privacy has a great deal of defect and insufficient: Indirect qualities who right of privacy protect, and right of privacy protect the scarce operating it nature disguise scattered qualities who right of privacy protect. Should set up the system of protecting citizen's right of privacy in my national law, seen from direction in which the right of privacy protects, the right of privacy is a kind of important private right, the mode that the right of privacy is protected should be altered too, the concrete content that should define the right of privacy and protect, confirm infringing the composition important document of citizen's right of privacy and stipulating the civil liability which infringes citizen's right of privacy clearly, such as stopping encroaching on, making an apology, compensation for damage. In addition, the exemption situation body copy while legislating to the right of privacy of our country touches upon to some extent. At present, our country is being in the economic stage for high development, this basic national conditions have determined that highly developed socialist democracy and construction of the complete socialist legal system still needs constant efforts for it, people's legal accomplishment should still have a series of development to improve all-snidely. A corresponding one is with it, the right consciousness inning the present stage the citizen including right of privacy in the present stage is not still very strong, the current situation of the right of privacy demonstrates the range small with the situation with relatively narrow field. The one that can be affirmed is, with the development of socialist market economy and construction of democratic politics, and the improvement of citizen's cultural dynamics, people's right consciousness will get general enhancement, the right of privacy will become the concern that an important right gets the society too. The right of privacy is one kind of the personality right, which is a closely linked with people's normal life right, it is social civilizations that progress descendant protection of the self-value that realize gradually. Through protecting the right of privacy from the constitution and civil law field, can perfect the personality right system of the citizen of our country, the ones that contribute to the society develop benignly. The network is one virtual world, people are in this virtual space, enjoy more abundant freedom, can carry on more extensive exchange with other users of the network. But the network world is the extension of the realistic society, the person in the true reality that the Internet user of the activity is in the network world, does not have definitely virtual network subjects. Just on the premise of this, the Internet user carries on the activity in the network world, must observe the law of the realistic society too, is contrary to law in the realistic society, infringe the behavior of the rights of privacy of others, implement in the society of the network, form tort equally. The development of Internet breaks through the national boundaries, the questions that are brought on net are that the global various countries must face too. Can't only consider the national conditions of China, if we strengthen the protection of the right of privacy of the network, should pay close attention to legislative trend and legislative trends in the world even more, draw the feasible experience measure from it, and the international standard protected to the right of privacy gradually draws close. Only take precautions against various kinds of questions that may happen actively when just started in the electronic information networking and development, try one's best to make the laws and regulations rationally abundantly, we will not be passive everywhere, there is light prospect of a becoming legal system, rational society too in the network society in the future.

Title: Housing Real Estate Price Research
Abstract: Establish gradually along with the socialism market economy system with real estate market gradually active, our country real estate already through become national economy of important pillar industry, the market system tends in perfect, the housing consumption becomes extension the heat order inside the new motive for needing and consumption. But in recent years, the our country real estate price soars more and quickly, parts of building price in the regions float to rise continuously, soaring range to outrun economy consumedly total growth level and other profession products and service of ascension range. The building price once increases quick trend, not only influence the city residents' living quality biggest, also is the whole national economy continues steady development of an unsteady factor, the building price problem F through become an important and economic problem and social problem which causes to pay attention to extensively. According to these, this thesis first to real estate price of composing, real estate price of the demand and supply of characteristic, impact factor and real estate market carry on analysis, because residence industry is our country constitute most importantly in the real estate industry part, the residence price has become real estate price economy in the most basic, most the problem of core, therefore, this text takes the price present condition of the residence industry as a point to carry on further analysis, to reveal my real estate prices in recent years and its related factors in the relationship. Finally, this text first to domestic and international residence market estimate of the model carry on introduction, then predict to the in common use market in the economic estimate the method carries on analysis and begs a certificate, looking for in keeping with our country currently the estimate method of the present condition of the residence market. Mainly return a model estimate to carry on a further research towards returning. Provide support and help for the development which guides a real estate industry, raise real estate to help a movement efficiency already.

Title: Comparative Study of the Death Penal between China and U.S.
Abstract: To some extent, the history of mankind is a history of excruciation, including the death penalty. Whether in the East or the West in ancient times, the death penalty has been deeply stamped with the brand of cruelty. Into modern human society, with the spread of Enlightenment, the concepts of human rights and humane no longer remain in the advocacy of progressive thinkers , instead they go to each person's soul and have bring tremendous reform to death penalty. Changes are not only reflected in the implementation of humane death, the strict proceedings and the rationality of crimes that might be sentenced to death, but also in the worldwide wave of abolishing the death penalty. Until 2006 88 countries and regions in the world have clearly abolished the death penalty for all crimes, 11 countries and regions have abolished death penalty for ordinary crimes while only reserve it for military crimes or war-time crimes, at least 30 countries and regions have abolish death penalty practically, that means no death penalty in the past 10 years and a commitment of no death penalty to people or the international community in the future. It has become an irresistible worldwide trend to abolish death penalty or abstain its usage. China and US, the largest developing and developed countries, have both stick to the death penalty though confronting the trend. Why they do so? What causes so? Are there any differences between two countries in legislation and judicature? It would be significant to China’s ongoing reform of death penalty to compare the differences and the reasons behind them. Considering all those factors, the thesis makes a thorough comparison on the history and current situation, the standpoint and rationality, its legislation, judicial restraint and execution of the two countries. Death penalty in US dates back to UK. As a result of legal tradition, in the early times of American colonies certain amount of death penalty crimes are stipulated though the existence of restraint policy. And as the expansion of the colonies, death penalty is favored by colonists. The thoughts of abolishing death penalty started in the continent in the 18th has also inflicted US and many states begun to restrain it, especially after the second world war, the movement of abolition of death penalty flourished in the US as the derivation and development of civil rights movements. And as a result, in the epoch-making case of Furman v. Georgia, it announces that the law and its execution is cruel and abnormal which is against American Constitution. Influenced by the Furman case, states start revise laws to meet the stand of restrain it, and in 1976 the supreme court of US renounced the principle of Constitution. 38 states in US , military and federal government retained death penalty at present, and due to the differences of legislation, the death penalty systems appeared rather diverse. However in general the death penalty systems have something in common, for instance the narrowness of the scope death penalty, its more and more discreet of implementation, the huge difference between south and north, execution far lower than sentencing, and the humane reflection of its execution. In recent several years, new development appears in US death penalty system, new death penalty crimes are stipulated, and suspension of death movement is on its way which seeks suspension of execution although death penalty is not abolished. China has a history of death penalty for several thousand years. The thought of severe punishment is always dominating. Compared with other countries, death penalty in China has changed from cruel to lenient, from savage to civilization. Chinese Communist Party in revolutionary base period stipulated death penalty crimes to maintain social order, but due to peculiar background, especially the influence from mistakes of aggressiveness, death penalty system is not perfect. After the foundation of new China there is no criminal law that stipulates death penalty and judicial activities can only resort to policies of punishing and mercy for quite a long time. China’s first penal code was made in 1979 and it stipulated death penalty system quite thoroughly and took a discreet position over this issue. But as the huge changes occurred in China in the later years, series of criminal law was made and the death penalty crimes had soared since then. 1997 penal code adopted these legislations and raised the requirement of implementation of death penalty. Although huge differences exist between China and US in history, culture and political systems, their attitude to death penalty is same. What influences American stands is the advocacy of public opinions and its unique political systems. Its public opinions not only affected the people-elected policy maker, but also influenced judges and procurators. The reasons behind such public opinions are the high crime rate, the death penalty tradition of the south, the tradition of private punishment, no domination by Nazi and etc. American political systems are unique. The federal government has limited powers and each state has the power of stipulating death penalty independently. Therefore there can be no uniform legislation to abolish death penalty and the only way is through the supreme court’s guidance. And only when public opinions considered the death penalty as cruel and abnormal can death penalty be abolished thoroughly. China’s public opinions also advocate death penalty, and not only the legislator but also judiciary has to take public opinions into consideration which result in the misuse of death penalty. The reasons behind the public opinions are the deterioration of public securities, the profound influence of legal tradition and Familism, the lack of thoughts of enlightenment and etc. Political factors also play an important role. Due to the influences of the thought of severe punishment and the tradition of “severe penalty against disordered society”, the rulers tend to use death penalty confronting with austere social public securities. Moreover, the aggressive left wing thought still exist and one of its result is severe punishment movement which foster the misuse of death penalty. Although the differences of the reasons of public opinions, they should be guided to strictly restraint of death penalty due to the inherent defects of public opinions. As for the crime of death penalty, besides individual state stipulates that the crime of rape the young girl can be imputed death penalty, other states generally stipulate that only the crime of murder in specific condition can be condemned the death penalty. The American federation criminal code has a relatively broad death penalty, besides the crime of murder and other crimes contain homicide, it also includes the crime of spy, treason and selling large amount narcotics and so on, which not contain causing man’s death. But in generally, the death penalty crimes in US are basically controlled in the scope of “the most serious crime”, and conform to the spirit of international convention. Comparing with the US, the crimes of death penalty in China are undoubtedly very broad; many non-violence economic crimes also may be sentenced to death penalty. So China must learn from American and set strictly limit to the crime of death penalty. As for the pattern of death penalty collocate model, US has cancelled the absolutely death penalty while China has still existed this kind of death penalty. All this is unscientific, we must learn from American and amend our legislation. As for the object of death penalty, China and America both forbid to sentence the pregnant woman, the minor and retarded into death penalty at present, which has reflected the contemporary death penalty system ’s civilization and humanity; But US once persisted carries out the death penalty to the minor and retarded for a long time and has received international society's criticism; China and American both have no stipulation of prohibition the death penalty to the senior citizen, which doesn’t conform to the international convention’s spirit, must be performed to improve. On the issue of substitutes measure for death penalty, US’s the lifelong imprisonment without parole system can display a good function in the substitution of death penalty; while China's death penalty substitutes measure lacks scientific, which lies in the set term of imprisonment’s deadline excessively low, on the other hand, the life imprisonment actually jugging term is too short, thus causes the postponed death sentence system also cannot play a effective role. Therefore, China should introduce the life long imprisonment without parole system into criminal law, and simultaneously enhance the fixation imprisonment’s term. One of the significant characteristic of the American’s death penalty system is its legal system, the idea of “due process” is ingrained in US, through strict and effective judicial measure, the death penalty has been limited maximally. The before trial system in the American’s death penalty case is fixed and detailed, which has divided into the accusation, the arrest, the registration, first time appears in court, the preliminary hearing, the prosecution, the indictment approves, the procedure, the choice jury and so on, entrusts many law suits rights to the suspect. The trial program in the American’s death penalty case is extremely characteristic, which has divided into the determines guilt procedure and the punishment discretion procedure. Only after the charge is established in the guilt determination procedure, can the case enter into the punishment discretion. While in the guilt determines procedure, must all the jury members unanimous approve the guilt can the guilt be come into existence. The punishment discretion plot generally revolves to the aggravate plot and the mitigate plot, only in the condition of the aggravated collectively larger than the mitigate plot, can the death penalty be considered to be sentenced. In some judicial area, the discretion of punishment also centers on some specific question such as the accuser’s possible crime again. Regardless in the guilt determines procedure or the punishment discretion procedure, the jury both has the final decision. After the trial program, US has also stipulated the direct appeal system, namely the case will be automatically appeals to the upper level courts. Besides this, there is the procedure of “after the state’s determine guilt” in addition. After exhaust the state’s relief method, the defendant may also apply for the federation’s “habeas corpus” to seek the rescue from the federation’s court. If all these measure was failed, the accused also may apply for the administration’s clemency. all the American’s judicature area has stipulated characteristic clemency system in death penalty, which conforms to the spirit of international convention. In the case proof standard, US implements “beyond reasonable doubt”, only in the case of the charge prove the guilt “beyond reasonable doubt” and has the aggravated plot, can the accuse be sentenced to death penalty. Moreover, the accused is granted to the right of silence in the entire process, and he/she cannot be forced to prove his/her crime by himself/herself. Thus the behavior of torture ceased. In all criminal case including the death penalty case, the accused has the right of obtaining attorney’s help and the poor defendant can free get the attorney’s help. The American various judicatures area has also stipulated the system of guarantee the effective attorney help to the defendant in death penalty, if the defendant thought attorney’s help was invalid, he can appeal for this reason. Compares with US, there are many improvements in Chinese death penalty system. For example, guilt determines procedure and punishment discretion procedure in whole leads into the guilt determine plot and the punishment discretion confuses, the standard of death penalty is slur, the proof standard in death penalty case is too absolute and idealization, the accused does not grant the right of silence and then the torture phenomenon has massively existed, the attorney’s help in death penalty case has poor effect, the clemency system is absent in death penalty ,all this questions causes China cannot control death penalty effectively. Therefore, China must learn from US in the foundation of national condition. Finally is the comparison of Chinese and American’s death penalty execute system. The American judicature area stipulate 5 kinds execute measure including the hanging, the electrocution, the poison gas, the shooting and injects at present. However, with the development of executes humanity, the injection way is accepted by overwhelming majority judicature area and become the most execute way in practice. In addition, all the American judicatures areas allow the criminal to choose specific death penalty execute way. The American death penalty system is filled with the humanities concern, not only forbid publicly to execute in order to maintain the criminal’s dignity, but also allowed the criminal’s family member, friends, defense attorney, the pastor as well as psychological doctor to the scene. China has adopted the shoot way to execute death penalty for a long time, until recently starts to select the injection method. However, the criminal has not the right of choose specific death penalty execute way. Moreover, in the influence of tradition, the Chinese custom to execute death penalty publicly and hope to display death penalty’s deterrent function by this way. In generally, China’s death penalty execute system is still careless and lack the American’s spirit of humanity concern. So we must learn
