Title: Science communication process analysis of the nature concept in aldo leopold's a sand county almanac
Abstract: Translation from original language as provided by author With global environment problems becoming seriously,the scholars and the public paid more attention to the issue 'how to protect the environment',and two Opinions what were protectionism and conservationism were coming out. The opinion of protectionism held on that humanity took over the nature,nature was only looked as the methods and the tools for the human motive ;But the theory of conservationism insisted on the nature own immanent value which not relying on the humanity and was for itself, the protection of the nature was not the humanity but the nature. In Leopold's early period, he supported the opinion of protectionism, but with the deepening practicing and promotion of the thought, he got to know limitation of protectionism, in the late period he converted to the opinion of conservationism. A Sand Country Almanac is the crystallization of Leopold's experience, observation and reflection in his whole life. The natural views, especially the thinking of Land ethic is the first moral ethic theory in eastern literatures, which try to establish a complete system including the whole nature of the earth. The ethic theory is that looked the nature of the earth as a whole and put it into the moral view. In this thesis, the first part introduced the Leopold's life, the primary content, the publishing process of the book and Leopold's cognitive process about natural conception. From that we can find the changing process of his thinking. His conversation changed slowly and thoroughly. The second part, we assayed the background of the communication about the changing of his thinking. We also assayed the communication process in the world and in China. Pointed out the reasons why his natural conception was hard to be accepted by social. Leopold devoted himself for the human perennial benefits. In this period, he redefined the relationship of the humanity and the nature, and called for the harmonious development of them. His conversation not only contributed to the development of world environmental movement since the sixties of the 20th century, but also influenced the environmental protection movements from all parts of the world indirectly. Studying the natural conception from A Sand Country Almanac wrote by Leopold in communication view can supply a new view to look and solve the problems in the process of communication. On the other hand, to those readers who were facing the serious of world environmental problems and economic growth in the world, the way Leopold called for ecological comprehension and ethic realization could brining sympathetic response and played an important

Title: Reasearch on decision making for emergency evacuation in buildings with multi-exits based on optimization theory
Abstract: Translation from original language as provided by author With the development of society, more and more people will appear in various venues, such as stadiums, shopping malls, convention centers, theaters, etc. Such buildings belong to venues where the crowd density is very high. When some emergency events or disaster incidents occur there, emergency evacuation is essential for groups. The study for crowd emergency evacuation is of great practical significance and helpful for social security. Crowd emergeny evacuation is the basic of building design and emergency rescue, and therefore has been the hot spot for the domestic and international researchers. Many experts have done a lot of research for the crowd emergency evacuation in the building for many years, especially for the crowd movement and the crowd's behavior badsed on quantitative simulation methods. The exiting research was made based on the special behavior survey and statistics, and the research methods can fall into two categories: one is to make evacuation experiment in the real scenario by some animals or people, and the other is to make a mathematical model or to do crowd evacuation simulation by computer. Considering the cost of ethical and moral factors of the evacuation experiments by animals or people, we can know that a mathematical model based on the optimization theory will become an important method for the study on crowd emergency evacuation. Based on the optimization theory, we explore the crowd flow mechanism in crowd evacuation, study overall evacuation time, and study the evacuation decision problem for different exits. Discussion on the relations between evacuation velocity and crowd density is presented in detail by making an optimization evacuation model. Given a certain evacuation scenario, calculating the evacuation time and making the allocation for each exit based on the optimization evacuation model and simulations by the evacuation software buildingEXODUS(v4.06) can be obtained as well as the comparative analysis for the two results. As a result, we can see that the result of the evacuation optimization model can be helpful to the evacuation management and the related evacuation decisions that can make all exits used well, and therefore evacuation efficiency can be enhanced. The results of the study are helpful to manage the crowd evacuation in the buildings. If some emergency events or accidents occur there, it also helps safety managers evacuate pedestrians as soon as possible, which reduces the amount of

Title: An ecofeminist analysis of the handmaid's tale
Abstract: Translation from original language as provided by author Based on the theories of Karren J. Warren and several other ecofeminist critics, this thesis analyzes Margaret Atwood's The Handmaid's Tale from an ecofeminist point of view. Margaret Atwood is the most famous contemporary Canadian writer. Her unique point of view of a female writer, incisive style, and accurate descriptions win her international reputation. Most of her novels take female characters as protagonists, aiming at revealing the particular problems that women face and reflecting universal social problems. The Handmaid's Tale was published in 1986. Taking females as the leading characters, and environmental crisis as its background, it depicts people who are suffering from tragic environmental pollution in a totalitarian country, in which females are taken as scapegoats of men for environmental problems and are exploited and oppressed. Ecofeminism is a combination of both feminism and environmental protection movements. Born in the 1960s, ecofeminism aims at solving the increasingly severer environmental problems by connecting nature with feminism. It inherits feminist theories, respecting the difference between two genders, encouraging diversity and criticizing dualism and the antagonism between males and females, culture and nature, sense and sensibility; at the same time, it adopts the basic ideas of ecology, such as liberation, opposing oppression, and the pursuit of harmony. Based on these two theories ecofeminism takes establishing s female culture as one of the fundamental solutions to environmental problems. Ecofeminist criticism attacks dualism and patriarchy, doing literature research from the perspective of both environment and gender, calling upon the elimination of dualism ideology and the care of nature and women, so as to develop harmony between nature and human beings, males and females. The Handmaid's Tale is a paradigm of explaining eco-feminist ideas. On the basis of the patriarchal ideology, Gilead is built into a totalitarian country which features taming and ruling females. Females are forced into a submissive position, which makes the whole society fall into abnormality; at the same time, due to the ignorance of the nurture of nature, and the hubris in science development, people trap themselves into doom. In the novel, natural phenomenon and natural creatures are the incarnation of females; and the products of civilization such as guns, cars and books are the incarnation of males. Females, natural phenomena, and natural creatures show resemblance under the same oppression. Females hope to find harmony, equality, wholeness and mutual benefit by getting close to nature, which indicates the closeness between women and nature, as well as nature's healing power upon women. In contrast, men pay much attention to the strength and power that technology and civilization bring to them, and focus on increasing their ability in competition and rivalry. Through revealing the antagonism between nature and civilization, females and males, this thesis points out that the ideology of dualism is the chief reason for Gilead's falling into crisis: on one hand, human beings' self-centeredness and blindly exploitation of nature breed the technique abuse which causes the sterility of nature; on the other hand, the sterility of society comes from women's exclusion from men and men's hostility towards women. Besides, the depiction of female friendship and the thought-provoking ending of the novel indicate that although Gilead is horrible, the female friendship and the closeness to nature have pointed out ways out of the control of patriarchal and dualistic ideas. The Handmaid's Tale reflects eco-feminist ideas that women and nature, which enjoy the same joy and moan the same sorrow, are closely linked together. It also points out that dualism and patriarchy are harmful to both nature and society, which are the root of misery. The novel warns readers of existing antagonism between nature and human beings, females and males and informs people of the value of current achievements of

Title: The study on wei yuan's science and technology thoughts
Abstract: Translation from original language as provided by author There was extensive research on Wei Yuan, however, few involved in Wei Yuan's Science and Technology Thoughts: In the "Wei Yuan's 200th anniversary commemoration of the International Symposium" have been academic exchange and discussion on Wei's business Science and Technology Thoughts; Secondly, what is worth mentioning is the thesis published by the Changsha National Defense University professor Zhu Yazong, " The expansion and limitations of " The Practice based on Confucian " - Review on the values of Wei Yuan's Science and Technology", But the writer did not very thoroughly and meticulously analysis and demonstrate on the values of Wei Yuan's Science and Technology based on more objective. View of the current status of such research,This paper attempts a more comprehensive, objective and more in-depth study based on Wei Yuan's Science and Technology Thoughts. Through this study, in order to clearly and systematically understand Wei Yuan's Science and Technology Thoughts from all levels, such as its formation, content and impact etc. and to some extent promote the excellent Chinese civilization; Furthermore, try to get Wei Yuan as a case on the study of Chinese scientific and technological thinking of that time, to grasp the advanced thoughts of Western Science and technology which were existed at that time and then positively and cognitively think deficiencies of the thoughts of Wei Yuan's Science and Technology .Based on this basis, to understand the different points between Chinese and Western on science and technology thoughts as possibly. From this, to gain experience, lessons and inspiration and then be more useful to exchange and integration of Chinese and Western science and technology and to some extent promote the establishment of China's science and technology. And based on the above, to get further revealing look and reflect the deeper value of this study. Based on the above considerations, This paper includes five sections.The first section states the historical conditions of Wei Yuan's Science and Technology Thoughts. Under this great era in the late Qing , it relates to the instability at the domestic environment, complex international factors and Wei Yuan individual's social history;The second, the emphasis of this paper, ,concentrates on the content of Wei Yuan Science and Technology Thoughts with great length, which include his geographical concept, water view, view of science and technology and methodology, on the foregoing basis of historical conditions .The third is about particular emphasis on the influence of Wei Yuan's Science and Technology thoughts at home and abroad. In this section in order to avoid generalities and clearly reflect the historical status of the thoughts, only selecting the "Bakumatsu" Japan, China Westernization Movement for the study; The fourth focuses on the limitations of Wei Yuan's science and technology thoughts. Among this, Mainly according to the history and status of Western Science and Technology Thoughts of that time, Standing point of comparison, to explore the limitations inherent in Wei Yuan Science and Technology thoughts and the reasons for them. The last is a summary and examination of further enlightenment from above. Through a brief review of this article ,this part focuses on the apocalyptic look which highlights the deeper meaning of.this article from three

Title: The analyze of seiq model in complex network
Abstract: Translation from original language as provided by author The recent decade has witness the birth of a new movement of interest and research in the study of complex network in domestic and international area. Many social, biological and technical systems, such as the spread of infectious diseases, computer viruses, rumor and so on, all can be descript by complex network.. In which, the vertices represent individuals and links mimic the interactions among them. The development of the complex network theory has do some help to the realization of the infectious disease outbreak, and it is a new trend to study the infectious disease in complex network. This paper aims to the study of the SEIQ model in complex networks, and the main contents and originalities in it can be summarized as follows: 1. Introduce the eclipse and quarantine states, the SEIQ model are established and analyzed in the small-world networks and scale-free network respectively. Depending on the spread of disease mechanisms and the mean-field theory, a standard SEIQ model and a L-SEIQ model with the Long-distance Infected are established and simulated in computer with matlab, analyzing it can be find that the probability of eclipse's infected and the Long-distance Infected all have an important influence on the spread of disease. 2. In order to control the spread of the disease, different immunization strategies were used on different network topologies: For the small-world networks, the uniform immunization strategy is taken; for scale-free network, proportional immunization and targeted immunization are considered respectively. Then simulate it and analyze the effectiveness of different strategy; at the same time, the influence of quarantine rate on the spread of disease is considered to provide guidance for the better control of disease spread. 3. The spread of the disease model is applied to the spread of SARS virus, translate the actual data of SARS virus which is transmission in 2003 into the specific parameters of the model, and simulate its spread basing on the previous model, then come to the best strategy for controlling the spread of SARS virus. In short, basing on previous studies, taking the benefits of that the complex networks can simulate the contact relationship between the individual, and combining the characteristics of the spread of disease, the complex network model of the spread of diseases SEIQ is established. Then, immunization strategy and the factors which affect the spread of the disease are analyzed. The empirical analysis is done with the SARS, and the strategy of SARS control is abstained. To a certain extent, the result of this paper enriched the theory of the spread of disease, and the model also has obvious advantages: the newly introduced state describes the spread of the disease process vividly; the way of disease spread can be simulated better in complex networks; the considering of the long-distance infection depicts the mechanisms of disease spread more

Title: The scientific development ideas of the chinese communist party in the 1990s of the 20st century
Abstract: Translation from original language as provided by author In the 90s, the CCP's outlook of scientific development encompasses Deng Xiaoping's theory and its enhancement by our country's third-generation leaders' group. The first-generation leaders' group headed by Mao Zedong has made instructive exploration on the progress of socialism which formed a solid foundation for the CCP's outlook on scientific development both in theory and practice. The international socialist movement and the development of foreign capitalism have provided both beneficial experience and lessons for us resulting in the party's idea of development in the 90s. Scientific development constitutes the essence and core of the idea. The 90's outlook answers the three elementary questions of why we should develop, where the power of development locates and the goal of development. During the prolong reform of China, Deng Xiaoping put forward a series of opinions about the problems of development. These opinions were passed on to the third-generation leader's group headed by Jiang Zemin. The success of the 90's economic development was rooted from their insisting and implementing such outlook of development.The 90's development strategy of our party was a detailed demonstration of the idea on scientific development. Den Xiaoping's strategic theory of development dealt with the goal of development, the path for development and the sustaining and comprehensiveness of development. The third-generation leaders' group centered by Jang Zemin further enhanced and implemented the outlook on scientific development primarily by way of reforming economy, implementing the strategy of sustaining development, pushing forward the country's administration under law enforcement and political civilization, enhancing the country's comprehensive strength by developing education and science. The national economy's health and steady growth was greatly propelled with these measures taken.The 90's idea on development is of great significance. First and foremost, it is the inheritance and innovation of the Marxism. Secondly, it provides theoretical guidance for the China-featured socialist construction. In addition, it endows the fourth-generation leaders' group with theoretical basis. Though the 90's idea on development has proved a great success in leading China's socialist practice, it caused several social problems signifying the limit of the party's idea on development. In the 90s, the party's adhering to the socialist direction of development is the fundamental source for the success of China's socialist

Title: Rural community governance mechanism construction research based on the conservation steward program in z village
Abstract: Translation from original language as provided by author Under the general trend of global modernization, China's society enters into a fast transition period, the society presents some breaks and confusions in the tradition to the modern switching process. To guarantee the society having a benignity movement and coordinated development, the state proposed constructing a harmonious society. The community is the microscopic society, the community construction is the foundation engineer of the society constructing, and from our country's national condition, the rural community construction become a key part. Governance construction in rural community is the most important part in rural community, but now the construction in our rural community do not have complete policy system and pattern, it is necessary to do deep research of some rural development exploration practices, to extract useful experiences and common theories that can be promoted. Although the rural environment resources government is only a part of the community governs, but has become a hot spot in the new rural reconstruction, the modern rural community environment resources government can be used as a breakthrough point to research the entire modern rural community governance. In this paper, the basic theory is rural sociology, takes "Conservation Steward Program" as a case to do a exploratory action research, analyzes the program's influence and the enlightenment to the governance mechanism of the rural community, refines the authority, the organization, the system, the democracy, the culture are essential factors of the modern rural community governance construction. There are altogether six parts in the paper. The first part, makes a summary of the related research about "the rural community governance mechanism construction in the transition period" , then explains and defines two basic concepts of "the rural community" and "the governance mechanism". The second part, from marketization, modernization, communization three dimensions introduce modern rural community's reforming background. The third part, from the government main body, the government way, the government ability, the government function four dimensions analysis the difficult position that the rural community governance mechanism facing at the present. The fourth part, does a research of the "Conservation Steward Program" in Z village, discusses it's influence and enlightenment to the modern rural community governance mechanism construction. The fifth part, base on the preamble theory and practice research, refines the essential factor which the mechanism construction needs. The sixth part, makes a brief summary and the forecast to this research. The paper's innovation spot is the research perspective, noting the civil community-based environmental projects actually come down to the community governance, including government authority, government main body, government principle, government system and so on, that is the governance mechanisms in rural community. This paper also take a "transition period" research perspective, it is the social context of the rapid modernization of our country's transformation make the" New Rural Community Construction" turn into an urgent cause , and rural community governance is the key to the success of this undertaking, concerns the rural development and stability. At this time, different strengths emerge, different patterns attempt, therefore it is essential to do a deep research to some related exploration practice, the Conservation Steward Program in Z village is one of

Title: Study on the information asymmetry issue in ethical trade and countermeasures
Abstract: Translation from original language as provided by author With the fast development of economy globalization and information technology, there is a shift in consumer consciousness and social values. The ethical trade movements urging businesses to pay more attention to the sustainable development of economy, society and natural environment, have aroused wide concern in global community. Although ethical trade gains rapid growth in terms of people's interest in it and its practice development, there are still some problems impeding its future development. Information asymmetry is one of these major issues. In essence, ethical trade is an information-intensive activity based on the free market. It exerts self-regulation and intervenes in the market through the interaction of stakeholders' decision-making; hence information is a most important element in the critical areas of ethical trade. What's more, from the perspective of Management Information System Theory, ethical trade contains an information system which plays regulating, controlling and reference for decision-making functions. Having complete information is not only an essential condition for traders' adequate decision-making, but also premise for the smooth development of ethical trade. However, due to various reasons, including imperfect market mechanisms, high transaction costs, people's limited knowledge and specialty of ethical products, there does exist some degree of information asymmetry between different stakeholders. The problem also triggers a series of issues that are embodied in the production, purchasing and consumption processes. Since the problem of information asymmetry damages the efficiency and effectiveness of ethical trade, it is necessary to improve the information system to promote the transmission and exchange of information in the whole process of ethical trade. To simplify the research, this paper mainly focuses on two core stakeholders --- the enterprises in developing countries and consumers in developed countries and introduces the mathematical model and the game matrix to further analyze the factors that influence the enterprises' decision-making in ethical trade under the condition of asymmetric information. In the end, we try to propose some measures in order to alleviate the degree of information asymmetry

Title: The idea of world revolution of china in mao era
Abstract: Translation from original language as provided by author Since 1840, China has gradually been incorporated into the Western capitalist world system. Chinese revolution is no longer an isolated domestic incident, but closely been linked to the development trend, the right pattern and the benefits distribution of the whole world. Rooted in traditional political ideology and culture soil of China, the idea of world revolution of China in Mao era is not only derived from "At the Same Revolution Theory" of Max an Engels but also deeply been impacted by the Soviet Union and the Comintern. It has undergone a process from the formation and development to radical evolution and gradual adjustment. Chinese Communist Party is a branch of the Comintern from its birth. After the founding of new China, Chinese communists clarified: Chinese revolution is the part of world revolution of the proletarian socialist. They accepted the analysis about imperialism and national question posed by Max and Engels. And they judged the world situation scientifically, that is "the revolution and the war" is the theme of the era of imperialism and proletarian revolutionary. In the two camps of capitalism and socialism, the America not only blockaded and sieged socialist countries but also interfered and suppressed other countries' revolution. So it is the key enemy of world people. On the contrary, the Soviet Union recognized the new China and assisted Chinese revolution enthusiastically. The Soviet Union is the staunch supporter and ally of China. After the successful revolution, China began to pay attention to and support revolutionary movements of neighboring countries. The most obvious manifestation of this is the Korean War and Vietnam War against France. In Mao' opinion "that is our internationalist duty". After the min-50', the world balance of power has changed a lot. The strength of Socialism accounted for the overwhelming superiority of the strength of imperialism. In such situation, Soviet Communist Party held the twentieth national congress, proposed the concept of peaceful evolution and détente with the United States vigorously. These practices led to differences between the two parties of Sino-Soviet. In the end revolutionism conquered over peaceful evolution. Chinese believes that the Soviet Union has become the de facto social imperialism and it can not continue to lead international communist movement. As a result, the center of world revolution had in fact transferred to China. In this period, China intensified the concept of world revolution. China believes that the war will occur, so it support for world revolution generously. The strategy that make other countries stop the war through revolution become China' leading foreign policy. As the international situation changes, China has begun to amend the idea of "world revolution" in the 70s.Chines leaders have adjusted the goal of world revolution, not stressed whether it is socialism or not, but stressed freedom from imperialist control and fighting for true national independence and liberation. Further more, they proposed the "three worlds" theory. China continued to implement world revolution, but they paid more attention to national interests. The most obvious manifestation is to improve relations with the United States. In Mao era, the ideal of world revolution and the national interest has in the confluence of contradictions. However, in most cases, both are equally important and uniformed. The idea of world revolution influences Chinese policy makes on the basic decision about national interest. But it serves the interests of the country ultimately. Although the idea of world revolution in Mao Era has undeniable limitations, it also produced some positive impact for Chinese diplomacy. There is necessary for us to make a correct understanding of the role of the idea of world revolution. For that has the significance of theory and practice for to make a comprehensive understanding of thinking itself and get a through observation of changes in New China' diplomatic

Title: Kmt people and the war in europe--to the kmt's publications as the center
Abstract: Translation from original language as provided by author July 28, 1914 the First World War broke out. To Sun Yat-sen led the early Nationalist Chinese people believe that this war will have a very important influence, closely watching this war, they adopted "Republic Daily", "Construction" magazine, "Weekly Review" and so on , describes the process of ward , West's comments on the war and people's remarks movement. Also they published a large number of editorials and related articles Commentary expound their own views. To ask for China's entry in the war, Sun Yat-sen, Zhu Zhixin, Tai Chi-tao, Ma Junwu and others analysis of international and domestic situation .They analysis China's accession to the pros and cons of war, firmly opposed to China's accession to the Allies declared war on Germany .They criticize the action of Britain and France and the United States ,because of they tempted China taking part in the war .They advocate that China should be an independent decision on the German diplomatic issues, pointing out that government policy should listen to the views of people get public support. They advocate that China should insist on neutrality in order to avoiding peril.The war ended with the victory of the Allies, they think this is justice defeated power. So the post-war world peace also just around the corner.To this end they are the post-war peace conference also hoping that China could use the meeting to recover some of their own rights.Paris and will beChina's diplomatic failure, the Kuomintang and the people's attitude from the original would be full of hopes and expectations to disappointment, but also recognized the weak impossible for China to achieve the post-war peace conference should be themselves as the victors rights. As the war development of the situation, the KMT people are also increasingly profound understanding of the war, they began to reflect on the reasons for the war, outcome of the war, as well as the effects of war, realized that it was the contradictions between the imperialist countries led to the conflict of war the outbreak. The war, some of the ills of Western society exposed, coupled with their reflection on the war, the KMT began to think China should be how to develop, how to avoid a world war and the pursuit of world peace and human happiness. They stressed the critical social Darwinism to human society of competition led to ethnic conflicts, the intensification of ethnic conflicts and advocate of human society should be to implement mutual aid, the mutual aid as a principle of social development, emphasizing the human will be able to help mutual evolution, survival of the nation-state can be developed, thus be able to avoid war and safeguard world peace. They see the war left some of the factors conducive to China's economic development and advocated the war in Europe to China a favorable time, China should take advantage of the war in Europe of the machine, as well as good conditions for the post-war economic development, and mutually supportive countries in the world to jointly develop to develop the industry. Kuomintang against imperialism and that imperialism is a leading cause of the war and advocated the implementation of the People's

Title: Study on abstract art in shanghai
Abstract: Translation from original language as provided by author Shanghai is the earliest Chinese city who accepted modern western art, abstract art language didn't being rejected so much here, and it undoubtedly possesses historic significance. The development of abstract art in Shanghai is related to Shanghai's specific geographic location, urban culture, thinking mode and flavor of life: history of leased territory made it tolerating western culture rather than sticking to Chinese tradition; economic prosperity and metropolitan life formed fine and delicate life habits, sensitivity to details and comprehension to art have been reserved unconsciously; the open social form, psychology and the convenience in international communication are the premises for abstract art developing in Shanghai. Chinese abstract art can be born and being developed continuously in Shanghai, it is the results of rationality and possibility of culture. During the 1920s and 1930s, modern art movement emerged in Shanghai, abstract art was in the rudimentary stage, from the later period of the Cultural Revolution to the approaching of the 21st century, the biggest challenges for artists in Shanghai are the experiment for modern painting and the practice for abstract art language. These artists found resolutions and their own artistic language from complicated and chaotic state, they persisted in by conviction and the artists' insight, became the implied key points to connect art history, and formed an important component in Chinese art history. Shanghai has already established its position as Abstract Art's Capital, formed specific regional cultural landscape, abstract painting has already being a representative symbol for contemporary visual culture in Shanghai, and it attracted attention. The first chapter of the dissertation expounds the development of abstract art, and re-examines artistic languages; the second chapter retraces the origin of modern art development in Shanghai, the course of artistic language transformation, and organizes contemporary development courses of abstract art in Shanghai; the third chapter explores the reasons for abstract art in Shanghai, the specific regional cultural phenomenon to emerge and to develop endlessly; the fourth chapter analyses the characteristics of abstract art languages in Shanghai, and generalizes the modes for its oriental artistic thinking to convert modernly; the fifth chapter points out the problems to be faced in the course of abstract art's development in Shanghai, and prospects its future development trend; the last chapter further explains abstract art in Shanghai's position and significance in the course of contemporary art development in China. The dissertation mainly adopts interdisciplinary studying method that combines fine arts and linguistics studies, from the born and converting structure of language in social culture and historic background, the relationship between language and context, and idea expression of language, to explore the reasons for abstract art in Shanghai to emerge and to develop endlessly, it analyses the characteristics of abstract art languages in Shanghai, then it delineates abstract art in Shanghai, the specific regional cultural landscape, points out the problems to be faced in the course of abstract art's development in Shanghai, and prospects its future development, further explains its position and significance in the course of contemporary art development in China, and tries to create a method of artistic languages research through studying abstract art in

Title: Emergency evacuation simulation of students groups based on vr technology
Abstract: Translation from original language as provided by author With the social development and increasing investment in education, that more and more children can receive schooling is deeply gratifying, but their safety at school is gradually becoming prominent. Since schools are important places to learn, live and grow for students, students must be strong support for personal safety. Some schools in the face of unexpected events, such as earthquakes, fires, violence, etc., in need of emergency evacuation, led to the evacuation of students crowding each other in time, or even fall trampling each other, resulting in heavy casualties, such as earthquake evacuation of some schools, ineffective when , Hunan, such as the stampede of students on campus. How to reduce casualties in emergency evacuation is an important research topic of related scientific research institutions and administration. A large-scale evacuation simulation is a project that needs a lot of human and material resources. And due to the dependence of human actions and psychological on many external factors, evacuation test is difficult to execute, even for testing. It is also difficult for person to access to the unexpected events, such as a state of panic, test results, to some extent, can not reflect the true situation. Therefore, using a computer to simulate evacuation behavior has become an important technology tool in the international security research. Currently, some achievements have been obtained in the research of evacuation simulation at home and abroad. After analyzing the characteristics of the existing evacuation models, this paper uses the simulation technology of group behavior based on Multi-Agent, and makes improved design of the characteristics of the students groups in the simulation, establish a simulation program of students group in evacuation. It also does some experiments, and makes some data statistics and analyses. The main studies of this paper include: analyze of students group behaviors in the emergencies, build evacuation simulation model for the main behaviors of students groups; research the methods of modeling the flexible structures of a variety of terrain environment, which can easily make the program applied to the various structures of the environment; use and improve the Multi-Agent based simulation technology of group behaviors, and come up with more suitable modeling method for the simulation target of this paper; improve the simulation algorithm of the existing models, including individual and group behaviors movement algorithm, path finding algorithm; use the research results in this evacuation process simulation of this paper to do the simulation, then get statistical data and do the

Title: Post-suharto civil-military relation--indonesia's democracy and transformation
Abstract: Translation from original language as provided by author Indonesia's civil-military relation is the most important topic in Indonesian politics. As early as the days of struggling for independence, Indonesian military always perform independently, free from civilian intervention. Beside the real responsibility of military to safeguard national security and unity, Indonesian military actively involved in political affairs. One of the reasons is that after Indonesia gained independence, the country experience a lot of political upheaval and instability, the civilian government appears to be inefficient because of struggles among differing political ideologies. Especially in the field of national security, civilian government appears to be indecisive; this caused the military to look down upon civilian government and like to strengthen their role in politics. This thesis will narrate and analyze the establisment of the Indonesian armed forces and on how the armed forces join effort in struggling for nation's independence, from the earlier days of Netherland's colonial days, inheriting the Japanese military doctrines and then join the fight against Netherland's colonial army. The process was full of contradiction and the building of ideology. But the Indonesian military also perform quite independent beginning from those days. This should the because of the influence of Japanese fascist thinking. Japanese army indoctrinated fascist thinking to Indonesian army and it encourages Indonesian army to get involve in politics. To get involve in political and societal affairs, the Indonesian army actively looked for legitimacy. After succeding in suppressing rebellion in many regions, the Indonesian military enjoyed high political reputation; it becomes an asset tobe actively involved in political and societal affairs. At the time, the international politics was within the "cold war" bipolar structure. Strictly speaking, legitimacy is a domestic political affair, but Indonesian military also has to consider on how the international politics may affect domestic political situation. Sides of cold war, the socialist camp and the capitalist camp have supporters in Indonesia; the Indonesian military also has to choose. After the "9.30 movement", the right-wing military led by Suharto chose to side with the west's capilatist camp. "Anti-communist" became the dominant source of legitimacy for the military to interfere in politics. The military regime led by Suharto exercise "dual function", military men enjoys enormous right in political, economic and social fields. Besides positionin military personnel in political position, Suharto also allowed military personnel to get into business and make money. This strengthens Indonesian military control upon the society. However, military regime raises doubts, because of its weak legitimacy. To consolidate its political standing, Indonesian military chose to exagerrate the menace the Indonesian society must face. When on the process "exagerrating the latent danger", the Indonesian military also spare no effort to instigate violence in the society, to let the society be in condition of tense and then increase the people's eagerness to be in secure environment, increasing their dependance on the military and police. Violence becomes one of the characteristic of Suharto-led military regime. One side, violence many strengthen Suharto's control toward the society, but on the other side it increases the people's antipathy. The accumulated corruption during the Suharto era exploded during the 1997 Asian Financial Crisis. The military has to face enormous international and domestic pressure and forces to hand over power. Suharto stepped down. The military faced with pressure to reform. Reformer leaders like Abdurahman Wahid and Megawati Sukarnoputri understand well the corrupt nature of military intervention in politics and chose to start reform. However, the political assets accumulated by the military during long period let them have bargaining power and resisting civilian's effort to reorganize the military. Reformer politicians and the military started a political struggle and this spill over the society, creating turbulence in the society. But,the free competition environment during the era of democracy provide the Indonesian military an opportunity to get involved in politics again. Politicians with military background join the election; fully use the democratic institution to get back into political

Title: The analysis and development studies of anqing track and field advantages project
Abstract: Translation from original language as provided by author As a track and field athletic sports main headings, there are many studies about track and field training, but most were directed at a high level of the campaign level. The level of movement between one and two and about the amateur sports school sports team training research and rare. Title: Simulation of human head-neck multi-body dynamic model
Abstract: Translation from original language as provided by author Human head-neck injuries were studied because of their high incidence rate in modern life. According to statistics, the head and neck are the most vulnerable parts of human body in vehicle traffic accidents with long-term consequence, especially the neck muscle damage of pilot is still a difficulty in military while the carrier-based aircraft landing. Now medical treatment and compensation related to human head-neck injuries lead to significant social costs, therefore it is a challenge to safety community for research into the head-neck injury mechanisms. The human head and neck responses to impacts are simulated and analyzed using ADAMS in this paper. Firstly the complex anatomy structure of human head-neck is studied, and previous studies of head mechanical loads and injury mechanisms are reviewed. Then the work is developing a new 3D head-neck multi-body model based on the anatomical structure of a real human body using ADAMS. The model consists of rigid head, cervical vertebrae(C1~C7) and thoracic vertebra(T1,T2) connected through nonlinear viscoelastic intervertebral joints representing the lumped behavior and nonlinear stress-strain muscle elements based on biomechanics. Finally the human head-neck model is validated with the front and rear end impacts and the results are acceptable. The boundary and loading conditions were applied according to the condition of the volunteers' tests, also the neck muscle damage is presented. The global kinematics like head translational and angular,movements and accelerations as well as local kinematics such as muscle damage can be predicted with this head-neck multi-body model. This model will contribute to the research on neck injury mechanisms, development of injury protective device and analysis of human head-neck responses to sustained

Title: Research on household income mobility in rural china
Abstract: Translation from original language as provided by author With respect to studying the dynamics of incomes, the paper aims to investigate income mobility in rural China. Though usually neglected, income mobility is significant for improving income distribution among rural households, enhancing poverty alleviation and decreasing income inequality. First of all, by international comparisons, this paper analyzes income mobility in some developed countries and developing countries, and concentrates on the differences in income mobility across countries. Secondly, it measures both rank mobility and quantity mobility, and the effect of income mobility on long-term income inequality in rural China from 1989 to 2006. Thirdly, it further assesses the determinants of household income mobility and their contributions to income mobility. And finally, it summarizes the conclusions, policy implications, and makes suggestions for future research. Based on the analysis of this paper number of conclusions can be drawn: Firstly, considerable income mobility equalizes long-term income inequality in developed countries and developing countries. In addition, with economy reform and transition, income of developing countries is more mobile. Moreover, many studies indicate household demographic characters (such as household size, age, gender, etc.), education and employment are important for income mobility. Secondly, there exists considerable mobility of income in rural China from 1989 to 2006. The high degree of rank and quantity mobility implies re-ranking and beta convergence in income distribution. Additionally, the paper also finds considerable transitorily poor and rich in positional mobility. On the one hand, transitorily movement of the poor and rich provides opportunities for both the poor and the rich households to change their income status, and decreases long-term income inequality. On the other hand, however, it also causes considerable income fluctuations and economic insecurity. Moreover, the equalizing effect of income mobility on income inequality is weakened over time with increasing income inequality. Thirdly, households with low initial income level, high share of wage income, high educational level of household members, high number of non-agricultural employed household members, and younger heads are more mobile. Change in the share of non-agricultural employed persons in household, change in the share of wage income and change in the average years of education of household members are the main contributors to the observed inequality in income mobility among all income categories of rural households. However, when analyze the initially poor and rich households, these results appear somehow different with average years of education of household members is more contributive to income mobility for rich households. Fourthly, with re-allocation of labor resources in the household, non-agricultural employment increases return to non-agricultural work and agricultural work by scale operation in agriculture production. Therefore, non-agricultural employment improves household income distribution in rural China. Education and economic return to education also influence income mobility. On the one hand, high average years of education and change in the average years of education of household members foster income mobility among rural households. On the other hand, economic return to education in rural China has been on the rise which increases income mobility. Moreover, economic return to education of non-agricultural employment is higher than that of agricultural work. So, the better educated and non-agriculturally employed have competitive advantages in improving household income. And education is more important for rich households than poor households because of the higher education level and non-agricultural employment among rich household members. So, with the transitory movement of rural households' incomes, the high degree of income mobility over the period provides more chances for farmers. Income mobility equalizes long-term income inequality even if the high annual income inequality. Therefore, it is important for government to adopt policies that creat a fair and competitive environment for boosting development of rural communities in the future. Finally, aiming to promote income mobility in rural China, this paper puts forward proposals for increasing industrialization and urbanization, improving social security and developing agricultural production,

Title: Public interest environmental litigation in india and its implication
Abstract: Translation from original language as provided by author In recent years, enforcement of environmental law has become an obstacle in environmental protection in China. How to improve law enforcement needs to be resolved imminently. However, Public Interest Environmental Litigation (PIEL) has just been established in China. There are few cases and PIEL still lacks explicit legal provisions. How to make PIEL effective in improving our law enforcement needs to be studied. The article will give an overview of Indian's PIEL by analyzing its background and implementation effect and point out its advantages and disadvantages and its relationship with environmental law enforcement, hoping to give suggestion to China's PIEL. This article consists of three chapters. Chapter 1 is the background of PIEL in India. The government structure in India provides a guarantee for judicial independence. Indian Emergency in 1974 gave rise to the judicial activism of the Supreme Court. In the following years, Supreme Court established judicial review which laid the foundation for PIEL. As the environmental legal system was undeveloped, the administrative organs were not actively engaged in law enforcement, and the influence of the international environmental protection movements was widespread in India, all these elements directly resulted in the establishment of PIEL. Aiming at achieving social justice, the Supreme Court actively promoted PIEL and opened the courts to citizens especially to the poor and disadvantaged. Chapter 2 is the contents of all the essential elements of PIEL in India. The elements include locus standi, scope of accepting cases and jurisdiction, procedure, remedy, litigation expenses, legal aid and judicial decision. Chapter 3 is the implementation effect of PIEL in India. PIEL improved Indian's environmental legal system, pushed the administrative organs to actively and properly enforced law and promoted public participation in India. However, Supreme Court's excessive judicial activism also brought bad effect to law enforcement. We can learn from Indian's experience that we must deal with the relationship with administrative organ, judiciary and citizen properly. It needs to draw the line of their right and power so as to make them coordinate properly. In addition, we should expand locus standi, simplify procedures, establish commission of inquiry and create flexible remedies to improve citizens' access to justice and protect citizens' environmental rights in

Title: Extended supraclavicular fasciocutaneous island flap based on the transverse cervical artery for head and neck reconstruction following cancer ablation
Abstract: Translation from original language as provided by author Purpose: After head and neck cancer defects not only lead to facial deformities, can cause severe dysfunction, physical, psychological and social aspects of patients will have adverse impact seriously affected the quality of life of patients. This study aim to explore a new surgical procedure for the head and neck reconstruction following cancer ablation with extended supraclavicular fasciocutaneous island flap based on the transverse cervical artery on the basis of suming up domestic and international research achievement and assess the reliability and usefulness. Methods and Materials: Form july 2008 to december 2009, fifty-three patients with head and neck cancer following ablation were reconstructed by extended supraclavicular fasciocutaneous island flap. Preoperative three- dimensional computed tomographic angiography (3D-CTA) was performed on all patients. Among them, the age of the 33 males patients ranged from 35 to 78 years(average age 57.09±9.6); the age of the 20 males patients ranged from 26 to 81 years(average age 55.35±15.7). The sizes of the skin paddle ranged from(4cm×6cm) to (7cm×19cm) (average 5.7×11.6cm). Results: Forty-five of the flaps survived successfully, including 4 cases with minimal partial necrosis. 4 cases with total necrosis. Following up 3-18 months, 44 of them were alive with no disease,6 cases are alive with disease, 1 has died of complication and 2 have died of a lung and liver metastasis. The color and appearance of the flap were normal and mouth opening was not limited. Facial appearance is good. Movement of the shoulder was not damaged. Conclusions: This new procedure, designed reasonable, which can be completed in one-stage. Postoperative facial appearance and function was very well. the flap can be raised with technical ease and thus requires a relatively short operating time; the flap donor site is in the same operative field and can be closed primarily; the thin pedicle allows easy transfer of the island flap, which can be tunneled into a defect in the head and neck; It was reliable for reconstructing head and neck medium-sized defects following the ablation of advanced malignant

Title: American identity and european identity of washington irving and in his tales
Abstract: Translation from original language as provided by author Washington Irving was a distinguished representative in the early American romanticism and was the first American who achieved an international literary reputation. As the father of the American short story, Irving was such a professional in recreating the European derivative with American background. Rip Van Winkle and The Legend of Sleepy Hollow are regarded as his best known tales for they were endowed with American identity and European identity. Meanwhile, Irving's trans-Atlantic literary contribution served as a bridge between the old and new. By analyzing the American identity, European identity and Irving's life experience from a historical perspective, the thesis tries to unveil the truth and effect of American identity and European identity of Washington Irving and his tales. The introduction will begin with a brief introduction on Irving's life experience and literary career. In Chapter One, through exploring the historical backgrounds of American identity and European identity, defines the American identity as a self-realization as an intellectually independent American citizen; the European identity as a derivative of the European cultural heritage. Chapter Two focuses on the traces of identities, particularly on the conflicts and mergence emerged between American identity and European identity. The first section attempts to analyze the conflicts happened between the newcomers and the country folks, in order to reveal the root of the conflicts. By analyzing the rural community life, education reform and migration movement, the second section tries to unveil the American social realities at the first half of 19th century through two symbolic buildings, tavern and the school house, in the Dutch village. Chapter Three focuses on the derivative of American identity and European identity. By analyzing Washington Irving's life experience and literary career, the author takes Irving himself and nostalgia as the fruit of American identity and European identity. The first section deals with some critical phases in Irving's life experience. By analyzing Irving's boyhood education and his visits to Europe at manhood, the author tries to reveal the American identity and European identity of Irving's through their respective presentation. The second section focuses on nostalgia, a specific psychological appreciation to the past. The author characterizes nostalgia as appreciation and orientation. By illustrating the patriotic Hudson River school and Henry James's 29-year-absense from the United States and, the author tries to prove nostalgia as a positive attitude in worshiping the American untamed beauty and in developing cultural sensitivity. The whole thesis concludes with a summary that American identity and European identity have instructed and are instructing the American people in molding and constructing a more diversified and open-mindedness society. Keywords: American Identity, European Identity, Washington Irving,

Title: On liao chengzhi's united front thought
Abstract: Translation from original language as provided by author Liao Chengzhi(1908-1983)was a Chinese outstanding proletariat social activist and loyal revolutionary fighter. He was an important leader who participated in the formulation and fulfilled Communist Party of China's united front general and specific policies. He was engaged in the Chinese overseas affair for a long time, devoted in the Sino-Japanese friendship enterprise, and made the historical contribution in promoting the unification of the motherland. Through researching and analyzing Liao Chengzhi united front thought, we will excavate his thought's historical value and the practical significance. Besides the introductory remarks and the conclusion, the full text is composed of five parts: The first part mainly analyzes formation of the historic condition of Liao Chengzhi united front thought. First, it is necessary to analyze the rationale which the Liao Chengzhi united front thought forms. Liao Chengzhi was a firm Marxist, and his thought originated from the Marxism basic principle. At the same time, it also couldn't leave the revolution and the construction practice. Second, it is necessary to explore the practical basis which the Liao Chengzhi united front thought forms. In each historical period, the united front presented the different historical characteristics, because it was different in revolutionary and the construction duty. It is the historical frame which the united front thought forms. Finally, it is necessary to explain the subjective condition which Liao Chengzhi united front thought forms. Liao Chengzhi lofty party spirit and outstanding individual moral character casts his "the individuation" thought. It is systematically discussed in the second part that the Liao Chengzhi united front thought of the formation and the developing process. In germination period, Liao Chengzhi accepted the patriotic education and sought China revolution's true belief by practice. In forming time, he took the Marxism theory as the instruction and positively set up the anti-Japanese national united front, the overseas Chinese as emerging force. In development time, In view of the united front duty, it was locked in some questions, such as the general overseas Chinese, Sino-Japanese friendship relations, reunification of the motherland as well as world peace. Liao Chengzhi united front thought obtained the development and enrichment in the broad domain. According to Associate Professor Chen Guowen's viewpoint, who is from Guizhou University humanities institute, it integrates the Sino-Japanese friendship in the united front, namely "Sino-Japanese friendship enterprise united front". In the perfect time, after the baptism of reform and opening-up, his thought of the united front had a beneficial supplement, and formed a complete theoretical system. The important content of the united front is expounded in the third part. It mainly includes four aspects: the Overseas Chinese affair thought, the Sino-Japanese relations, the world peace thought and the reunification of the motherland thought. The Overseas Chinese affair thought includes four aspects, such as, the Overseas Chinese is mother of the revolutionary; the formulation of overseas relations doesn't conform to the Marxism; Chinese education must be specialized and we must lift up the patriotism flag high; The second part includes "the folk advance" and "To promote official by the public", developing the Sino-Japanese trade by the evolution type; The third part includes that Chinese people is very fond of peace and peace is the mass movement; The fourth part includes "the long-term plan, the full use", the regression of Hong Kong in 1997, "not dividing the priority in patriotic" as well as "One country, two systems". These four parts constitute the main body of united front thought It is summarized the essential feature of Liao Chengzhi united front thought. Under the leadership of the Chinese Communist Party, we must insist principle and flexibility; it is necessary to insist the embarking from the national characteristic, breaking the deadlock, and seeking the international cooperation. The Chinese nation and the international trail connection will be realized; we must insist the Marxism Scientific instruction to united front and conform to people's practice activities. The fifth part mainly elaborates the significance of Liao Chengzhi united front thought. Historic importance includes two aspects: providing the strength support to complete the Party's task in various historical period and making the important contributions for enriching party's united front thought; The practical significance includes providing broad mentality for the socialist modernization, the efficient path of impelling the region to be stable, constructing harmonious world and the reality instruction of completing the unification of the

Title: Strategy: A case study of a community college and the dynamic forces at work in its environment
Abstract: Past research on strategic planning has been confined largely to for-profit organizations; there is limited research on the strategic planning of nonprofit, public organizations such as institutions of higher education (IHEs), particularly nonprofit, public community colleges. Seminal scholars on strategy have associated social movements, political and economic conditions, technological advancements, and global competition as dynamic forces at work in the environment that influence strategic planning but neglected to define nor explain how and why these forces influence planning. The purpose of this qualitative case study was to investigate the forces at work in the environment of a nonprofit, public community college. This study reviewed archived documents to gain an understanding of the history and planning of a single case study community college. Individual interviews were conducted of participants with knowledge and experiences about the strategic planning of the case study and the forces, which influence planning. The collected data were analyzed to identify recurring keywords and phrases referring to forces in the environment that influence planning and compared with the references of forces in the environment from seminal scholars to verify the study's results. The results of this study revealed the population, economy, government, accrediting agencies, competition, leadership, and inertia influence the planning of the community college. A limitation of this study was the focus on a single case study and a recommendation for further research was to investigate the planning of other nonprofit, public community colleges and the forces in the environment that influence their strategic planning.

Title: Confinements and liberations: The many faces of the veil
Abstract: This study explored the veil as norm among modern middle and upper-middle-class women, a class that historically had rejected the veil until recently. The study sought to identify the loci of the forces pushing the wearing of the veil. The study is based on the integration of historical analysis with qualitative methods and content analysis. Specifically this research is based on triangulated data from (a) detailed interviews conducted with 65 young Muslim Egyptian women during the summer of 2008, (b) content analysis of 70 sermons delivered by four of the most influential preachers today, and (c) a survey of the history of the veil in Egypt. Findings showed that the veil has become a unique instrument of power employed by several actors at three new and interrelated arenas of struggle. At the social level, women are using the veil to redefine their roles in society. At the political level, they are using various forms of the veil to declare full or partial alliance with counter-hegemonic forces challenging the state’s moral authority and the state’s political liberalization policies that have targeted women. At the global arena of power, women are engaged in a solidarity movement against the West and the forces of globalization. All these tension zones are influenced by new patterns of immigration in the Arab world and by new forms of intraregional globalization fostered by a newly emerging Arab satellite industry. This study was the beginning of research that should continue to investigate through the utilization of novel and more focused integrated methods this particular phenomenon. The struggle to remove the bonds of the West, in particular, invites future research to dissect the many aspects of interregional and intraregional globalization and their impact on religious identities across the world. This research also suggested that the attitudes towards the veil, women, the state, and the West are in a state of flux, requiring the use of novel identity barometers to assess the direction, magnitude, and implications of these changes on the relationships between the West and the Muslim world.

Title: Home-range fidelity and the effect of supplemental feeding on contact rates between white-tailed deer (<i>Odocoileus virginianus</i>) in southern Illinois
Abstract: White-tailed deer ( Odocoileous virginianus ) are an important game animal and provide intrinsic value to many people. However, disease has become of great concern within white-tailed deer populations. Frequency of contract drives the establishment and spread of infectious diseases among susceptible hosts. Supplemental feed provided to increase white-tailed deer survival or create hunting opportunities, as well as bait stations to aid in capture of deer, may increase contact opportunities and disease transfer. My objective was to quantify the effects of bait sites on indirect contact between deer. I examined data from global positioning system (GPS) collars placed on 27 deer near Carbondale, Illinois, USA, from 2002 to 2005. Location data from GPS collars were used to ensure that I quantified contacts between deer in separate social groups, based on the volume of intersection of their spatial utilization distributions and correlation of movements. I matched 35 bait site locations and control sites not containing bait based on local land cover composition. Pairwise indirect contacts (locations <25 m and <30 d apart) between deer were tabulated within a 10, 25, 50, 75, or 100-m buffer around each bait and control site. Indirect contact frequencies between bait and control sites were compared using mixed-model Poisson regression with deer pair as a random-effect variable and bait, joint utilization distribution (JUD), and year as fixed-effect variables. Contact frequencies did not differ significantly (P<0.05) between bait sites and control sites at any buffer distance, implying that small bait piles used to capture deer have minimal effect on contact frequencies. However, the effect of more consistent and greater quantities of food distributed during supplemental feeding programs should be studied further to determine its impact on contact rates and spatial distribution of deer. Understanding the spatial distribution of white-tailed deer is important to implement effective disease and population management within localized areas. The objective of this study was to measure the home-range fidelity of female deer in an exurban deer herd in southern Illinois. I compared location data of 7 deer that had been collected in 2004-2005 and 2008. I used the volume of intersection (VI) and percent of home range overlap to statistically compare the two annual home ranges for each deer. Deer were located used ground-based radiotelemetry and home ranges were characterized using a fixed kernel utilization distribution. Comparing home ranges between years, the mean VI was 0.45 with little variation (range 0.35-0.55). I found the mean percent overlap of 50% isopleths to be 47.1% (range 31.3-71.7%) and the mean overlap of 95% isopleths to be 62.0% (range 44.3-68.6%). My results indicate that female white-tailed deer on our study area showed strong home-range fidelity, which could permit disease and population management by removing deer and reducing local deer densities.

Title: Essays on economic *growth, education, and the distribution of income: A structural analysis for the case of South Africa
Abstract: Since the fall of the Apartheid regime in South Africa in 1994, the democratically elected post-Apartheid governments have engaged in social and economic reforms aimed at improving the welfare of millions of the left outs during that regime, and at enhancing economic growth. Among these reforms, the most important have consisted of achieving structural transformation of the South African economy through technological advancements, improving skills by investing massively in human capital through education and training, reducing income inequality across racial groups through access to programs that facilitate the acquisition of skills by the left outs of the Apartheid regime rather than through massive income redistribution, liberalizing the labor markets and the formation of labor unions, privatizing statal and para-statal corporations and abolishing monopolies in public services, liberalizing trade and capital movements, promoting new investment through tax incentives, promoting private initiative, reducing or at least freezing government expenditures, reducing poverty, and so on. In this dissertation, I analyze the relationship between growth and some aspects of the economy targeted by the aforementioned reforms through two separate essays. In the first essay (Essay 1), I analyze the growth and welfare effects of public spending on education in post-Apartheid South Africa while in the second essay (Essay 2) I investigate the dynamics of income inequality, poverty, and growth in the post-Apartheid South Africa. Starting with Essay 1, since the abolition of its Apartheid regime in 1994, South Africa has launched a massive program of education and training, which has been financed through resources representing annually on average 21% of the national budget, or 7% of GDP. Today, the GDP share of public spending on education is 1.3 times the average of industrialized countries (5.4%) and almost twice that of developing countries (3.9%). In this essay, I simulate fiscal policy experiments to analyze the growth and welfare effects of a reduction in or an elimination of spending on education in a model of endogenous growth with human capital accumulation and policies for the Post Apartheid South African economy. The first and second experiments consist of reducing the GDP share of educational spending to the averages of industrialized and developing countries, respectively; while the third experiment consists of eliminating government spending on the educational sector (a 100% tax reduction). The results of the simulations demonstrate that a reduction in or an elimination of educational spending reduces the long run rates as well as the transition rates of growth, in per capita GDP, the wages of skilled workers, and overall welfare. The effects on the other variables in the economy (physical capital, human capital, labor, consumption, and the interest rate) vary across experiments. However, these growth and welfare effects are small. Turning to Essay 2, I construct a model of growth with heterogeneity in asset holdings and skills and calibrate it to the Post-Apartheid South African economy in order to analyze the dynamics of income distribution, income inequality, poverty, and growth. I find that growth is achieved at all levels of incomes and poverty is totally eliminated by the end of the process, which lasts 73 years (from 1993 to 2065). Furthermore, the economy achieves the overall convergence of incomes to the income of the average consumer in the distribution. Indeed, poor consumers improve their relative positions of in the distribution of wealth as well as in that of income while rich consumers worsen theirs. Next, I combine the results of the heterogeneous model with the microeconomic data (the South Africa’s 1996 October Household Survey) to estimate the distribution of income, and to analyze thoroughly the interaction between growth, income inequality, and poverty. I find that a one percent increase in the rate of growth of income causes on average poverty to drop by 3.7%, using the $2 per day poverty-line, and by 1.3% using the $1 per day poverty-line. Moreover, growth causes overall decline in income inequality but the effect is very small. A one percent-increase in the rate of growth of income results on average in a decline in income inequality of only 0.056% by the Gini coefficient and of 0.11% by the Global Theil Index.

Title: Arouse the conscience—The photography of Alexander Gardner
Abstract: Alexander Gardner is a Scottish photographer best known for his work during the Civil War era. In addition to producing hundreds of his own photographs over the course of his nearly twenty-year career, he oversaw the production of the war's most talented corps of photographers, and he produced the seminal photographically illustrated history of the war, Gardner's Photographic Sketch Book of the War (1866). Although Gardner's photographic production is the most well known of this era, he and his work are also the least understood. Through an exploration of Sketch Book , this dissertation engages the key issues relating to Gardner's biography, his contribution to American photography, his photographic practice, and his treatment of three interrelated topics: the role of African Americans during the war and in its aftermath; the meaning of slavery to the war and its origins; and the war's meaning and its memorialization. Chapter one offers new details of Gardner's life in Scotland and his relationship to radical politics, his exposure to photography, and his life in Washington, D.C. In an outline of the kind of photography and discussions about photography Gardner was exposed to in Europe, this chapter establishes the foundation for his artistic vision. In addition, understanding his interest in reform movements provides key insight into the choices he made as a visual artist and the personal and artistic alliances he cultivated throughout his life. The second chapter argues that the form of Gardner's Sketch Book was inspired by contemporary discussions within the international reform community about travel as a critical practice and new media as a tool to effect social change, and sought to present a visual argument for photographs as visual histories. In chapter three, an extended discussion of an image in Sketch Book demonstrates that Gardner was more sensitive to the African American experience than scholars have previously acknowledged. Chapter four continues a discussion of African Americans in Sketch Book , and argues that the presence of African Americans in the book serves to question the theme of national reconciliation that many scholars have seen as central to the project.
